reviews.name: 821errol
reviews.title: Fabulous views
reviews.comment: This is a fantastic location. The views are worth the walk. Unfortunately Uncle Tom's Trail was closed but the South Rim Trail to Artist Point was great. Definitely make the effort and walk the entire way.

reviews.name: Coco P
reviews.title: One of our Yellowstone favorites
reviews.comment: The view at Artist's Point is especially great for photos. We enjoyed the stairs at Uncle Tom's outlook. We looked at these Falls from every vantage point we could find.

reviews.name: Carolyn C
reviews.title: Colorful Views
reviews.comment: We took a Road Scholars trip to Yellowstone and the Grand Canyon was one of our favorite stops. The colors of the rock were beautiful. It was a perfect month to see the nearby falls.

reviews.name: aperrian
reviews.title: Another Grand!
reviews.comment: Another Grand Canyon ( there is the one in Arizona, but another one in Kauai - Waimea, and in Mexico too ... and GOD knows how many else in the USofA ...) but neat , and clean and with manicured access And rangers everywhere ...

reviews.name: Foxx Boys Adventures
reviews.title: Amazing 😉
reviews.comment: Been to the GC several times in my life and this was the first time here. It is just as beautiful to me. Great place and make sure you get to Artist Point...

reviews.name: Rich L
reviews.title: Grand Canyon / Grand View / Grand Fun !!
reviews.comment: WOW is all you can say... It is truly amazing and a stop that is Not-To-Be-Missed. This is a highlight of the park and you will love it. Recommend

reviews.name: Sheryl T
reviews.title: The colors and the mountains are breathtaking
reviews.comment: I got a little confused about calling this the Grand Canyon, but it is truly a beautiful sight. When you look down you will see water flowing. I loved the oranges and reds in the mountain.

reviews.name: flyfishwoman
reviews.title: A must to see!
reviews.comment: Best thing to see in park. Go early (be there by 9am latest to avoid people & parking jams). Start with south rim to get east sun shining on canyon walls. Then go to north rim which is one-way road south to north (park at Lookout point and walk paved trail to Grandview which is easy short walk with great views along the way).

reviews.name: DaMama4
reviews.title: Amazing Views!
reviews.comment:
Seeing the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was a great stop to walk around and see the amazing views in depths of the canyon. There are many places that you can view the canyon and the waterfall. There are many other picture ups as well. There was only one public bathroom that was very busy.It is a very busy place with parking can be an issue sometimes.
Well worth the stop when touring Yellowstone national Park.

reviews.name: leihtwam
reviews.title: What a site
reviews.comment: Go see Grand Prismatic so amazing and take the hike up the overlook you get a better view. You can see the overlook at Fairy Falls it’s worth it!!!!

reviews.name: Jenny A
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: It’s a must see. I would definitely put this on my priority list. The hike down to the lower falls isn’t worth it if you have bad knees. Yes he view above is spectacular!!!

reviews.name: Renae S
reviews.title: Highlight of trip
reviews.comment: The most beautiful part of Yellowstone! We all agreed Artist point was the ultimate visual treat....awe inspiring!

reviews.name: NCGAMECOCK1
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: One of the highlights of Yellowstone National Park. It is a deep canyon with the Yellowstone River at the bottom. The views around the canyon are breathtaking.

reviews.name: RecreationV
reviews.title: So Many Stunning Sights
reviews.comment: Yellowstone NP is filled with so many stunning, awesome things to see. This is one of them. It is a must-see, add it to the itinerary!

reviews.name: Keith D
reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.comment: The Falls are a must see at Yellowstone, and we recommend the South Rim Trail, at least out to Artist's Point, in order to get the best views. Trail is about a mile and a half each way, and shaded in the mornings, so it's not a bad hike, with only a few steep sections. The North Rim is more an auto tour, with multiple pullouts along the way.

reviews.name: kpinphilly_again
reviews.title: This is the view that inspired the national park system
reviews.comment:
After spending time in the Grand Canyon (AZ), every other state's "grand canyon" can be less than awesome. But not this one. We were totally surprised by the size - depth, width, length - of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone.
We sat through an interesting, but brief, Ranger talk at Artist's Point, and then spent a good hour enjoying the view from that area. This is the view that Thomas Moran painted in 1871 and which became part of the inspiration for Congress to create the first national park in the world, and for President Grant to sign the bill into law.
We also took it in from Lookout Point and Grand View - totally worth taking in both the South Rim and North Rim drives.

reviews.name: Ken18
reviews.title: Majestic views
reviews.comment: Visit the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and view the Upper and Lower Falls for great views. Make sure to visit both the North and South Rim.

reviews.name: Donna E
reviews.title: Unexpectedly gorgeous
reviews.comment: We have visited our fair share of national parks, so we did not expect to be so surprised by the beauty and uniqueness of this small canyon. It is so special! We took the long trail loop that starts near the picnic area by the bridge, walked through a field then a forested area, past several steaming mud flats and ponds/lakes, to Artist's Point for a ranger talk about the canyon. We then continued on the South Canyon Rim Trail to take in the views of the Lower Falls then the Upper Falls. Unforgettable!

reviews.name: Gdax
reviews.title: North and South Rims
reviews.comment: Beautiful waterfalls decorate this canyon. There are multiple viewpoints along the North and South Rim. Personally enjoyed Artist Point at the South Rim the best. We were here during the middle of the day which is fairly busy and always found parking spots.

reviews.name: SDtravel G
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!
reviews.comment: We enjoyed seeing the beautiful iconic yellow stone and waterfalls. It was simply breathtaking and the kids did well on the hike from the south rim toward Uncle Tom's.

reviews.name: MamaCip75
reviews.title: Worth the stop!
reviews.comment: There are several areas to stop and park at to view the canyon. We chose to stop and take a short hike to Artist’s Point at the Lower Falls. For me, it was the most gorgeous part of the park as it lives up to its name! Plenty of parking with restrooms on site. The falls and the Yellowstone River are highly visible here as the river then runs through the canyon. Simply breathtaking!

reviews.name: Pam W
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment: Take the hike to artist point. It’s an easy hike and well worth the views. Also make the trek to the lower falls overlook. This is a steep hike down with MANY switchbacks but to see the falls from this angle is well worth it. It’s suitable for children but adults but it is strenuous

reviews.name: Rawa13
reviews.title: Lives up to the Grand Canyon comparison
reviews.comment: Usually, comparison to a world-famous attraction ends up being a disappointing experience but not in this case. This is a must-visit attraction in YP.

reviews.name: EJRTRIP
reviews.title: Wish I would have walked down
reviews.comment: It is an impressive site. We probably missed the best vantage point because of the construction signs leading us to the north side. However we still got wonderful pictures. We didn’t walk to the bottom because it was cold and raining.

reviews.name: 639jane
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: Be ready for steep walk to brink of falls but well worth the climb.. all views of canyon amazing ... every direction you look is beautiful

reviews.name: gazooby
reviews.title: The Falls gets a 5+, the park maintenance budget gets a 2: CALL CONGRESS!
reviews.comment: Of course the Falls are spectacular, and the hikes down to overlooks are steep but worth the exertion. I choose to write instead about the maintenance issues. I have posted some photos of broken fencing, trails that were closed off due to safety issues, and other maintenance problems. This is the fault of Congress, not the National Parks Service, which has a $12 billion maintenance backlog. If you love your national parks, call your member of Congress and complain about their underfunding of parks. It matters here, where the only thing keeping your precious child from falling over a sheer cliff is a broken fence. Of course your other choice is to pay $50 instead of $35 at the gate next year, but that doesn't seem very American....

reviews.name: TheEdgeNYC
reviews.title: Phenomenal scenery
reviews.comment: Visited the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone during a trip in early June. Pictures, or words, cannot describe the scenery. One really needs to come here for themselves to see firsthand what this area has to offer.

reviews.name: Ppoupore
reviews.title: Beautiful nature
reviews.comment: The view of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was truly beautiful and quite amazing. Parking was a problem due to large numbers of vehicles in the parking area provided.

reviews.name: Stephenbkk20156
reviews.title: Most spectacular natural feature ever
reviews.comment:
I wasn't ready for this. My wife had suggested Yellowstone as a destination and I knew it was going to be impressive, but I had no idea what kind of things we were going to find there. So, the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was a total surprise.
We saw it on the map, but didn't really take it seriously. Even when we parked the car and followed the clear signposts: it looked like a river carving its own little canyon. But when we stood on the lip of that canyon and looked down at the river and the sulphur deposits that decorated the sides of the enormous canyon! Grand Canyon is no exaggeration. This place is absolutely spectacular. We just couldn't get enough of it.
Well-marked trails. Safe and well-chosen viewpoints. It was all aid out for us. But we didn't even mind the crowds. Glimpses of coloured deposits turned into dazzling, dramatic canyon views as we made our way through the surrounding trees.
We lingered longer than we expected. It never got old.

reviews.name: Brian M
reviews.title: Worth doing
reviews.comment: The views are exceedingly good and the driving is not too strenuous. We saw a small bear that had created a massive traffic jam but it is not always that you find a bear walking without a care in the world in the Park.

reviews.name: Brian W
reviews.title: Simply breath taking
reviews.comment: If you spend 1 day in Yellowstone you have to see the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. It is superb!

reviews.name: NatParkHikerJess
reviews.title: Stunning is an understatement
reviews.comment: This was one of my favorite places in Yellowstone. Seeing the canyon and the waterfalls is simply stunning. Arrive here early or explore in the evening to get gorgeous lighting and escape the crowds. You can park and do short walks out to viewpoints or go for longer hikes--totally up to you! We came here early AM and also came back to Artist Point for sunset and enjoyed both experiences equally.

reviews.name: AirRiedle1
reviews.title: Nice Canyon
reviews.comment: If you have seen other canyons in other Nationalpark you wont regret to have walked the way down to the waterfall. Very nice spot for amazing pictures and Insta stories.

reviews.name: 2rollon
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This canyon and waterfall is spectacular. It’s a must stop for everyone coming to Yellowstone. You can view it from a distance or walk down to the brink of the lower falls and stand on a platform right where the rushing water falls over the edge. Fantastic!!

reviews.name: Austin G
reviews.title: Hike the southern rim!
reviews.comment: The southern rim trail was an unexpected find. It’s a little long but gorgeous. It ends at artist point so if you have two cars leave one there.

reviews.name: Chad
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: There is a lot of great views in this canyon but extremely busy in July. I recommend getting here early so you don’t have to deal with the parking issues.

reviews.name: Marge C
reviews.title: South rim trail
reviews.comment: Beautiful scenery, including water falls and variety colored cliffs. Nice trail, some steep inclines. Worth the work.

reviews.name: luv2dive51
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: There were many spots to visit the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. There is construction in the area as of July 2019 and some backups but never had to wait more than 10 minutes

reviews.name: Sanjay B
reviews.title: Colorful Canyon
reviews.comment: It is Grand because it is colorful -red,yellow,ivory,white,some what green stones with deep green water , it is Grand because it’s deep, it’s grand as it is long, it’s grand because it give astounding feeling, it has 3 falls, but most popular is lower falls, which gives scenic view from very close & afar. It is nearly 4000 ft wide and more than 1000 ft deep and 20 miles long.its total view is breathtaking. Must see👌

reviews.name: Jill D
reviews.title: Your eyes need a rest after this travel.
reviews.comment: Take your time as you drive around and enjoy this incredible view. The Yellowstone Grand Canyon is only one of the incredible items to see and enjoy at this National Treasure.

reviews.name: MdTravelerX2
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: If you just visit Old Faithful and don't see the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, you've missed over half the experience of Yellowstone. Incredible scenery. Good talking trails. Several good hiking trails. A "must see."

reviews.name: luvchevys21
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Such wonderful views. Very windy but the canyon and river are picture perfect. East walking trails. Kids also loved the benches built into the rocks

reviews.name: GRS-SJS
reviews.title: Amazing views, colors and falls
reviews.comment: I really didn't know about this section of the park. Amazing spot, great overlooks and trails along the rim. Take time to enjoy all the sights along this drive.

reviews.name: amber w
reviews.title: Must See!!
reviews.comment: Do yourself a favor and view this Grand Canyon!! It is breathtaking!! The long distance view of the waterfall is awesome.

reviews.name: Beth H
reviews.title: So Beautiful it Looks Fake
reviews.comment:
I was looking forward to seeing this area, after reading the reviews on it. I was a little worried that my expectations were too high. I felt like it looked fake in everyone's pictures. I can now say, it met and exceeded my expectations! It is so beautiful that it does look fake.
We drove both the north and south rim to see the different viewpoints. We got to the north rim first, which the ranger said will get more backed up as the day goes on. We didn't have any trouble finding parking, and we were there around 8:30 am. We hiked the trail to the Brink of the Lower Falls and the Red Rock Trail. Both were beautiful and worth it.
The Brink of the Upper Falls and Uncle Tom's Trail was closed when we were here on June 25.
We did drive on the South Rim Road to Artist's Point is a must as well. This area is very awe-inspiring.

reviews.name: Cefleetwood
reviews.title: Breathtaking!!
reviews.comment: Lower falls hike is a great way to see the Grand Canyon! I highly recommend the artist point trail, stunning views! It’s a must do in Yellowstone

reviews.name: DWNBRHM
reviews.title: not to the same scale as the grand canyon
reviews.comment: but i think just as stunning due to the large waterfalls that you can get quite close to. plenty of great walks and photo hot spots to look back on with awe!

reviews.name: msquared023
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Gorgeous views of the colorful canyon walls, a waterfall, and the river that cuts through the canyon. Worth a stop!

reviews.name: Geoff_Lee-Anne
reviews.title: Not the same as the Grand Canyon, But still Great
reviews.comment: An amazing site, look out for mountain (Bighorn) sheep along the cliffs. It is really Quite spectacular.

reviews.name: RAVI11
reviews.title: End May Visit 2019
reviews.comment: great place to see. Walk around and see spy the points ear marked for good views. We also saw Nest onto of peaks. Amazing colours of nature

reviews.name: BusabaS
reviews.title: Upper Falls, Artist Points, Inspiration Point, many more
reviews.comment: They are located in the northeast of Yellowstone National Park. There are many point to stop along the way and around the areas. I like the Inspiration Point because there was no tour bus, only few cars, and it’s beautiful.

reviews.name: RobintheWriter
reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.comment: Definately worth seeing! Beautiful waterfalls and rock formations. I have yet to hike here - but it looks fantastic.

reviews.name: Lcbluize
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: Beauty all around. We took a private tour with EcoTours of Wyoming. Our guide, Sarah, took us to many places in the park, and we ended our tour here. It was so beautiful. Awesome and powerful. A must see.

reviews.name: Mike H
reviews.title: Do not miss the Canyon
reviews.comment: Mind blown. Do not really need to say more than this but need 100 words to post. Somehow had missed the Canyon on a previous trip. It is a must. The pictures do not do justice to the beauty of this place.

reviews.name: Dianna N
reviews.title: Best Views Ever
reviews.comment: This was definitely worth the drive. We took the trail hike down to see the lower falls and were not disappointed. We also drove around to the other side and loved the views. The water level was too high for the staircase to be open.

reviews.name: sspeidel12
reviews.title: Nature calls
reviews.comment: Man could not come close to creating such beautiful vistas as this. The walls of the canyon are colorful and vary from rock to fragile Yellowstone to tree covered. There are various outlook points on both the south and north rims, all worth seeing and hiking (steps and switch back down 200 - 600 ft at some points).

reviews.name: May F
reviews.title: High cliffs with a grand view
reviews.comment: The place has many hiking trails. The cliffs are very high and you should always watch your kids to prevent any accidents. There are 2 falls upper and lower falls. You can spend many hours just exploring the place.

reviews.name: Ken S
reviews.title: Beauty
reviews.comment: Georgeous place. Can't believe how lucky I was to have experienced this beautiful place and had an amazing guide ... Stephen

reviews.name: Elaine8675309
reviews.title: one of my favorite parts of the park
reviews.comment: i always return to this spot for every visit It is just too amaing with waterfall and the the canyons

reviews.name: TravelGlo4
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: In addition to viewing the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, you need to check out the Lower Falls. Just beautiful!

reviews.name: Csearles
reviews.title: Beautiful but crowded
reviews.comment: This is a must see attraction in Yellowstone. If you can hit it earlier in the morning. When we got there mid afternoon the tour buses were in full force and so were all the tourists. It was a challenge to get a good spot to grab a few pics. Even with all that do not pass this up on your Yellowstone visit.

reviews.name: Jerome B
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was amazing, even in the last days of winter (we were there in May, but there was still a lot of snow on the ground and snow banks on the road to the view points). I was surprised as I hadn't done my homework; deep gorge, beautiful views. An amazing place among many in the Park.

reviews.name: CarisseB
reviews.title: My favorite spot the whole day at Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The canyon was surprising to me. I really did not expect it to be so amazing. I was most disappointed that we did not give ourselves enough time at that spot. I would have really liked to have hiked down to the lower falls. Some others coming up from the hike said it was beautiful and well worth it.

reviews.name: william m
reviews.title: Another must see
reviews.comment: This is another spot to include when you are doing the Grand Canyon. Again, parking can be a little problematic, so it might be good to go later in the day or earlier in the day if you are staying in the park.

reviews.name: TeriPugh
reviews.title: One of my favorite viewpoints
reviews.comment: This is such a beautiful location. Get out and walk around at each pull out. Inspiration point is breathtaking. We were blessed with great weather. Sunny and cool. A feast for the eyes and senses. Take pictures but stop and just look around with your eyes and listen with your ears. It’s all so magical. We are blessed to live in such a beautiful country!

reviews.name: kmacmoo
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: Lots of RV parking and car parking. There are 2 parking lots. Busy place so be patient, it’s worth the visit to see this beautiful sight!! Bathrooms in parking lot.

reviews.name: Mr Edav27
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Wonderful views of the upper and the lower falls of the Yellowstone River. Followed the South Rim trail and there many great photo opportunities.

reviews.name: mewalko5
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Many stops along south and north rims, upper falls and a few trails were closed for repairs. Scenery was unbelievable. Lots of stops along the way for restrooms and photo ops. Some walking to get to views, and other longer trails available

reviews.name: dheffne
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: The views were wonderful. We went end of June , it was not crowded. It was cool but comfortable if you bring some warm clothes. I don't like the cold and I was fine. No problem finding parking. Lots of different view points you could visit even if you are not in shape to hike. My favorite part of yellowstone other than my love of hiking. . The river is full and fast due to the Spring snow melt.

reviews.name: rich65k
reviews.title: Great scenery
reviews.comment: Nothing compared to the Grand Canyon but magnificent nonetheless. Stop here to see some wonderful scenery.

reviews.name: Glen H
reviews.title: Great place to view amazing geology
reviews.comment: One of the many beautiful places in Yellowstone. We loved the views and wonderment of this place. The fall was delightful.

reviews.name: Nick
reviews.title: Amazing attraction at Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: Both the lower rim drive and uppper rim drive provide amazing views of the Canyon. This was a highlight of the trip.

reviews.name: K H
reviews.title: Beautiful steep crowded
reviews.comment: Worth a look even a hike. Central in park we found ourselves stopping several times on our way to and from lake, horseback riding, camping nearby.

reviews.name: architect1013
reviews.title: As spectacular as ever!
reviews.comment: Such a wonderful area. You'll love the sights and you'll love the wildlife. Lots to do and see. Spend some time and enjoy.

reviews.name: Ben T
reviews.title: Amazing views of waterfalls
reviews.comment: This canyon is located along the main road in Yellowstone on the east side of the park. There are two drives one on the north side of the canyon and one on the south side. The road along the north side is one way and loops back to the canyon visitor center. The views of the huge waterfall is amazing. There are trails or stairs that take you down to see the falls from close to river level but it is a long hard trip back to the parking area. The first stop at brink of the lower falls is one of the best views. Inspiration Point is the last stop on the north rim drive and the view from there is fantastic. All of the overlooks are well worth the time but the first and last to me are best. This drive can be very crowded and there may be waits to find a parking spot. If you can get there early in the day you will have less issues. The south rim drive is a road in and the same path back out. There are several overviews to view the upper falls and all are great. The last is artist point and it to me is the best view. All overviews are an easy walk from the parking. I did not expect the canyon to be one of my favorite things in the park but it was. Don’t miss it.

reviews.name: Eva C
reviews.title: Perfecf
reviews.comment: This was so amazing! One of my favorite Yellowstone sights!! The waterfall, hikes, and the view at sunset is beyond gorgeous. Don’t miss out on this if you go to Yellowstone!

reviews.name: John S
reviews.title: A second Grand Canyon?
reviews.comment: I had never heard of any other Grand Canyon besides the one in Arizona. This is isn't as long or as deep, but in many ways, it is just as majestic. We saw it from the south rim close to the Lower Falls and fell in love with it, considering it to be one of the best attractions in the entire park.

reviews.name: Gottasetheworld
reviews.title: Day 3 in this park and our FAVORITE, by far
reviews.comment: Wow! This eastern part of the park is so different from the geysers and basins and we loved it! Some of us took the hike down to the head of the falls; others went halfway (it was extremely steep going down) and one chose to forego it altogether. But there are plenty of vista points to view it even if you don't want to hike it. Inspiration Point was a great place to do that- on a one-way road that allows parking and great photo ops.

reviews.name: Paul H
reviews.title: Spent two weeks in area
reviews.comment:
Spent two weeks travelling area and appreciate all that we saw.
Grand. Canyon area was especially good to see . So much you need this time . Road blocked with animals on road including. Bison . Car parks can be very busy even when we were in June.
Shudder to think what they might be like in very busy times
Well worth all the trouble and strife getting around once in a lifetime experience All staff we came in contact with were very helpful including Rangers .

reviews.name: TXMARTINS
reviews.title: The best of Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: Probably our favorite part of Yellowstone! The Grand Canyon area of Yellowstone is stunning & both the views of the Upper & Lower Falls are just spectacular. More parking is available than what you will find at many area in Yellowstone. Make sure this is on your list!

reviews.name: wicomet
reviews.title: Rivals the Grand Canyon (AZ)
reviews.comment: Arrive at the north rim by 8AM to avoid the rush, and be sure to hike down to the numerous falls viewpoints. Each hike is about 30 minutes round trip.

reviews.name: Kathy S
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: Beautiful area. Two rims to visit. Some construction so some areas closed. Go early and beat the traffic. Parking can be limited.

reviews.name: kunfushuss
reviews.title: Beautiful, with some nice hikes
reviews.comment: This was one of the coolest places in Yellowstone, with two waterfalls and a canyon reminiscent of the grand canyon in Arizona. We took a hike on the north rim, which was just a walk, but more or less straight up and down using a path with many switchbacks. The view at the bottom - right next to the waterfall - was awesome. There are overlooks that are much more accessible too though. And much more crowded.

reviews.name: Colona1988
reviews.title: Every cloud or bit of sun shows different colors in the rocks
reviews.comment: This has become a necessary stop on all our trips to Yellowstone. The light on the canyon walls is incredibly beautiful.

reviews.name: GustinB
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Obviously a must see stop. Take a pic. Enjoy the scenery. All of yellowstone was beautiful and this is up there.

reviews.name: 1funnygirljj
reviews.title: Artistic Point-Beautiful
reviews.comment: Hiked over to Artistic Point, Waterfalls and canyon are beautiful! There is also a parking lot for those who are driving over and then an easy walk to Artistic Point from there. Not ADA friendly, just too rough a trail. But the overlook to the falls I would say is ADA. I was with a hiking group and we came in from another trail. Beautiful views!

reviews.name: JayB1r
reviews.title: Fear of heights fully realized
reviews.comment: With the many different overlooks, I was able to get a full view of rage Canyon even with my bum knee. If you are mobile, you can even get better views. The falls are fantastic. The canyon’s history is well covered in the signs. This is a must see. It may not be the Grand Canyon or Niagara Falls, but it is still one of America’s best

reviews.name: Liz H
reviews.title: This was well worth a long drive
reviews.comment: Couldn’t believe just how beautiful and amazing this place was, viewed from several different stops and is awe inspiring. Almost a tearful moment. Definitely one I won’t forget.

reviews.name: Travelingourworldwithck
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: If you have the chance to see this park, please don’t hesitate, it is absolutely beautiful and there is so much to see

reviews.name: Jane S
reviews.title: Not the real Grand Canyon but still beautiful.
reviews.comment: The rock formations are amazing and the colors you see are spectacular. Not the size or magnificence of the Arizona Grand Canyon but still well worth your time.

reviews.name: Misty R
reviews.title: Must do
reviews.comment: This is a definite must fir everyone. It's one of my favorite places in Yellowstone. It was snowing when we visited, amazing!

reviews.name: torid840
reviews.title: Awestruck
reviews.comment: This is one thing to put on your must see list in Yellowstone. Its amazing. Im not sure if I’ve ever seen so many colors in one area, very surreal.

reviews.name: Mid
reviews.title: Falls
reviews.comment: Get here early must do the Lower Falls Brink trail, though a bit of a hike back up. Uncle Toms Trail was closed again 3 years in a row this thing has been closed.

reviews.name: SusanRVer
reviews.title: Unbelievable!
reviews.comment: So beautiful. A must see! Yellowstone is huge andxwe did the best we could to see most of it..we were coming back from mammoth hot springs and decided to do the 12 mile drive to the grand canyon..so worth it!! Even ran into a Buffalo traffic jam lol!

reviews.name: mehtkx
reviews.title: More beautiful in person
reviews.comment:
See from as many angles as possible.
We worth doing the short hikes to the brink of the falls and also to the bottom.
Top sight in Yellowstone

reviews.name: pasweet
reviews.title: Yellowstone gem
reviews.comment: There are many ways to experience this natural feature and your choice will influence how much you enjoy it. Both the north and south rim drives are worth doing as they provide a variety of overlooks to see both the canyon and the upper and lower falls. The problem is the popularity of these drives and overlooks means it can be very difficult to get parking Patience and advance planning(come early) reduce the problems. We went on s short hike from the artist point parking lot along the rim of the canyon which was a great way to really see the colors of the canyon. This is not to be missed

reviews.name: Susan P
reviews.title: Easy visit in a car
reviews.comment: Easy visit in a car . Stunning view from Artist point . Some of the trails were closed due to repair work

reviews.name: travellerfromatown
reviews.title: Better than the Grand Canyon?
reviews.comment: I kinda think so. Stunning colors, amazing waterfalls. Artists point — I would love to go there everyday! Personally though, I don’t think the hike to the brink of the falls is worthwhile.

reviews.name: Tarielovena
reviews.title: A must visit
reviews.comment: Out of all the wonderful things Yellowstone offers Artist Point is definitely our favorite stop. It offers some of the most picturesque views. Both times we’ve been there, June and September, we have had no problems with parking since we got there around 4-5 and there was parking a plenty. Lookout Point has its own charms as well and a lot of elk wonder around there.

reviews.name: juvemeister
reviews.title: Wonderful Colors & Topographic Beauty
reviews.comment: I kept reading about how this place resembled a mini-Grand Canyon, and it really does in many ways. Think we drove through the viewing area on the North side of the canyon (upper) closest to the lodge. Plenty of vehicles, and in fact, parking was at a premium. Thus, 4 stars instead of 5. We enjoyed the various viewpoints that line the parking area, and worked our way all along it. Because the wife was still recuperating from a foot operation, we did not trudge very far down any trails, but we did fine at the viewpoints, some of which have stairways that take you down to overlooks that seem to be right on top of the canyon. It's fun looking at the falls from a distance and watching the way the river churns through the canyon. Loved the canyon and the crevices and precipices, and it was even fun watching folks on the other side of the canyon. But you had better bring binoculars if you really want to savor the details. A hailstorm eventually drove us back to our car and the safety of the cocktail lounge in the village. So there's that, too! Great to have a martini waiting nearby.

reviews.name: Joseph Robba
reviews.title: If you do one thing at Yellowstone, this should be it
reviews.comment: The views of the Grand Canyon are simply amazing. Artist Point is the best place to take it all in. After a jam-packed couple of days at Yellowstone, this was my favorite part by far.

reviews.name: Intlxpatr
reviews.title: Classic Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Some of the most iconic views of Yellowstone at your fingertips. The North Rim is best for hikes (IMHO) and Uncle Tom's Trail gets you up close and personal. All the hikes are worth the effort. On the South Rim, there are short walks to viewpoints, fabulous views without paying the price of the steep hikes back up. Something for the fit, and also for the not-so-fit.

reviews.name: Jan A
reviews.title: Wow this spot is great!
reviews.comment: This site is surprisingly majestic and stunning. In some ways I enjoyed it as much or more than the Grand Canyon of the Colorado. The colors change as the sun moves along the canyon. It is just amazing to watch and a pleasure to enjoy.

reviews.name: brandy621
reviews.title: Not for the faint of heart!
reviews.comment: The trek down to the observation platforms is quite the trek - especially back up. I can see this being a problem for those who are out of shape or the elderly. I'm not even sure how many switchbacks there are - but there are A LOT and it's all up hill...pretty steep. It takes you down to an upper observation platform and then a lower one that is right next to the raging river and the falls. You are definitely rewarded with some amazing sites if you make it down there. The amazing power of the river and the falls right there at your fingertips and then the majestic views that look more like a painting then real life. It's definitely worth a visit if you are near but be warned that it is NOT an easy walk back up.

reviews.name: mom98wmu
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: Our time was short and we considered skipping this area...DON'T...It was very beautiful and well worth visiting.

reviews.name: igolfCA
reviews.title: Very impressive!
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was more impressive than I thought it would be. It’s a short walk to the main overlook, and from there you can see both the waterfall and the canyon. There are several trails to hike if you are interested.
At the overlook, there was a park ranger who was very helpful and interesting. She told us about the Osprey pair that had a nest in the canyon. In fact, we saw them and the nest, but she said there were no eggs this year. Enjoyed this stop and would highly recommend!

reviews.name: Neemr22
reviews.title: Awe inspiring
reviews.comment: When I first hear Grand Canyon, I thought sure. But once I saw the combination of waterfall and canyon I changed my mind. I does live up to it's name.

reviews.name: Mindy P
reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.comment: Even in the rain and hail (twice!) this place is too beautiful to miss! There are so many different viewpoints it’s worth more than one stop.

reviews.name: RobinCord24
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Must see! Don’t skip this amazing feature of Yellowstone!!!! We did the Lower Brinks hike and the bottom view is great.

reviews.name: MnFox
reviews.title: Must stop site while at Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Just another great contrast in the environment of this park. The GC of Yellowstone truly is a unique experience. Don't just rely on the high level overlook to experience this portion of the park. Take the path to the falls overlook and other less traveled areas. Some are a little more strenuous than others, but well worth the effort.

reviews.name: Sharon R
reviews.title: impressive!
reviews.comment:
anything you get to see of this magnitude is worth the time. Try and visit on a weekday or early morning for less congestion.
Love our National Park!

reviews.name: Rodney P
reviews.title: Yellowstone 2019
reviews.comment: There are several viewing points on either side of the canyon. Artist Point is the best and best known so expect crowds. Parking is pretty good, but restrooms are limited so expect long lines. We stayed at Lake Lodge the first night in the park and did the wile east side in one day - the canyon is on the east side above fishing bridge and the road to Cody. The canyon has to be one of your “must see” stops in the park.

reviews.name: Tarakerry
reviews.title: absolutely magnificent
reviews.comment: Beautiful canyon plus waterfall. Trails are nicely structured to that it is a joy to experience the whole canyon.

reviews.name: ASH814
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: This is the canyon that a member of our party was anxious to see. It is breathtaking and a sight to behold.

reviews.name: Paula S
reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.comment: There aren’t words to describe the beauty of this stop in the Canyon area of Yellowstone. It can get busy with busses, but we were always able to get a spot for a great picture. We did the hike to the brink of the lower falls, which was great. It’s 600 feet down, which means, 600 feet straight up! It can be taxing, but well worth the effort!

reviews.name: Warmhiker
reviews.title: Simply beautifual
reviews.comment: Worth the overlook. Really pretty and a great view of the water. It's so serene and you're up pretty high, but definitely worth the visit. The Canyon area is our favorite - worth the drive!

reviews.name: David Walker
reviews.title: A truly Grand Canyon for sure.
reviews.comment: This is a truly amazing wonder of nature and one of the most beautiful waterfalls you will ever see (Lower Falls, that is) and one of many wonders of Yellowstone. I’m however dropping one star due to practicalities - disappointment that several of the trails (including the Uncle Tom Steps) going into the high season are out of use, and also the parking (on the North Rim) - even in early June - is difficult, so goodness knows what it will be like in July/August. Maybe they have more elaborate controls in operation when its busy but if not be prepared to go very early in the day, or take a longish walk down from the Canyon Village (or elsewhere) to avoid the car parks.

reviews.name: Jane S
reviews.title: More colorful
reviews.comment: It IS so much more colorful and glamorous than the Grand Canyon due to the fact it's not as deep, which allows ou to see so much more along the river and also the waterfall is fantastic. Be sure to take a hike all the way down to the waterfall, a special place.

reviews.name: Patricia B
reviews.title: Amazing view
reviews.comment: Went in early May which meant less of a crowd. Beautiful view and a great place to take a group photo!

reviews.name: Judy O
reviews.title: Dramatic views
reviews.comment: Unusual rock formations, great view of the valley created by the movement of the earth. The different colors of the different layers of earth were striking.

reviews.name: c n
reviews.title: So many different ways to see the canyon, take your pick based on skill level.
reviews.comment: There are many different trails to see the canyon and falls so pick one that matches how far you want to walk and how steep a trail you can handle. Be prepared for huge tour buses full of foreign tourists who hog the best spots on overlooks for selfies. Just be patient and wait your turn. It's worth it. Or you can take a trail that is not popular with the bus crowd like The Brink.

reviews.name: James B
reviews.title: Incredible views
reviews.comment: The hike down to see both falls is well worth it. Just be advised you are at high altitude and it may be difficult to catch your breat coming up.

reviews.name: S L
reviews.title: Amazing surprise, even if you have seen the Grand Canyon (Az)
reviews.comment: Just walking up to the lookout provides and breathtaking view of the waterfalls. Hike further up the trail towards Sublime Point to see an amazing array of colors

reviews.name: Don P
reviews.title: Always great to view
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is always great to view, I never get tired of it. This is one of the must see sites when visiting Yellowstone. Be sure not to miss it.

reviews.name: Greeneyedteacher
reviews.title: Superb, must see
reviews.comment: We saw the canyon from the north and south viewpoints and it was gorgeous. The hike to the brink of the lower falls was steep, but put you in the “brink.”

reviews.name: JohnCamp81
reviews.title: Simply Awesome
reviews.comment: Mother Nature has provided a wonderful environment with beautiful scenery. The National Park Service has provided easy access and ideal viewing stations. This is a must see if going to Yellowstone. Like all the sights there, this one fills up quickly as the tourist season gets into full swing. I'd recommend an early spring or late fall visit but whenever you visit, you can't beat the views.

reviews.name: sky9696
reviews.title: All the awe of Grand Canyon, Just a Little Smaller
reviews.comment: Loved our visit to the GCOY. We hiked down to the waterfall and visited both sides of the canyon. Highly recommend for awe inspiring views.

reviews.name: denise b
reviews.title: Stunning view
reviews.comment: The hike was short and steep but within the capabilities of my 77 yr old decently fit husband. One of the best views in the park.

reviews.name: Kathy P
reviews.title: Simply Beautiful and Breathtaking
reviews.comment: The views are stunning. It is amazing to stand and gaze out into the distance. The trip is worth it and it is a little crowded. Take time to listen to the park rangers

reviews.name: jeremy s
reviews.title: Magnificent but beware vertigo
reviews.comment: Spelling binding views. Check which observations points are open early in the season as the snow stays late.

reviews.name: Helen C
reviews.title: Avoid rainy days
reviews.comment: Views from both the North and South Rims are a must see. The walks to the lookout points are short and well-paved. Try to avoid rainy days. We went on Memorial Day and there were lines of cars when an animal is spotted. This area is high altitude with narrow lanes in some places.

reviews.name: The5MRanch
reviews.title: Amazing Canyon!
reviews.comment: Both rims are amazing views, but I think the south rim has better views of the falls, do if you have limited time, I would do that side.

reviews.name: Denise E
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Don’t miss the north and south rim drives. Worth it. Awe inspiring! We even saw egrets nesting on rocks.

reviews.name: Carol A
reviews.title: A must-see
reviews.comment: If you had only one thing you could see in all of YNP, this would be the place. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a breathtaking, amazing place. While the Upper Falls is impressive, the Lower Falls of the canyon is the real show-stealer. The sheer size of the Lower Falls, the pounding river and the colorful painted canyon walls combine to create an unforgettable picture. Artist’s point and the North Rim Drive are both excellent viewing points. For those who want a closer view and a challenge, tale the 300+ staircase in Uncle Tom’s Trail to get a closer look at the lower Falls.

reviews.name: Nick B
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Worth a stop, but not nearly as Grand as advertised. It was snowing the day we were there. so limited visibility may make my review more harsh than on a bright, clear, warmer day.

reviews.name: Dan O
reviews.title: Very pretty
reviews.comment: The views of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone were phenomenal. The colors here are vastly different than anywhere else in the park.

reviews.name: m00nbeem
reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.comment: Beautiful vistas. Educational. Animals galore. Very easy to navigate. For all ages. Hard to explain unless you see it for yourself.

reviews.name: Ivette N
reviews.title: Magnificent
reviews.comment: Something to be seen. Absolutely breathtaking. Just stand near the edge of the over hang made me nervous to look down. So I used my selfie stick to take my pictures and it was a good choice. There are different levels of viewing the canyon so every photo is amazing. When, one comes up to the over hang to see the falls the sound is overwhelming. Remember all photos were by a selfie stick.

reviews.name: mbywaterrn
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Beautiful! Worth the drive along the Great Loop at Canyon Village, so much to look at and take in and there are just so many gorgeous vistas along the route.

reviews.name: Nick
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
It is amazing place on earth.
There are 2 best spots to view.
The water fall and the canyon looks amazing

reviews.name: paws0810
reviews.title: Vacation
reviews.comment: We got into town on this side of the park on Friday, May 10 when the roads opened. Most every little nook and cranny was closed but they did have several viewing spots open

reviews.name: Dave C
reviews.title: Colder than hell, but worth it.
reviews.comment: We showed up on a day it was snowing lightly and when we walked out to the points to get better views, the wind was downright frigid. But, we were dressed for the occasion, so we still enjoyed the views.

reviews.name: Rebel60
reviews.title: Awesome view
reviews.comment: Stopped to view this point of interest. Very beautiful. Other places to see in this area are the Upper falls and Lower falls.

reviews.name: Motivator535
reviews.title: Grand canyon creates grand views
reviews.comment:
This is a perfect spot to take a family photo for your Christmas card, we did. Both the upper and lower views are spectacular, but you need to plan on extra time and clothing layers if you are going home to the bottom.
Well worth the time and a must see why you are making the Grand loop in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Little Mama
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The hike was perfect for me and my young boys!! The waterfall and scenery was absolutely beautiful!!

reviews.name: RustyWater
reviews.title: Amazing and Stunning Views
reviews.comment: This place is Amazing, the overlooks at the Water Falls are a must see. You have to be here to appreciate the beauty, ruggedness and the power of nature. Unfortunately several of the areas and trails were closed due to snow, you are still at 7800 feet, but we were still able to see so much. Spectacular, Mother Nature at its most powerful and a geological delight.

reviews.name: Mickey
reviews.title: Yellowstone Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Breathtaking! It's hard to choose a favorite site in Yellowstone, but this is definitely one of them. Stunning!

reviews.name: chakrab2016
reviews.title: A must do
reviews.comment: I liked the Yellowstone grand canyon more than the more famous Grand Canyon of Arizona due to its exquisite beauty. This has an artist point too, not to be missed.

reviews.name: Eva J
reviews.title: artists viewpoint
reviews.comment: Like so many other places in Yellowstone, this is an area with fantastic views. (And plenty of people trying to capture the perfect photo for social media.)

reviews.name: MarineAir10
reviews.title: Breath Taking Views
reviews.comment: The views are exceptional and let you experience another of Yellowstone’s many different sides. We saw numerous examples of park wildlife in this area.

reviews.name: Carol B
reviews.title: May 2018
reviews.comment: It was beautiful as there was still snow on the ground...worth seeing for sure. Make sure you have a camera.

reviews.name: Kerim Perdomo
reviews.title: Amazing View - You see Magic Hand of God...
reviews.comment: When I planned this trip, I never imagine I will see how beauty and wise is our earth, our planet...stunning colors and views, strong current waters forming this beautiful waterfall...I will come back again...

reviews.name: Jellybaby67
reviews.title: Visit at different times
reviews.comment:
We visited this early morning, late evening and midday. The best light was surprisingly at noon as it lit up the rock to show the yellow stone of Yellowstone!
There will always be loads of people here, but if you can get here early, head to the North part of the canyon first. Walk down to the top of the waterfall (which was very worthwhile despite the uphill climb back) and also walk along the north canyon trail to Artists Point to avoid crowds and have easy parking.
Also worth going to see the Upper Falls, quick and easy and you realise how fast the water is flowing. Often rainbows here.
An amazing canyon and waterfall which you should have at the top of your must see's in YNP.

reviews.name: 31Elaine
reviews.title: Fantastic scenery
reviews.comment: The Colours in the rocks were amazing, if you can time it for when the sun is shining on it, even better.

reviews.name: RichardMPeters
reviews.title: Well worth a stop off
reviews.comment: Stunning views during a winter trip. The perfect spot to stop off for lunch and only a few minutes from Canyon Village visitor centre.

reviews.name: Aaron
reviews.title: Easy hike with great views
reviews.comment:
Walking to the viewing area from the parking lot is a cynch and the views are incredible. Had the benefit of arriving early and dealing with no crowds.
Tip for this site and others all over Yellowstone - GET THERE EARLY! If you don't get started until 9am or later, you're dooming yourself to hassle. The best way to see anything in the park is to get out early and make occasional time to see things after dinner.
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a must-see stop.

reviews.name: James M
reviews.title: One of my favorite places in the park.
reviews.comment: I spent the summer working in Yellowstone and went to the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone many times. Very peaceful late in the evening when the crowds have died down. Artist point is a must see spot in the park.

reviews.name: geoffviking
reviews.title: A Must See better still if you are prepared to walk a little
reviews.comment: We did this over 2 days as we traveled once from Gardiner and then from West Yellowstone. We walked both the North & South sides of the gorge. We also walked down to the viewing platforms at Lower Falls & elsewhere. Walked out to Inspirational Point. Even if you do not want or cannot walk much it is still well worth a visit. This is top drawer.

reviews.name: webatweb
reviews.title: Not to be missed!
reviews.comment: The falls and canyon are on the north loop so a lot of people overlook this area. Don’t be one of them. This area is some of the most photogenic in the park.

reviews.name: NanetteS
reviews.title: Well worth the time!
reviews.comment: I have taken the morning sunrise hike from the canyon village camprground to the rim of the canyon. It is well worth the time it takes to view the canyon at sunrise and sunset! Do not miss the opportunity to walk all of the trails and not miss any of the spectacular views!

reviews.name: Larry F
reviews.title: Wintertime Delight!
reviews.comment:
We visited here with Yellowstone Forever Expeditions on snowshoes hiking along the canyon rim.
This was fabulous and wondrous!
Our Naturalist Guide informed us about the history, geology, thermal features and the falls.
Check out our pictures!

reviews.name: Franzy016 Y
reviews.title: Amazing Canyons!
reviews.comment: So far to all the canyons my family has been to, this place is the best! What a beautiful creation of God for everyone to enjoy! Its rainbow mix of colors make it so stunning! This was the third time we visited the site. Great place to be.

reviews.name: jeaneelu
reviews.title: Worth the drive
reviews.comment: Yellowstone is a very large park and requires a lot of driving. Depending on which way you go, make sure you DO NOT miss this gorgeous canyon view, from several angles. There are a lot of short hiking trails that take you all over the rim to see great views of the canyon and the waterfall below. Do not miss it!

reviews.name: Zhiv
reviews.title: This Canyon is a mini-replica of how the real Grand Canyon was formed
reviews.comment: We visited late spring, when water volume was quite high and spectacular. There are spots where you can get close enough to the water though not too far from the road and from the top of the waterfall the view is mesmerizingly beautiful. I highly recommend it.

reviews.name: ThreeWiseMen1998
reviews.title: Wonderful? Depends
reviews.comment: This is definitely a stop because it's right next to the lower falls which is definitely a A+. Is this "Grand Canyon" wonderful? Depends on whether you have been to the real Grand Canyon before. To us this was just a deep canyon.

reviews.name: Sanjeev K
reviews.title: Worth it!!
reviews.comment: Before visiting YellowStone, I have heard only Grand Canyons which are in Arizona. And I found these so amazing and it is worth seeing great carving of nature from both sides of the canyon. It looks so stunning when sun hits only half side of the canyon.

reviews.name: 510richarde
reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was a bit of a surprise for us as we thought it was stunning. You get the opportunity to see this from different sides, the North, South etc and I would take the opportunity to do so. Not just a fantastic photo opportunity but, we thought, an awesome sight. We really enjoyed it and are happy to recommend.

reviews.name: Heather R
reviews.title: Amazingly beautiful park!
reviews.comment: This National park is amazingly beautiful! If you're in the area, check it out! It's worth a stop!! We even say a herd of elk crossing the road as we were driving through.

reviews.name: geejam
reviews.title: stunning
reviews.comment: we weren't sure what to expect but were not disappointed. The views were incredible and it gave you a real sense of how mother nature can change an area! We had a great time here

reviews.name: Corinne P
reviews.title: WOW Just WOW
reviews.comment: A must see, we sent most to the day viewing from all platforms, great view points, well maintained. Nice to see early when sun was just coming up, then nice to see later in day when full sun.

reviews.name: Debbie's Travel bug
reviews.title: another stunning area to view
reviews.comment: they say this is the grand canyon of yellowstone park. you can certainly see the resemblance of the two. the view were stunning there is an area where you can stay here over night. we didnt stay here but next time we come, we will look at staying a night or two. everything is within an hour away. make sure you take your camera as the views are breath taking

reviews.name: Kathy B
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: Go early to these areas! We stopped at every pullout and it was worth it. Go on all the little hikes-beautiful area!

reviews.name: parmstro
reviews.title: Magic
reviews.comment: Yellowstone isn't just geysers and wildlife - it also has spectacular canyons and waterfalls. Highly recommended. Walk to the top of the lower falls for fabulous views.

reviews.name: Kathy G
reviews.title: MUST SEE in Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: We stopped at the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone during our visit - great location with lots to see! Parking was great - nice large lot. Path leading to various outlooks and photo opportunities. The views are amazing - so different than any other area of Yellowstone - it was a great place to stop and see a lot of different landscape views!

reviews.name: LUCKYME72
reviews.title: Must See in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: We have been several times but always enjoy the various views of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. We drove to Artist Point to see the Lower Yellowstone Falls and great views of the Canyon.

reviews.name: Meander607241
reviews.title: Vacation
reviews.comment: Great place to visit in Yellowstone. A must see!!!! Impressive. Majestic. Words do not express the beauty.

reviews.name: alanvoetsch
reviews.title: Don't miss this
reviews.comment: Amazingly beautiful and words cannot really describe the colors and contrasts along with the waterfalls make it a must see.

reviews.name: Mark P
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: I thought this would be a poor cousin to The Grand Canyon, but although a lot smaller, it was truly beautiful. Lots of convenient places to park and short walks to viewing points.

reviews.name: C W
reviews.title: Nice canyon views of the falls!
reviews.comment: Enjoyed seeing the "Grand Canyon" of Yellowstone. Offers a different perspective of a canyon. Roads are nicely maintained and the traffic was bearable.

reviews.name: mvidro
reviews.title: Unbelievable
reviews.comment: I wanted to visit for 30 years after seeing Thomas Moran's wonderful painting. Believe me, this roughly 20 mile long, 1000 foot deep gorge doesn't disappoint. Its walls pop with stunning yellows, reds and oranges. We spotted steaming features near the Yellowstone River. On the North Rim, we stopped at Inspiration Point and walked down to the brink of the Upper Falls. We also visited Lookout Point and Grand View to see the Lower Falls. On the South Rim, we caught a ranger talk on geology at Artist Point and joined a 90 minute ranger guided walked through .5 miles of the "back country", where only 10 percent of visitors ever go. Don't miss this wonderful opportunity to see one of America's treasures.

reviews.name: dixiepeach
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: The entire park is beautiful and the canyon is no exception. Allow plenty of time for multiple stops for different vantage points of the Canyon. Take time to sit and take it all in.

reviews.name: DrDadrwp
reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.comment: This is well worth seeing. It is a spectacular park feature. There are incredible views of the valley a falls. It is a photo stop for sure!

reviews.name: Luis D
reviews.title: Beautiful place.
reviews.comment: The beauty of the canyon is memorable. The entire park is spectacular, Put on your bucket list. A must see!

reviews.name: ksmMissouri
reviews.title: Pretty place
reviews.comment: The views of the Canyon from the Ribbon Lake trail are beautiful. Pretty colors and a different view from every spot and angle, just like the real Grand Canyon.

reviews.name: Deb
reviews.title: Beautiful drive and amazing canyon views
reviews.comment: Beautiful view of the canyon and the waterfall is stunning. The viewing areas are easy to access with the boardwalks.

reviews.name: KittyKatch
reviews.title: Amazing views of the canyon
reviews.comment: We felt really lucky to have come late in the season and see the canyon with snow. On the last day it was snowing too much to see the waterfall though

reviews.name: Corvair65
reviews.title: Better Than the Famous Grand Canyon, Just Smaller
reviews.comment: If you have to choose between Old Faithful and the Canyon, go to the Canyon. It's beautiful, and add a waterfall.

reviews.name: Robert L
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Very nice, but easy to miss on the park road. Well worth the drive and the walk. The viewing areas are easy to access

reviews.name: SteveGl
reviews.title: Afternoon at Canyon
reviews.comment: Easy to get around with spectacular scenery. Love it, we did expect this beauty and were thrilled with it.

reviews.name: outsteppin
reviews.title: We could have just stood in awe all day
reviews.comment: We enjoyed the hiking, the views and the spectacular falls. What an experience! What a way to share this country with our friends from England.

reviews.name: Sheila P
reviews.title: Another Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: I never knew there was another Grand Canyon. It's just as spectacular as the one in Arizona. If your in the area go and see it.

reviews.name: PTOGreer
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I think the Grand Canyon in Yellowstone is much more impressive than the other Grand Canyon. Who knew what something so marvelous was inside the park? Beautiful

reviews.name: spitzy135
reviews.title: Every View is Breathtaking!
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon area of Yellowstone is one of the most picturesque parts of the park, and very different from the well-known geo-thermal areas. This part of the park is a must see, since it is why the park is called “Yellowstone.” From these overlooks peering into the gorge, you can see the yellow walls of the canyon that gave Yellowstone its name.
We visited in late September, and got early starts at the first light of dawn. We were rewarded with incredible views of this area, and at most of the overlooks, we had the park to ourselves. Don’t pay any attention to comparisons to the actual Grand Canyon or to Niagara Falls. Each of the national parks we have visited have their own special beauty and we appreciate each of their unique vistas. The views of Yellowstone Canyon were just extraordinary.
We visited North Rim Drive first. This is a one way loop where you can drive and stop at the successive viewpoints to admire this breathtaking area. This worked well for us, since we really don’t hike, but could still experience incredible views with very little effort. We stopped at all of the easy points along the way; Brink of the Lower Falls, Lookout Point, Grandview, and Inspiration Point. Each of these views gave a different view of the gorge and the Lower Falls, and every different view was amazing. Some tourists skip these views and only go to Artists Point. What a huge mistake! Spend the time to explore these other views. You won’t be disappointed!
Just an FYI. The signage for Inspiration Point is very confusing. The first sign you see is not Lookout Point. It is a trail that has sheer drop-offs, and really should be cordoned off for safety. The actual observation point is at the next sign, and is an area that just opened up from construction. This overlook has numerous steps to the view, and is absolutely stunning. The park really did a great job at this site. Always look for official park signs with maps, which mark the actual overlooks.
We then headed back toward Canyon Junction, and turned south to pick up South Rim Drive toward Artists Point. We stopped at the Brink of the Upper Falls, but didn’t go all the way to the observation point. It was somewhat steep, and too difficult for us. We then passed Uncle Tom’s Point, which was still closed for construction. It was supposed to be open by September of 2018, but apparently it is taking longer than expected.
Artists Point is one of the busier parts of the part. It is probably the most visited of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon overlooks. The view from here is absolutely incredible. Definitely a primo selfie shot! It’s a good idea to get here early, and definitely be patient. Many people setup camera tripods, and there were only a few “holes” in the prime areas for the rest of us to take pictures. But if you persevere, you will get some great shots.
We are so glad we spent a couple of hours here to enjoy the many exquisite views of Yellowstone Canyon. If you love beautiful scenic views, you’ll love this part of Yellowstone!

reviews.name: Taylor B
reviews.title: Not to be confused with the Grand Canyon of the Colorado
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone isn't to be confused with the larger and even more magnificent Grand Canyon of the Colorado. But it is big enough and beautiful enough to stir your emotions. Surely, it is one of the most popular attractions in Yellowstone National Park. It is the first large canyon on the Yellowstone River downstream from Yellowstone Falls. It is about 24 miles long, 800 to 1,200 feet in depth and from a quarter-mile to three quarters-of-a-mile wide. Like the Grand Canyon of the Colorado, it is an erosional feature, not a result of glaciation. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a classic V-shaped valley, indicative of river-type erosion rather than glaciation. Today, it still is being eroded by the Yellowstone River. Perhaps the most picturesque features of the canyon are the upper and lower falls. But there are other important landmarks, including Agate Creek, Artist Point, Calcite Spring, Cascade Creek, Inspiration Point, Grand View, Lookout Point, Overhanging Cliff, Point Sublime, 7-Mile Hole and Silver Cord Cascade. For ambitious and curious tourists who want to get a closer view of the canyon and the lower falls, perhaps the canyon's most spectacular feature, they are encouraged to tackle the Uncle Tom's Trail, which is a three-mile hike along the steep stairway down the base of the lower falls.

We are senior citizens who had never seen the Old Faithful Geyser. The auto trip that we took from Florida to see this wonderful event was well worth it. We got to the site where Old Faithful would make a show for all to see. There were may seats available around the area yet people had to sit on the concrete at our feet due to the crowd waiting for the Geyser to erupt. When it erupted on time, the display went on for about three minutes. It was wonderful!
Other things that we was were people fishing in the streams, people watching other eruptions in several other spots in the park, and last but not least a bison walking up the side of the road.

!

reviews.name: BaggageConveyorBelt
reviews.title: Step into a fine art painting
reviews.comment:
Yellowstone is one of the most amazing places on the planet, and its Grand Canyon is stunningly beautiful.
There are several viewing platform areas - take the time to check them all out. Each one gives a different perspective and angle. The sheer size of the canyon, coupled with the drama of fast-falling water, plus the unusual color of the rock walls make this a must-see. See if you can spot a few small steam vents in the canyon walls.
There's a great, short video on the NPS site about the falls. It contains excellent, concise information that will aide you before your visit.
In a huge, must-see national park filled with must-see attractions, I can see why some might miss this one. If, like most people, you enter YNP from the south gate and travel, clockwise, you will have to travel a bit to get to the canyon. Ideally, it will be your second or third day of your visit.
Do not miss out. If you enjoy nature (which is why we visit Yellowstone, right?) take the time to see this part. While the thermal features are like visiting another planet, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the most beautiful parts of this planet.

reviews.name: David A

reviews.comment: Be wary of arriving at busy times as car-parks fill and there can be hordes of other tourists at the key viewing spots. Both sides are very attracrtive and for those of us keen on geology and geography, very interesting too. A must-do on a sweep on the Great Loop Road

reviews.name: Michael K
reviews.title: Interesting surreal yellow colorization of the canyon walls
reviews.comment: Unlike the Grand Canyon in Arizona which appears red in comparison, the canyon walls of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is yellow in color. With some of the exposed rock in black color, it makes for an interesting and surreal image, almost like looking at a painting. Also, the Grand Canyon in Yellowstone is closer to the observation viewpoints, which gives it a more intimate feeling. This is a must see attraction. Both the Lookout Point on the North Rim Drive and the Artist Point on the South Rim Drive offers great vantage points of both the Lower Falls and the Canyon. The Calcite Springs Overlook also offers a great vantage point for just the Canyon itself and is less crowded.

reviews.name: Kezibear

reviews.comment: Know that there is no singular view of the canyon and falls that is better than another. They are all stunning. You will also never see the exact view of the Moran painting because it is a compilation of views. Bring your hiking boots. Hike the north lower falls trails and do it at dawn. No one will be there and your drive through the park to get to the canyon will be unmatched. Steam rising everywhere, fog patches, foraging animals, and then the hike down to the crest of the falls. The mist at dawn catches sunlight and reflects colors from the walls. Hike the northern rim after - its relatively flat. You’ll mostly be alone or meet a couple of other dawn enthusiasts.

reviews.name: ELKW
reviews.title: can take a look if you have time
reviews.comment: The most attractive region in the Yellowstone (I think) is the geothermal region, however, the canyon region is worth to go to take a look if you have time, it takes you at least half fay (4 hrs) or even longer if you walk many trails. The most impressive in this canyon region is the Lower falls, the colorful (red, orange and white) cliff wall may be also somewhat attractive.

reviews.name: anne b
reviews.title: Amazing Veiws
reviews.comment: We visited the different rims along the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone and hiked down the lower falls which is paved.

reviews.name: ethompson_familyof5
reviews.title: Breathtaking! Amazing!
reviews.comment: Do NOT miss this stop on your Yellowstone vacation! Amazing views! Steep hiking down. But just take your time. Definitely a must see!

reviews.name: Segaria226
reviews.title: Not the Grand Canyon but very nice.
reviews.comment: This is on a much smaller scale than the Grand Canyon of course but offers nice views of Canyon and waterfalls and some good walks around the area which take in lakes and some thermal features. Some of the south rim areas were closed when we were there but the trail from Wapati trailhead to Ribbon Lake is a good one to do. The driving route on the north rim offers a number of good viewpoints too.

reviews.name: Lisa P
reviews.title: Unparallelled Beauty
reviews.comment: This is a must see in the park. There are many hiking trails from easy to more moderately strenuous and the views are breathtaking.

reviews.name: Scott D
reviews.title: Amazing views!
reviews.comment:
This place was absolutely amazing. The trail down to the lower falls is a little steep, so be prepared to take a few breaks on the way back up. Also, I wouldn't suggest wearing a hat as the wind blows hard. I saw several people hats get blown off and fall down the mountain.
Put this on your list of things to do!

reviews.name: Bobbie B
reviews.title: Better than the real Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: This is absolutely beautiful and more on a level that you can visually comprehend than the real Grand Canyon. I wasn’t a fan when we visited two years ago but this was different. Far more beautiful and exciting to see. We loved it!

reviews.name: Calmel100
reviews.title: BREATH TAKING!
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful sites I've ever seen! Our tour guides were awesome and told us a lot about how this Grand Canyon came about. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: paxa
reviews.title: Spectacular views and excellent trails
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon here of course is nothing like the Grand Canyon in Arizona - it's much narrower, more like a deep gorge, but the view is spectacular nevertheless. The river is a much more brilliant green next to the amazingly colorful palette of the Canyon walls. There are many lookout points on both north and south rims. Stop at all of them if you have the time, but if not, here are 3 of my favorites:
Artist Point - on the south rim, gives you a sweeping, distant view of the falls. Tends to get overcrowded so best to go early or late in the day. For more solitude and more views of the Canyon hike a bit on the Point Sublime trail (look for the sign marked Ribbon Lake). Trail is a mile one way but no need to go all the way as the best views are half way in.
Brink of Lower Falls - right off the north rim drive, requires a very steep hike down and up (0.75 miles one way) to the viewing platform. A must see if you like standing almost next to the bottom of a huge thundering waterfall.
Brink of Upper Falls - Off the loop road just south of the north rim drive - not far from the parking lot, just a few steps down. We stopped here as a last minute add on at the end of the day but it was totally worth it. Nothing like being right next to a raging river rushing towards the lip of the fall. If you like the deafening noise of water plunging down this is a good spot to be.
In addition to the Canyon and falls, we also found the stretch of the loop road between Tower and Canyon junctions to have the best bear sightings. Two in one day - grizzly and black bear with cub!

reviews.name: RRosenthal
reviews.title: Dazzling waterfalls and Colorful Canyon!
reviews.comment: Spectacular views of the waterfall and canyon! Truly beautiful, so it's no wonder artists have flocked here to paint it!

reviews.name: Terry B
reviews.title: Gorgeous canyon
reviews.comment: Short walk to overlooks. Incredible views. Unfortunately there was some Smokey haze that day. There was a small grizzly on the path going to the right so we didn't go there! Others did. With their kids. Then a ranger came, thank god. Take the pull off and visit this place.

reviews.name: YoMinGuy
reviews.title: Very pretty
reviews.comment: Certainly worth stopping at the various overlooks high above the roaring river below. The canyon changes color throughout the day dependent on the angle of the sun. Cool!

reviews.name: cornatel
reviews.title: Surprising
reviews.comment: Really one of Yellowstone's to do. The canyon has two rims. Definitely both rims deserve a visit. The same way it is a good idea to walk along the trails on both rims of the canyon. Marvellous sights.

reviews.name: leslies190
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: This was a beautiful place to visit! Our visit was included with our group tour and this was so nice and we are so glad we stopped here.

reviews.name: Connie B
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: We spent 10 day in Yellowstone and spent time in the Grand Canyon area as well as other parts of the park. The falls were so breathtaking as were the canyon areas. Make sure to hike around the falls to get the full experience.

reviews.name: Frank C
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views
reviews.comment: Amazing scenery, waterfalls, and pleasant walks on well developed trails.I have been to Yellowstone several times before without ever seeing the Grand Canyon portion of the park, and it is worth whatever time it takes to get to it!

reviews.name: C9989VFlindab
reviews.title: May 2018 trip in yellow stone
reviews.comment: It was great view and totally different view from the lower level but we enjoyed very much to see some bears, buffalo and some elks and deers. We also hired the same tour bus took us to visit the upper level park it that was also a smart move otherwise you would driven over 150 miles again and would not enjoyed the rides

reviews.name: mcriss50
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Part of our tour included this area which was very scenic. The depths of the canyons is amazing. If in Yellowstone you at least need to drive by.

reviews.name: KNHSFamily
reviews.title: Excellent area of Yellowstone-not to be missed
reviews.comment: This is a very busy area of Yellowstone and parking is at a premium. Take extra caution driving around parking areas. The scenery here is breathtaking to say the least.

reviews.name: Rebecca E
reviews.title: breathtaking
reviews.comment: One of the most memorable stops of our trip. A short walk from the parking, totally worth it! Pics do not do it justice

reviews.name: GrandTour781176
reviews.title: A little effort for a big reward!
reviews.comment: Seeing the canyon and falls from all of the different vantage points is worth the time and the energy to walk down into the canyon. Every angle shows something different, and there are plenty of places to stop and catch your breath on the walk back up out of the canyon.

reviews.name: Tom B
reviews.title: Spectacular scenery
reviews.comment: Plus animals: we saw several deer with big antlers. Earlier we saw a doe with a fawn. The park does a great job of showing the waterfalls from a good vantage point.

reviews.name: DJBradachNaples_FL
reviews.title: As good as it gets!!
reviews.comment: If you are in the park and do NOT visit this site, you might as well stayed home. Inspiring and awesome at the same time. The geo-thermal part of the park is outstanding, but so are these sites. Take them in!!

reviews.name: MLB1221
reviews.title: Jaw dropping beautiful.
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a must visit. The stunning beautify of both the waterfalls and the surrounding areas cannot be adequately described or pictured. They are a must see.

reviews.name: deejaye60
reviews.title: Must See Stop(s)
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is definitely a must see stop. Many opportunities to view waterfalls. We used the Gypsy app which pointed out where all the stops were and we didn't miss anything.

reviews.name: bharatabhyankar
reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment:
I visited Yellowstone National Park with Cosmos tours.
Every spot of Yellowstone is wonderful including Nature, History and Geology.
Don't miss the great view from Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone on your visit.

reviews.name: Mark B
reviews.title: Simply stunning
reviews.comment: By far the best place to visit in Yellowstone. Very photogenic. There are so many places to stop to enjoy the views along with several short trails

reviews.name: Steven H
reviews.title: Many places to stop along the Raod
reviews.comment: Great places along the road to view the canyon and take pictures. Many water falls and fantastic views. We rented a car in Cody, Wy., so we would not have to drive the RV in tight places and miss some of the places to stop.

reviews.name: CdninLoudoun
reviews.title: Splendid
reviews.comment: I was blown away the second I walked to an overlook to observe the canyons and the falls. It is rich in geological formation and dramatic cliffs so you want to stay off the edge. The Artists Paint Pots are in a category of their own offering a backdrop that you cannot even find in an art gallery. This is a must see if you visit Yellowstone.

reviews.name: traveladdict3500
reviews.title: Do both the South Rim and the North Rim.
reviews.comment: On the South Rim you can see Artists Point with a view on the Lower Falls. Too bad Inspiration Point and Old Tom's Trail are closed. On the North Rim you can see the Upper Falls. You need a day to see it all. As it is very crowded here, go and see this early in the morning or after 3PM (as we did).

reviews.name: JoeNathan9249
