reviews.comment: I wish I could provide any sense of the sights, feelings, sounds of this spot....but for me - it is impossible. It was a magical, spiritual moment that will live with me for the rest of my life.

reviews.name: bhamjeep
reviews.title: Worth the walk
reviews.comment:
It is worth walking down to the falls on the north rim - it takes about 10-15 minutes to walk down but the photo ops for the large waterfall and canyon itself are really worth it. It is a steep walk back but you can take breaks along the way.
Lookout point enables you to get good photos from the top of the canyon without walking down into the canyon - look out for the osprey nest in one of the high rocks as you look into the canyon.

reviews.name: lillie32940
reviews.title: AMAZING
reviews.comment: The waterfall was really amazing and can't be missed. I hear there's a hike that you can actually get really close to it. A lot was closed off for us because we were there in May and there was still a lot of snow on the ground. DO not miss this area when you are in the park.

reviews.name: Marc D
reviews.title: impressive
reviews.comment: the falls are beautiful. There is an upper and lower so you must continue down the road to see both. The short walk out the points are worth it. The falls are dramatic and different viewing points are available for seeing a different perspective. Take your time and watch the drama unfold.

reviews.name: Sam N
reviews.title: A vertiginous brush with greatness.
reviews.comment: I had missed this last time we went to Yellowstone due to a water main breaking the road when coming from the North. Saw it and was inspired and awed by the grandeur of this majestic treasure! Very few places evoke the sense of wonder and delight that this magnificent canyon does in me. The Grand View overlook was much less crowded and the views are nearly as good as the Brink of the Lower Falls. Get your "been there, done that" shot at the Lower Falls and then move up to Grand View to drink in the splendiforous essence of Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. A definite highlight of our trip.

reviews.name: Judy M
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Great Loop Road offers so many beautiful vistas. Take your time and stop whenever there is a parking area. Even if you aren't going to hike just enjoy the views.

reviews.name: Anand1351
reviews.title: Simply Awesome
reviews.comment:
We went just a day after west entrance was opened. This place is simply awesome, views are stunning. One of the most scenic places on earth especially when there is lost of ice and it’s a sunny day.
Must visit when in Yellowstone National Park.
Five stars...

reviews.name: MGCPH
reviews.title: This is worth to see but...
reviews.comment: You should not expect something like Grand Canyon, otherwise you will be very disappointed, although it is beautiful and lovely...

reviews.name: WildlandMarket
reviews.title: Beautiful Photo Opportunity
reviews.comment: If you want to see beautiful landscape and waterfalls on your trip to Yellowstone, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone will make for a great stop and photo opportunity. There may be others but the overlook we stopped at, had wonderful expansive views of the falls as well as the canyon walls carved out by the river. As I will suggest in any review of major park attractions, get there early since if the road to get there is open, its tourist season. So most scenic outlooks like this draw pretty big crowds which kind of takes away from the peacefulness you would get from this place without the crowds.

reviews.name: houstonnative47
reviews.title: Deep and beautiful
reviews.comment: It is quite a hike down some of these steep rocky trails to see this canyon and river and I did gripe a bit about it but the views that you have when you get to a stopping point are so awesome and I did live through it all! LOL There are sheer drops with waterfalls and some geysers as well as the raging river carving the walls out over time. Just awesome!

reviews.name: Verna C
reviews.title: Lovely
reviews.comment: There isn't anything I could say bad about visiting this park! It's beautiful, awe inspiring and humbles me.

reviews.name: sschafe5
reviews.title: Picturesque
reviews.comment: The Yellowstone River's canyon often gets lost in the shuffle of geysers and roaming bison. Frankly, it wasn't very high on our list prior to our visit. Once there, however, we were quickly enamored with the place. It's stunningly colorful, and I wished I would have had more time to hike in the area and not just catching quick glimpses.

reviews.name: Willof72
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring Views here...
reviews.comment:
Definitely a beautiful display of sheer rock canyons with waterfalls traversing through creating the perfect backdrop for a spectacular photo opportunity. We didn't walk down to the lower areas as it was getting late in the day but in my opinion...you don't need to.
It is a awe inspiring display of nature that Yellowstone is so well known for.
Definitely don't miss out here...

reviews.name: Steffanie C
reviews.title: The most beautiful place we saw
reviews.comment: Admittedly, our trip to Yellowstone was short and surfacey. We didn't have a lot of time and did the photo-op loop for the sake of a guest from Asia. Much of the rest of it was cool, but this was legitimately beautiful and I wish we had more time to explore but we had to hop into the car to drive to the next photo op. If we go back to Yellowstone, it will be to stay in the Old Faithful Lodge and spend more time here.

reviews.name: Cathy D
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: The waterfall is so cool and mist surrounds it. I loved it. You have to climb down a bunch of stairs and it can get scary, but the scenery is definitely worth it.

reviews.name: Marion
reviews.title: Worth visiting
reviews.comment: Nice walks available especially to see waterfalls from closer viewpoint. Lower waterfalls impressive, not totally frozen in the winter. Beautiful landscapes

reviews.name: Yves R
reviews.title: Canyons always look good
reviews.comment: It is deep, there are lots of trails one both sides of the canyon (you can easily walk and appreciate the perspective from the top)

reviews.name: Heather L
reviews.title: Beautiful place
reviews.comment: This was a beautiful attraction, and place to stop and just enjoy the majesty of this park! Bring a camera, great hiking shoes, and plenty of water!

reviews.name: Karrst
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: Amazing views from a number of points of the canyon and falls, we stopped off at Artist's Point as time was limited. Would have like to have walked more of the canyon itself, but the views from Artist’s were spectacular. Winter I bet is even better.

reviews.name: XinnieY
reviews.title: One of my favorites at Yellowstone NP
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone definitely made my top two favorite of Yellowstone National Park. The view is breathtaking. We hiked down to the start of the waterfall. Somewhat steep hike, so good hiking shoes recommended, but the view is all well worth your time and effort.

reviews.name: Robert V
reviews.title: YNP's Thrill Area
reviews.comment:
This area of YNP is located at the point where the lower loop joins the upper loop, on the right or east side of the lower loop. The place is very crowded daily in the Summer so keep patient with the traffic jams that are experienced so frequently. The weather is also subject to change dramatically, as the rain came quickly and changed an 80 degree day into the fifties, with hail, thunder, and lightning within minutes!
There are two distinct areas to visit, the lower canyon view and the upper "ledge" walkway. The lower view provides spectacular views of both the Upper and the Lower Falls. You can walk part of the way onto the lookouts. In August of 2017 the other walkway was closed for the Summer due to construction.
The walk on the Upper Canyon road is the most spectacular since you can walk within feet of the Falls, as you watch the rushing water pass by only a few feet from you, just before the water tumbles down the very high Falls. This is possible only after a somewhat strenuous walk down many stone, wet stairs to the small balcony at the top of the Falls. On the ridge walkway you can see down over the deep cliffs into the Canyon's bottom below, and still get views of the Falls and other beautiful scenery. This area is a must-see for your visit to YNP.

reviews.name: oldgrowth-pdx
reviews.title: Many great views
reviews.comment: There are many easy views from the rim that are great, such as Artist's Point or Grand View. However, my favorite view of the lower falls is from Red Rock Lookout. It does involve a bit of a hike down into the canyon on a well done trail. It is well worth the effort. If you are more ambitious, you can hike lower into the canyon and closer to the lower falls by hiking Uncle Tom's Trail. Also fine views. It is hard to go wrong at any of the canyon viewpoints. Note the canyon is great in any season, although in the winter or spring - snow can limit access.

reviews.name: nightingale1972
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: It is always a joy to see the canyon in any season; in the winter, the snow is especially beautiful.

reviews.name: Rachel L
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This area is one of my favorite places in the park. There's lots of hiking and viewpoints and the waterfalls are so beautiful.

reviews.name: nikonman50
reviews.title: Grand Canyon Winter Tour
reviews.comment: A snowcoach tour leaves the Old Faithful Snow Lodge at about 8:00 and circles the parks stopping at many planned sights including viewing the Lower Falls of the Grand Canyon. It stops for scheduled heated restroom breaks and sights along the way. It also stops when animals are sighted and everyone can get out and take photos. A box lunch is provided and eaten in the Canyon visitors center so you can warm up. Coach is very comfortable and well heated. Coach holds up to 10 people.

reviews.name: pingaroo
reviews.title: Gorgeous canyon currently under construction
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a 24 mi/39 km canyon between Tower Fall and Yellowstone Falls. There are 2 main drives:
1) North Rim Drive: Brink of Upper Falls Trail, Brink of Lower Falls Trail, Inspiration Point, Red Rock Point, Lookout Point, Grand View Point
2) South Rim Drive: Artist Point, Uncle Tom's Trail (closed until Fall 2019)
Hikers can opt to do the North Rim Trail (partially closed between Brink of Lower Falls Trail and Brink of Upper Falls Trail until Fall 2019) and South Rim Trail (closed until Fall 2019) instead of the drives.
My husband and I visited in August. As hikers, we were disappointed that we could not hike the South Rim Trail, including Uncle Tom's Trail, which takes you to the base of Lower Falls. However, we understand the importance of maintaining this natural beauty and hope to return when construction is completed. We did the North Rim Drive around 6pm on Saturday and the South Rim Drive around noon on Sunday. We recommend doing the drives either early or later in the day as there is limited parking. We had no trouble finding parking at the various view points on North Rim Drive at 6pm but had to park on the side of the road instead of the designated parking lot at Artist Point.
The Brink of Upper Falls Trail and Brink of Lower Falls Trail are 0.4 mi/0.6 km each and really do take you to the brink of the falls. While all the viewpoints were pretty, Artist Point was the most scenic and memorable. If you have time for only 1 viewpoint in Yellowstone, make it Artist Point.

reviews.name: JacksonTraveler21
reviews.title: So cool!
reviews.comment: Be sure to hike down to the platform at the top of the falls. It is AWESOME. It’s a decent way down and back up, but not all that strenuous and so amazing to stand where all that raw power is cascading over every second.

reviews.name: Anaturenerd
reviews.title: Beautiful, Awe Inspiring Views
reviews.comment: I was amazed by the size and beauty of this place. Hike down to the brink of the upper falls after you take a look around the top. Evening or mornings before 10 AM are the best, less crowded times to go.

reviews.name: lanceo53
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone - a Yellowstone National Park MUST SEE !!!
reviews.comment:
On the list of the Top 10 things to see in Yellowstone NP...the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is indeed wonderfully beautiful and majestic !!!
There are two drives/trails to do: one is the North Rim Drive, and the other is the South Rim Drive. You just have to do both !!! You will get fantastic views, up close and personal, of the Upper Falls, the Lower Falls and of course the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, as you walk along the rim of each side of the canyon.
Make sure you the do Brink of the Upper Falls lookout, and the Brink of the Lower Falls viewpoint, be sure to do Lookout Point, Grand View...all on the North Rim. Then make sure you do the Upper Falls view, Uncle Tom's Point, Uncle Tom's Trail, and Artist Point...all on the South Rim.
Truly an incredibly wondrous creation !!!
Either go to Yellowstone NP in the Spring, before Memorial Day weekend, or in the early fall, after Labor Day weekend...if your schedule allows. You will avoid the huge tourist crowds, congestion, noise, and all that goes along with the summer crush !!! We went the first full week after Labor Day weekend, and the crowds were GONE. Easy to park, no congestion, in some places hardly any people, saw a lot of wildlife as they were content to come back into view now that the people had left. But be sure to bring layers of clothes, as temps can be comfortable during the day, but can be quite cold in the evening. We even experienced snow and freezing temps a couple of our days visiting !!!
Take lots of photos...Enjoy !!!

reviews.name: Janice3loves
reviews.title: Beautiful Waterfall, higher than Niagra Falls.
reviews.comment: Take note this is should see. I was with a tour and just loved it. A great tour manager makes a big difference. There are many areas to see around the falls that the tour shows you. The bathrooms sre terrible at the Falls.

reviews.name: Jon K
reviews.title: One of the most gorgeous places in the park
reviews.comment: This is certainly one of the most beautiful places in the whole Yellowstone Park, a place that is already full of breathtaking and unbelievable scenery. It's a tough hike, but definitely do Uncle Tom's Trail to the Lower Falls - it's simply amazing. In any direction you look, there are stupendous views. You can't take a bad photo here.

reviews.name: EnjoyingNC
reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.comment:
My partner and I had a magnificent all day tour on Christmas Eve day, a gorgeous sunny and cold day. Our guide was very friendly, upbeat and kept us well informed of the many sites we saw on this 8 hour journey. The views just kept getting better from Norris Geyser to the upper and lower falls of the Canyon to the wildlife surrounding Yellowstone Lake. There were several stops along the way for rest room and snack breaks and the tour price does include a box lunch. This was an ideal way to spend Christmas Eve day with crisp winter images that look like they just came out of a holiday postcard.
Our pictures bring back fond memories we will always treasure. Having been to Yellowstone the last 2 Christmas vacation, the Canyon Day Tour is my favorite and I would strongly recommend it. Please note that our day was sunny, about 8 degrees, and gorgeous blue sky.

reviews.name: Vladimiramirela
reviews.title: Mother nature - the greatest sculptor!
reviews.comment: It is not the real Grand Canyon, however, it is great in its own way, impressive and unique, like each and any other wonder of the park.

reviews.name: Jetsetter071
reviews.title: Amazing, breath-taking, spectacular...did I say amazing?
reviews.comment: I can't even begin to describe how wonderful the views are! The paths are well maintained and there are the occasional restroom facilities. We visited in October so it wasn't very busy. We packed a lunch and enjoyed it at a lovely little viewing station. I just can't say good enough things, it's amazing!

reviews.name: 3604Panda
reviews.title: must go but make sure bring warm clothing
reviews.comment: The cayon is very pretty with different colors. We went on both rainy and sunny days, both were good. On the rainy day, the temperature dropped so much that we had to buy jackets from the shop near by.

reviews.name: mk148127
reviews.title: Worth the Trip
reviews.comment: Beautiful to see. If you are relatively fit, take the walk down to the waterfalls. It is spectacular. Walking back could be taxing, but it is worth it.

reviews.name: gerleg12
reviews.title: Interesting
reviews.comment: The canyon is nothing like the Grant Canyon on the Colorado.but is very interesting. There are some very colorful spots.

reviews.name: SimbaTheExplorer
reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone has striking geography. You would not expect to see this in Yellowstone. The diversity of geography in Yellowstone is amazing.

reviews.name: Mulan H
reviews.title: Definitely visit this spot
reviews.comment: The views of the Grand Canyon are gorgeous! It is definitely a must visit! I visited when there were fires in Montana, but thankfully it rained the previous night so the sky was no longer hazy. It is definitely one of my favourite spots in Yellowstone, I enjoyed this better than the geysers.

reviews.name: fnqfamily
reviews.title: AMAZING
reviews.comment: WOW, definitely worth the visit. I enjoyed seeing the Grand Canyon more than the geysers. The canyon is spectacular, love the colours and the waterfalls.

reviews.name: PJ-Twickenham
reviews.title: Great to Visit this Place
reviews.comment: Well worth the effort to visit here. Scenery is spectacular. Be sure to get there early and miss all the big crowds.

reviews.name: chmeee5
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: In many ways much better than the famous geysers with the spectacular canyon cutting deep into the forest.

reviews.name: Jim B
reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.comment: The downstream view of the lower falls is breathtaking. There was lots of free parking, and we'll maintained trails.

reviews.name: TX C
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: The trip to Yellowstone NP was my first. This vista was one of the definites on our trip. Gorgeous view! Parking is limited so go early and expect to wait for an open slot.

reviews.name: VLW
reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: We visited this popular attraction early in the day. Parking was still available and the temperature was still on the cool side. There are several stops on each side of the canyon, some are closed for construction (Inspiration Point, part of the north rim trail, and Uncle Tom's Point). We stopped at Artist Point, Brink of the Upper Falls, Lower Falls, Lookout Point, and Grand View. My favorite was Artist Point, the views are excellent from here. Parking lots at most of the spots are big enough for several cars. Most of the sites are within easy walking from the parking lots. The only exception is Brink of the Lower Falls, the trail drops steeply about 600 feet to the falls. Some reviews compare this to the Grand Canyon in Arizona, but there is no comparison. This is unique and beautiful in its own way. This is a must stop when visiting the park. If you can only see one part of the canyon, I recommend Artist Point. I also recommend arriving early to avoid the major crowds.

reviews.name: SigInDenver
reviews.title: A view from the canyon protected this place as a national park
reviews.comment: Not only are the views stunning, but they are legendary and should not be missed. The walk is easy and though it is a very popular place, relax and go with the flow and you will be able to enjoy this beautiful place

reviews.name: michel_omnibee
reviews.title: A canyon. A grand one.
reviews.comment: Visiting Yellowstone wouldn't be complete without checking in the Grand Canyon. As the name implies, it is big and impressive. Rightly so.

reviews.name: Lisamarie L
reviews.title: One of my favorite places in Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
This is a must see if you have limited time.
We primarily experienced this through Artist Point, which gives you a view of the brush like colors on the canyon walls, and then the amazing lower falls and the river which carves a beautiful turquoise ribbon through the golden walls of the canyon. We also visited the brink of the upper falls, which let you get a bit more up close and personal to the frothing waters!

reviews.name: dbinhou7511
reviews.title: Amazing sights along the canyon
reviews.comment: Several stops along the side of the road or you can walk over from the Canyon Visitor Center. Look for the osprey nest.

reviews.name: msadler99
reviews.title: Awesome and Majestic
reviews.comment: Super cool. Great place. Beautiful sights. We were there early October, chilly, some snow. Don't miss site. Free. Decent walk. Other areas to walk out on.

reviews.name: jafenn
reviews.title: A must see when visiting Yellowstone NP
reviews.comment: Any visit to Yellowstone would not be complete without a visit to the canyon and falls along the Yellowstone River. I recommend arriving early to beat the crowds. See it from both the north and south rims. Then drive south along the river’s path thru Hayden Valley and you will most likely be rewarded with wildlife sightings!

reviews.name: Tom C
reviews.title: This is one beautiful sight!
reviews.comment: enjoyed our walk down to the falls -- not the return trip so much -- and the power of the falls, especially the lower one. Access from south side closed for improvement, but drove to the end of the road for a great view up the valley.

reviews.name: Steven H
reviews.title: Nature Sure Does It Right
reviews.comment: If you have a passion for what nature creates, you would not want miss this. Not only did the Yellowstone River create this canyon, but waterfalls you have to see to believe. Upper and lower falls take a little hiking to get to but well worth it.

reviews.name: mgward3560
reviews.title: GC of Yellowstone a beautiful canyon.
reviews.comment: There are many views of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone on the loop road that takes you to the viewpoints for the upper and lower Yellowstone falls. These are right near Canyon Village in NW Yellowstone. It's a great road with places to park and view the river/falls/canyon.

reviews.name: DoctorVincenzoVonCueBall
reviews.title: One Word “Amazing”
reviews.comment:
The best advice I have is this should be on your bucket list and you should make sure to check it out.
Warning though is never push your luck by getting too close the the edge the fall is real bad from that height.
the Doctor show me some LOVE ❤️Hit me with a Helpful VOTE!

reviews.name: Katherine M
reviews.title: Don't Miss!
reviews.comment: Great trails, lots of benches to rest. The view is just beautiful. Go in September - I cannot imagine how crowded it is during the summer.

reviews.name: SaskyBreeze
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Hikes were fantastic and well marked. The views were spectacular. There was construction on some of the trails but it honestly didn’t even matter. Washrooms were accessible and parking was decent too.

reviews.name: Jens F.
reviews.title: Not comparable to the famous one but also interesting
reviews.comment: You should visit the falls and the different scenic views there. You'll get a much more close look to the canyon than in Grand Canyon National Park because it's very narrow and not so deep. The main spots are good to reach with the car. Just only a view steps to the platforms.

reviews.name: Stephanie C
reviews.title: Fascinating Spot
reviews.comment: There are a lot of great sites around this area. It definitely is a must see if you’re in the area! Make sure to use the pull offs.

reviews.name: ricetom
reviews.title: Stunning vista
reviews.comment: This view is absolutely amazing but was very crowded when we stopped by midday. Well worth the stop.

reviews.name: Ann W
reviews.title: Beautiful but quite a hike to see it 600' down and up.
reviews.comment: Beautiful but quite a hike to see it 600' down and up. It is worth it if you are fit. The views of the area are spectacular.

reviews.name: Carla B
reviews.title: Beautiful to behold
reviews.comment: You definitely should not miss this lovely sight while visiting Yellowstone. The view of the canyon and the waterfall are spectacular.

reviews.name: CDH075
reviews.title: A Must-See!
reviews.comment:
On the day we visited Canyon Village/Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone included an additional unexpected bonus as it snowed the night before. We had beautiful 'winter wonderland' views in the morning, then as it warmed up and the clouds opened up, we had equally nice 'Fall' viewing!
If there is snow, just be prepared for slippery conditions on the switchbacks until the snow and slush is gone.
Hint: Always carry a case of water and cooler of food items anytime you are in the park because the weather/road conditions can change quickly. Also keep extra clothing on hand just in case. We would love to come back here again.

reviews.name: Lori L
reviews.title: Worth the Hike Down
reviews.comment: You must drive up to Canyon Village. It's a nice walk down to the viewing stations. The views are breathtaking. Between watching the waterfalls and the deep rich canyon, this is one of the reasons why you came to Yellowstone. It's worth every step back up. It's a bit steep but know you can rest every few steps.

reviews.name: simpleyme
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This is really a beautiful view The colors of the water and the canyon walls are fantastic.. There are plenty of spots to pull over and see it .

reviews.name: Cesar2011BR
reviews.title: Wonderful Place
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a must visit attraction in the Yellowstone National Park. The colors of the soil in the mountains and the kind of green running water is an spectacular view.

reviews.name: bbqkeith48
reviews.title: Being there is better than pictures!
reviews.comment: We were told to make sure and see this by a photographer in Cody WY. He was right it was worth the time. Absolutely beautiful.

reviews.name: Ken W
reviews.title: Long lovely hikes
reviews.comment: There are three trails start at the 1st hnearest the falls and then walk to the next. Youl will get a few miles end by end of the day and the sights are worth it.

reviews.name: arlened585
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: This place is one you must see to really appreciate. It is beyond words to explain the beauty of the area. It takes at least three days to see the area. The Yellowstone River and the rock formations are breathtaking as is the whole area of the park.

reviews.name: lkumar64
reviews.title: Must See!
reviews.comment: The 20 miles of canyon created by the yellowstone river in its 600 miles of turbulent journey is one of the highlights of the visit. While its geology is not clearly understood, its clearly a much loved stop. We braved biting cold temperatures to trek the trails to see the views.

reviews.name: wellsfam
reviews.title: artist viewpoint was a gorgeous
reviews.comment: Don't know how we've missed this on prior trips, but a real highlight this time. Do yourself a favor and look up Thomas Moran's paintings before you go to see what he captured there.

reviews.name: Famontherun
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: We drove along the edge of the canyon, stopping at all the vantage points for different views of this splendid natural attraction...just breathtaking! We did not take the hike to view the falls from below so I can't comment on the hike or view from there. Be sure to spend some time enjoying this when you visit.

reviews.name: Shawneen B
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: I knew little about the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone and was surprised by the beauty and grandeur of this section of the park. It was absolutely beautiful and worth the various short hikes to access breathtaking views from a variety of vantage points.

reviews.name: radx4
reviews.title: Do It
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is one of the most visited destinations in the park. This is for good reason. The views of the canyon are simply amazing, and there is nothing else like it. The Yellowstone River, combined with unique volcanic activity, has created a very interesting canyon with rock formations and colors that are unlike anything else I've seen.
There are roads that go along the upper rim and part of the lower rim. There's plenty of parking on the upper rim, so you can stop at various places to walk and take pictures. I recommend hiking down to the brink of the lower falls and lookout point.
Construction at the time prevented us from reaching Inspiration Point, but it likely had a similar view to the other locations we did see.
Bottom line: Be sure to check out the Grand Canyon when in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Mike P
reviews.title: Better than Arizona's?...
reviews.comment: I've been to the Grand Canyon and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and they are both awesome - amazing for different reasons. This one is so dramatic and Yellowstone falls looks incredible as it flows fiercely all year round. Is easy to get to, just check your park map when you arrive, and parking is easy - it's a very short walk to the overlook (look for 'artists point' on south rim drive). Would definitely recommend this as one of Yellowstone's best attractions. If you want to see it from a different perspective, you can do a very steep, but fair short hike to the top of the lower falls (take lower falls trail from north rim drive). It's important to note these two different views are on opposite sides of the Canyon - chittenden bridge will take you over the river.

reviews.name: Tracy W
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: We travel here in September and while there were still plenty of people, it wasn't excessive and I must say that the scenery is worth it. There are many spot to view the canyon and the Yellowstone river. Stop at as many as you can!

reviews.name: joyfultraveller_10
reviews.title: Awesome Views
reviews.comment: Canyons, waterfalls, steamy jets, pine trees, interesting rocks! This is a place with a variety of stunning scenes. Bring your camera! There was a ranger there giving a lecture on wolves which we happened upon. Most interesting. Don't miss this area!

reviews.name: Mary P
reviews.title: Breathtaking Views
reviews.comment: We were on a Road Scholar trip for six days and saw so many wonderful sights. Every person interested in the beauty of the natural wonders of our world should visit Yellowstone National Park. I'm going to give almost every site in the park a 5.

reviews.name: Max H
reviews.title: Get there early morning to see the sunrise and the wonderful effects
reviews.comment: This is a brilliant place to visit. It has breathtaking views but can get very crowded with coaches etc and plenty of Chinese visitors Go early before the bulk arrive or after six in the evening but make sure you go

reviews.name: Malenymac
reviews.title: Brllliant and unexpected
reviews.comment: Whilst being amazed at everything else Yellowstone has to offer, we were so surpised at the is extra gem. The Grand Canyon of yellowstone and the falls are excellent and well worth the visit notwithstanding the plethora of tourists.

reviews.name: Larry M
reviews.title: Beautiful, unique, a must see in Yellowstone, BUT...
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the "Must Sees" in Yellowstone.
BUT... be sure to check on what is currently open to the public. We were there in August 2017. Several roads and/or view points/trailheads were closed for either improvement or repair.

reviews.name: RachelR
reviews.title: Stunning beautiful. Too many tourists.
reviews.comment: One of the most stunningly beautiful places on the planet. Alas, it's hard to appreciate in a crowd of several hundred+ people. Try anyway. Early morning or late evening are best times to avoid crowds, although photography light is best mid-day.

reviews.name: VAD859
reviews.title: Gorgeous. Gorgeous. Beyond gorgeous.
reviews.comment: Beautiful and scenic area of Yellowstone National Park. Excellent signage. Good parking. Paved walking path to overlooks. Bathrooms near the parking lots.

reviews.name: Donna V
reviews.title: Totally awesome
reviews.comment: Probably our most favorite part of our Yellowstone trip (other than the wildlife). The Yellowstone River and the falls were very beautiful. The pictures seen beforehand did not bring it justice.

reviews.name: Caitlin M
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This was a highlight of our trip. Some group members did along hike while others just enjoyed the view from the top. There is something for everyone and lots of parking. Washrooms were dirty but available.

reviews.name: JPTEncino
reviews.title: Best Yellowstone Experience
reviews.comment: Words cannot express the beauty and power of this location in Yellowstone National Park. If we had ignored the little signs for the Brink of Upper Falls it would have been a big mistake. I can't imagine this would be unnoticeable from about a half a mile away. Do not miss both the Lower Falls and the Upper Falls. They are truly spectacular.

reviews.name: NancieMD
reviews.title: Beauty all around us
reviews.comment:
Take your time and stop to enjoy all what nature has to show.
Great views awesome , spectaller, capture

reviews.name: K1w1NZ
reviews.title: A beautful loocation and sight to see.
reviews.comment: This is a must see in the Park. There are several locations to view and all are worth a visit. If you get there in the morning at the right time a rainbow appears from the falls is wonderful to photograph.

reviews.name: 351diane
reviews.title: Thor Grand Canyon at West Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is another beautiful place to see and hike in West Yellowstone. Don't stop at the very beginning with the waterfall, continue around to the path and walk up! The views are simply stunning and the hike is not that difficult. You can stop anywhere along the way to just gaze out at this natural beauty that God gave us. My husband hiked to the very end of the trail but didn't feel the views were any more enticing for the last 1/2 mile. Simply lovely

reviews.name: JRoc2010
reviews.title: So beautiful!
reviews.comment: I wish the weather had been better on the day I was there but it was still beautiful despite the rain and snow. Gorgeous view!

reviews.name: bill p
reviews.title: worth the hikes down
reviews.comment: So the classic view is from Artists point, and it is a great one. Best light in early am, but closer to noon better chance to catch a rainbow from the spray of the falls.. Hikes into the canyon only go down so far, but offer great views of the brink of the lower falls and from the red rock observation point. Both are recommended. Hard to pick out a favorite spot at Yellowstone but this would be right up at the top.

reviews.name: capngrey
reviews.title: Dramatic Views
reviews.comment: Deep and noisy were my first impressions. The colors were amazing and we learned that the yellow rock gave Yellowstone it's iconic name.

reviews.name: Jack H
reviews.title: Simply gorgeous
reviews.comment: Yellowstone is a must see for all! This loop road is fantastic. The Park is a true American treasure. Don't miss it.

reviews.name: Wayne K
reviews.title: One of the signature locations
reviews.comment:
The view of the falls was one of the drivers for designating the park - the iconic painting.
The view from the South Rim Drive walkway is excellent and just what you would expect.
As per usual the walks are very well maintained and easy to traverse.
Unfortunately Inspiration Point was close this late in the season - sad.
North Rim Drive has an excellent alternate view from Grand View. Worth the drive and stop.

reviews.name: Marathon59
reviews.title: Easy access point. Lots of parking and a short walk to the viewing levels.
reviews.comment: Stopped here twice. Once in the afternoon and took pictures. Then the next day early in the morning for the sunrise. What a difference the sunlight makes. It is amazing the colors you see in the morning.

reviews.name: peanutsNewYork
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring
reviews.comment: There ;are so many wonderful things to see and experience in Yellowstone, but this is definitely one of the top places to see. The roaring waterfalls are just beautiful, powerful and the canyon is gorgeous. Mother nature at her best! There are the upper and lower falls, both with boardwalks and viewing areas. Don't miss this.

reviews.name: Deborah W
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: A must see in Yellowstone! The falls are fantastic and the canyon is so impressive. You can get some great photos here.

reviews.name: Linda C
reviews.title: Fascinating !
reviews.comment: Two beautiful drives; one on each side of the canyon. Beautiful views, trails and waterfalls. Many pull-out points. If you are at all interested in geology or just like beauty, you must come

reviews.name: ljmorecambe
reviews.title: Must see.
reviews.comment: Stunning scenery. Some access points currently closed for maintenance, but still plenty accessible viewpoints. Many stunning aspect to Yellowstone, but this is a must see.

reviews.name: Rboone58
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: My number-one, MUST-see area of Yellowstone. Easy hike to see the falls with a nice viewing area available. Make time to see this area when visiting Yellowstone

reviews.name: TucsonTraveller2
reviews.title: Amazing Waterfall from different vantages
reviews.comment: What a beautiful and powerful waterfall. The views from both sides of canyon are amazing. You will have to walk a short ways to see from all overlooks. Be sure to stop at all the overlooks and be amazed.

reviews.name: MNDadMinnesota
reviews.title: Five Stars... but get there early!
reviews.comment: The GC of Yellowstone was our most anticipated stop on our three day trip to the park. The beauty and grandness of this place deserved 5 stars, no question. This was our first stop of the day, arriving before 10 am. All was good. By 11:15 the place was a madhouse. Tour buses bringing loads of travelers packing the trails and walkways. Regardless of your park destination, my advice is to get there as early as possible. We found that by early afternoon we were ready to be free of the crowds. Do notice warnings before walking down to the observations decks as this is a very tough return back to the top. Was hoping the end of August was going to be a bit quieter. We still had a blast!

reviews.name: tammythetypist
reviews.title: Grand View, Literally Awesome
reviews.comment: A must see. There are lots of ways to see this feature, one two different sides. Far away from the falls themselves or right over the falls. Beautiful waterfall and river below. Beautiful walls of rock and pine trees. A picture moment.

reviews.name: rukkunudeen r
reviews.title: Yellowstone's Majestic Canyon
reviews.comment: Its gigantic, colorful and fantastic with a majestic waterfall. Loved the colorful scenery with a superb viewpoint

reviews.name: Mary H
reviews.title: This Is A Must See In Yellowstone
reviews.comment: I missed the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone 6 years ago but will tell everyone that this is a must see. It is gorgeous! You must see it from every angle and bring your camera you will want to tell all your friends to go and see it too.

reviews.name: Bruce H
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is a wonderful place to stop while in Yellowstone. The scenery is colorful and fantastic. From Artists Point, one can take a shot of the Yellowstone Falls, which is truly magnificent.

reviews.name: chventures
reviews.title: ~~ Yes, it's BEAUTIFUL but I think the geyser basins are more spectacular! ~~
reviews.comment:
Having been to the Grand Canyon in Arizona it is very easy to see why this area of Yellowstone has the same name. It is absolutely incredible that there is such diversity in this park and a canyon is just one of many.
The parking lot is big so plenty of room. It was pouring with rain the day we visited but the place was still packed with tourists. The main viewing area, like many in the Grand Canyon of Arizona, was CROWDED so you had to wait to get a good picture etc.
Easy walk from the parking lot to viewing areas and of course the Falls can be seen here too. Glad we saw it but we were wowed more by some of the other sights.

reviews.name: Bartonbears
reviews.title: Outstanding vista
reviews.comment: We visited Yellowstone as part of a small group tour and visited the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone toward the end of three day stay. We found the view awe inspiring. The vast scale of the canyon took us completely by surprise. It was, without doubt, the most impressive thing we saw in the park even though we loved so many other aspects of this amazing place. You really can't afford to miss this viewpoint if you are visiting Yellowstone National Park.

reviews.name: therealcyclops
reviews.title: Crowded but beautiful
reviews.comment: This was a beautiful waterfall in a canyon. The canyon walls are multi colored. Go at sunset or sunrise for amazing scenes and less people. Very crowded. Seeing from a location you can hike to with less people would be better.

reviews.name: Siteseer1
reviews.title: You're there already.
reviews.comment: If you are going to see the falls you will see the canyon. It is very beautiful and well worth the time to enjoy it.

reviews.name: Mounty76
reviews.title: A Special Place
reviews.comment: This is a must see! One of the most beautiful canyons complete with waterfalls in America. This is the heart of Yellowstone! Pick up a National Park Service Canyon Trail Guide before you go. It would not be a complete visit without doing at least a couple of trails. On the south rim Uncle Tom's was closed for construction. The South Rim Trail offers beautiful canyon views, but limited views of the Falls, but you must go to Artist Point. On the North Rim the Red Rock Point Trail offers incredible views of the Falls but is very steep.

reviews.name: TractorDoc76
reviews.title: Easy to See How the Park Earned its Name
reviews.comment:
This Canyon is indeed Grand. . . and the walls covered in an array of colors were the source of the name "Yellowstone" bestowed on the park. They do throw off brilliant shades of yellows, oranges, browns, pinks, etc. and contrasted next to the blues/greens of water, sky and foliage it is easy to see why overlooks have names like Inspiration Point, Artists Point, etc.
This area is less known than Old Faithful but just as, well, Grand.
Definitely worth a visit -- drive the upper and lower canyon roads (or hike the trails) to take in the overlooks.

reviews.name: Chris E
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Stunning beyond words. Incredible beauty all around. Lots of viewing points and trails to walk. Car parking can be a problem.

reviews.name: Je'Ann L
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Breathtakingly spectacular! Just one of so many outstanding natural things to see in the park! It was one of my personal favorites. We stayed nearby at the Canyon Lodge in a perfect location and were able to see other fantastic venues in one day as a result. Wonderful trip!

reviews.name: ger w
reviews.title: A ribbon of gold
reviews.comment: Try to arrive in early evening ,by then some of the tour bus visitors will have gone and you can see the falls as a ribbon of gold.Keep an eye open for the multi coloured sides of valley

reviews.name: kealoha
reviews.title: Amazing, beautiful canyon
reviews.comment: I'd heard so much about Yellowstone, but not about the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. What a great surprise! It was just gorgeous! I've seen other beautiful canyons, but not with the colors of this one! The waterfalls were beautiful, as was the river. My favorite spot was Artist Point-- unbelievably beautiful. It was all easily visited, with roads, walkways, lookout points and trails.

reviews.name: Sarah M
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: By far one of my favorite spots at Yellowstone! Beautiful views of the waterfall and the canyons. All the views are only a short walk but very busy location!

reviews.name: Pat D
reviews.title: Take the time to hike along the trails.
reviews.comment: There are several areas where you can park and walk out to see the canyon and the waterfalls and they are all worth the effort. They are mostly level and the views make them easy to handle. Each section has a different view of the canyon and/or the river, so try to make time to stop at each one. Like everything in the park, parking can get to be a problem at these popular stops, so try to go early or later in the day if you can. If not, just make another loop, chances are good that someone will be leaving and open up a space.

reviews.name: jmb
reviews.title: A Must!
reviews.comment: You need to see this! OMG! The water fall is amazing and the rock formation is incredible! It can be very crowded and parking may be an issue, but do not miss this!

reviews.name: Alan R
reviews.title: Spectacular; however limited your time in Yellowstone, go here!
reviews.comment: Although not of the same scale as the Grand Canyon in Arizona; this compact canyon with it s glorious waterfall is still extensive and beautiful with a glorious viewpoint from artist's viewpoint.

reviews.name: CS124578
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: The views are amazing of the falls and the canyon. We drove both upper and lower and walked up the trail to take pictures. It was an easy walk in and back and well worth it. One evening after dinner we drove back on the lower falls drive and saw lots of wildlife.

reviews.name: Mal_1313
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: A really beaitiful place with accessible trails. Would be useful to have more sogns though so it is easier to know where to go exactly as we parked in the first parking lot, not realizing that there was a second one that was closer to the trail that we wanted to do.

reviews.name: TravelFan48105
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: This is one of the best sights in Yellowstone. The canyon was created by the glaciers and the river while the gorgeous colors are related to the iron in the rock. There is a very lovely walk on a trail at the southern rim leading to the falls. On another day we drove on the northern side, then hiked close to the rim and the views were spectacular there also. This is a natural feature of Yellowstone National Park that cannot be missed. Go early to beat the hordes.

reviews.name: Cherie P
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: This is a spectaculter place to see...the colors of the Canyon are beautiful and a must hike is to the top overlooks and down in to view both the Upper Falls and the Lower Falls....both falls are spectacular as well as the Canyon.

reviews.name: Katana107
reviews.title: Amazing views!
reviews.comment: So beautiful! Artist point is a must. Brink of lower and upper falls is a lot of fun! Do the red rock trail in order to get an awesome view of lower falls! I wish uncle toms trail would of been open!

reviews.name: John P
reviews.title: My Favorite Yellowstone Feature
reviews.comment: Of all the things to see in Yellowstone, the canyon is my favorite. The colors, the river, the falls - it's all beautiful. The hike to the brink of the lower falls is well worth the effort. Use caution - the trail is in need of maintenance. Some of the railings are broken and/or missing.

reviews.name: Tracey W
reviews.title: Wow
reviews.comment: Visited the grand canyon ...this mini one is also stunning well worth a visit the view and sight is amazing the waterfall and river that was a bonus

reviews.name: CJGinNM
reviews.title: What a view!
reviews.comment: We stopped and did the very short walk to see the Lower (I think) waterfall. The view is spectacular. Only 'problem' is the amateur photographers with piles of equipment that seem to think it's their right to take all the best viewing places and stay there for a long time.

reviews.name: jmarti2002
reviews.title: Anniversary Trip 2017
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone did not disappoint. Make sure you make it to Artist Point. The bring of the upper falls was outstanding.

reviews.name: Ronald B
reviews.title: Amazing hikes
reviews.comment: The hype is an understatement when it comes to the GC of YS. Be sure to go to the visitors center to see the geological history of YS. Then make all the stops along the canyon rim, north and south. Hike down to the bottom and along the rim. See magnificent vistas, hear the roaring waterfalls and rapids, see the osprey nest sitting atop a pinnacle of rock, hold hands and say I love you Celebrate your 50th wedding anniversary! No better place.

reviews.name: seasideljs
reviews.title: Amazing Canyon!!
reviews.comment: We didn't realize there was such an amazingly beautiful canyon in Yellowstone! We were totally shocked while we took in it's beauty! It is so colorful..This is a must see in Yellowstone..

reviews.name: Kevin M
reviews.title: Stunning and Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Words and pictures can't quite put the beauty of the falls into perspective. We went early to beat the September crowds and we were able to to get some really nice photos. The later you way to sightsee the more crowds you will have to wade through. Parking can be difficult, but it's worth the effort to witness the stunning views.

reviews.name: notsogold
reviews.title: Pretty but
reviews.comment: Area is pretty enough but hardly compares to the real thing. Definitely expected much more spectacular scenery than we saw.

reviews.name: Kevin W
reviews.title: Get there early
reviews.comment:
We drove there from Mammoth to get there by 7.30am to beat the tourist busses, we just about made it to the South side ahead of the hoarders, note it is worth taking the path along the through the woods to see the canyon in the early morning light.
North side was good and we walking down to the brink of the lower falls, it's worth the walk.
Then get out out you have seen it all and the tour busses will have caught up with you.
Good luck

reviews.name: Christi463
reviews.title: Awesomeness!
reviews.comment: This had a lower and upper falls. The lower was from a distance but absolutely breathtaking views. So many people trying to get pictures with the falls behind them. The upper falls was close up and personal! Loved it!

reviews.name: Rose L
reviews.title: Yellowstone Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Beautiful [place to visit....do the walk down to the falls, but remember, you still have to walk back up that hill....but worth it...

reviews.name: IsabellasGrandma
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning.....
reviews.comment: While not as overwhelming in size as Arizona's Grand Canyon, this is beautiful. The South Rim offers views that are much more readily accessible and, IMHO, far more striking. The North Rim views are limited unless you're willing and able to hike moderate distances (and inclines) which, for older folks, can be a challenge. Between the wildfire smoke and the altitude, the hiking part proved a bit too much for us. The South Rim was much easier and offered a couple of overlooks that provided incredible views.

reviews.name: Rebecca B
reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment: Mother nature is amazing at the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. I recommend to start on the south rim for a spectacular view of the lower falls and the canyon walls. Then make your way to the north rim. We took so many pictures at both rims. It is so picturesque.

reviews.name: CandE_Evans
reviews.title: Fabulous
reviews.comment: Stopped by the roadside to view this canyon. It is huge and I think deeper than some parts of Grand Canyon. No disabled parking spots available so it made it hard for my wife to get out of the car due to the narrowness of the parking bays.

reviews.name: MinnesotaRandy
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Unexpected and beautiful! Nice paved trail. The rock formation colors are great. The waterfall is stunning.

reviews.name: MMarianne1352
reviews.title: Beautiful Part of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: I had no idea that this was part of Yellowstone. The scenery is gorgeous. We took a hike with a ranger on the South Rim, and learned a lot about the geological history of the park.

reviews.name: BilRob
reviews.title: Amazingly beautiful place!
reviews.comment: This is some of God's best work! The views of the canyon with all the different colored stone and the waterfall is stunning. Do not go to Yellowstone Park without stopping by here at Artistic Point. My words cannot do it justice, but I can promise you that you will not be disappointed!

reviews.name: jday2015
reviews.title: Must See for ANYONE Going to Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a Must See for ANYONE Going to Yellowstone. Upper and Lower Falls viewing areas are easily accessed from north and south rim viewing areas. Artist Point on south Rim is also a must see.

reviews.name: Peter K
reviews.title: Great colors in the canyon and the falls are a must see
reviews.comment:
We visited the canyon on 9/2/17. We started at Artists Point on the south side. I'd recommend getting there early (8 am or so) because the light is great for photos and the crowds are not there yet. When we visited, the rest of the So. Rim Drive stops (Uncle Tom's, So. Rim trail) were closed for renovation which I believe will continue into 2018) so check with the park website on their status if they are important to your visit.
We then drove to the North Rim. We did the four outlook hikes:
The Lower Falls hike is worth doing and while there are a few switch backs it is not overly strenuous
Look outpoint is an easy walk to the edge of the canyon with great views of the falls.
The Red Rock hike is strenuous, with lots of stairs and switch backs but the view and photos you can get of the falls are worth the work. I highly recommend this hike.
the Grand view trail is a short easy walk to the edge, again great views of the canyon
As of Sept 2017, the Inspiration Point Rd and trail were closed for renovations. Check with the park website on when it will reopen in 2018.
Note: most but not all of the restrooms are pit toilets, if that is an issue Brink of the Lower Falls overlook has regular restrooms
Be sure and see the canyon while you are in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: CFT99
reviews.title: The most beautiful views in the park
reviews.comment: After visiting the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, it is clear why it's called Yellowstone. The views are stunning. You can take an extensive hike or drive around the rims and take modest hikes at each look out point.

reviews.name: Peter C
reviews.title: Just as grand
reviews.comment: Some people might say this is not as good as the Grand Canyon but to us this is just as grand. The view with the water falls just a must see. If you are in the park you have to go see it.

reviews.name: packcal
reviews.title: Our favorite area in Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
The colors of the deep canyon and river, coupled with the two large waterfalls are other worldly.
And, not as crowded as the Old Faithful area.
Highly recommend.

reviews.name: joedvet
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: Although some of the points and hikes are shut down now - check before you go - we enjoyed what we could see. Amazing views.

reviews.name: Judi H
reviews.title: Limited access
reviews.comment: Because of road construction, Inspiration Point was closed, and part of the south rim road was closed. We were able to walk to both falls and to Artist's Point, though.

reviews.name: Tim C
reviews.title: Awesome, just Awesome
reviews.comment: This is a spectacular canyon to view at serveral locations north of Canon Village or between the famous falls. A must see in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: golf076
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: I have been to the Grand Canyon, now this. What a beautiful sight to behold. Years of flow created this beautiful canyon, do not be afraid to get close and look down, do it!

reviews.name: Tayadog1
reviews.title: Top 3 site in the park
reviews.comment: Beautiful 20 mike canyon with the upper and lower falls. Breath taking views everywhere. Tough to beat the part of the park.

reviews.name: Dhanan
reviews.title: Great hike to and along the Yellowstone river
reviews.comment: We loved this not to difficult hike for it's beautiful scenery. A must do when in Yellowstone. One can also get to scenic point without hiking too long and be able to see gorgeous sights of the river on both sides of the scenic vista and waterfalls at one end.

reviews.name: nancyzalzalah
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment:
Beautiful site from above another must to see
Give yourself plenty of time traffic is crazy. You don't want to miss anything

reviews.name: PrapullaChandra
reviews.title: Beautiful canyon and falls
reviews.comment: Canyon was so deep and beautiful with yellow stone. We saw it from artist point. A must visit place in yellowstone national park. Morning time is good time I guess for artist point visit, will get good photos. After noon sun will be in front of us from artist point may not get good photos. From brink of lower falls afternoon should be good.

reviews.name: AnnaMarieT917
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: This breathtaking site is s wonderful place to take pictures and to hike. Don't miss the strenuous hike to the bottom if health allows. There are spots to rest along the way but it is taxing and, if you are able, worth it.

reviews.name: alli0721
reviews.title: No words
reviews.comment: There are no words for how beautiful this place is! We could have watched the waterfall and soaked in the scenery all day. It's a hard walk down and back up, but shaded and doable with plenty of benches at every turn for those who need to sit for a spell. The hill going back up is winding but worth every pound lost

reviews.name: PhilJR70
reviews.title: Beautiful location
reviews.comment: A few of the parking lots and trails were closed for construction, but that didn't affect our trip. Artist Point was busy in the car park, but not too bad, and definitely well worth the visit - stunning view of the lower falls and valley. We did most of the trails on the other side, and although the hills back up from the falls edge were steep, it was worth the walk.

reviews.name: grandmawithabus
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: The painted canyon wall is worth the short hike and the waterfall is impressive. It was worth the short hike to go see this attraction.

reviews.name: PopUpShop
reviews.title: Dramatic Views
reviews.comment: I am NOT one for heights - I had never been to YNP as a kid, so was a little stunned & got the nasty surprise of sheer drop-offs and gorges. We came to this one and I found it scary as the passenger. My husband enjoyed the views. :0

reviews.name: Bonnie W
reviews.title: stunning view
reviews.comment: This was the second time we went there. The first time, there were so many people around. You were barely able to take a picture or have a clear view of what was downtown there. The second, maybe because we arrived in the late afternoon, only a few people were there. We could take a better look at the canyon. I will say a must go place, especially with the sunset sunshine.

reviews.name: fraserfritz
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning. A real treat to see this place.
reviews.comment:
We were blown away with this visit. I just wish that we had more time to do some of the treks . I must have taken several dozen photographs of this location.
A highly recommended visit. You will not be disappointed 👍🇺🇸

reviews.name: BDNRHarris
reviews.title: Wow
reviews.comment: This place is a must see. The falls and the power of the river carving through the rocks will take your breath away. Come early in the morning or later in the evening to avoid the crowds.

reviews.name: W G
reviews.title: Do not miss
reviews.comment:
After Old Faithful, this place probably ranks number #2 on the list. Strangely I haven't heard of this canyon prior to visiting Yellowstone but with the combination of a beautiful talls falls (twice the height of Niagara Falls), pine forest, and canyon, this is one of the most beautiful places I've ever seen and it was entirely created by nature and preserved by the national park service.
There is a north rim and south rim. The road goes fairly close to multiple sites on both rims. You can hike around both rims (short distance). You can't hike down to the canyon. If you want to see the river, go upstream to the Yellowstone lake or downstream to the hike by Tower Falls or much later driving north out of Yellowstone on highway 89.

reviews.name: CherylW_13
reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.comment: Between the colors of the canyon and perfect view of the falls this place catches your breath. We only saw the canyon and falls from one of the viewing points and cant wait to plan our next trip to do more hiking down into the canyons. This is a must do at YNP but takes at least a day to do right unless you are like us and just stop for a quick photo.

reviews.name: souzagar
reviews.title: Hike the rim
reviews.comment: This is something that I had missed during my last visit to Yellowstone and we were glad to take the time to see it during this visit. There is a trail along the rim that you can hike, take that in the direction away from the falls to avoid the larger crowds.

reviews.name: Ken K
reviews.title: Worth the Stop for sure
reviews.comment: Terrific views of waterfalls. No need to take long walks down the paths. The canyon is nice but the real attraction is the waterfalls.

reviews.name: Carol C
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: This is a must see! Some of the trails were closed but the falls were still accessible for viewing. There are several trails that take you closer to lower falls (like Red Rock). Short but steep. From artists point on the south rim, I highly recommend the Ribbon Lake trail. About .5 miles along the canyon rim. Not for the faint of heart but views of the canyon are amazing.

reviews.name: AG K
reviews.title: Awsome
reviews.comment: A must stop if you visit Yellowstone NP. Artist point is one of our favorite spot in the park. Too bad the north rim trail was closed in places for fixing.

reviews.name: Shirley D
reviews.comment: Not quite as fabulous as the Grand Canyon of Arizona but still nice. There may have been some hiking trails but we did not have the time or energy to explore.

reviews.name: RatingsfromMe
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The vistas are beautiful. The vistas provided to stop and look can get crowded. Going early morning is more enjoyable with the less crowded.

reviews.name: TedinAppleton
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning
reviews.comment: I highly recommend the ranger talk for this. They make what is already a beautiful experience even more fun. Remember, if you are deaf you can order a sign interpreter 3 weeks in advance. Wear comfortable shoes and bring the best camera you can afford. I can see why early explorers were so amazed with this location.

reviews.name: Kayewillis
reviews.title: Beautiful spot
reviews.comment: Wow, what a view. No trip to Yellowstone would be complete without a trip to Artist Point. I hope I someday can return

reviews.name: Jayant K
reviews.title: Wonder no more why it is called Yellowstone
reviews.comment: If you ever wondered why it is called the Yellowstone, visit to this canyon will answer that question. Not obvious in other parts for Yellowstone, NP, the yellow (and other color rocks) carved out and exposed by the Yellowstone river falls are quite a sight. Be sure to visit the Artist Point on the East side, as well as all the vista points on the west at Upper and Lower Falls. View will of course vary as the day progresses. Mornings are likely to be clear with clouds (and thunderstorms) rolling in later in the day.

reviews.name: FroilineMaria
reviews.title: Great site
reviews.comment: Must see . Little busy but just needed to wait a short minute to get a better view . Bit view is unbelievable. Must see

reviews.name: TravelReviewer1983
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone can be described in many ways.
I would simply recommend you go see it yourself.
Truly unmissable!

reviews.name: john b
reviews.title: Better than the Grand Canyon?
reviews.comment:
Real close. Absolutely Beautiful! More for me too say, no, except TripAdvisor wants me to.
Just go and see. No one in Yellowstone can't miss this.

reviews.name: F. Scalfaro
reviews.title: The Grand Canyon of the West
reviews.comment: You must include this on your stops! This is a fantastic sight to see and experience. Plenty of spots for great pictures.

reviews.name: BCofOC
reviews.title: Truly a Sight to See
reviews.comment: A big surprise for us to realize how spectacular Canyon was within the Park. The trails are well marked and in some areas surprising close to the canyon rim. There are guided tours along the trails. The Canyon is surprisingly deep, steep and narrow. This is also a very popular area and parking can be horrific. Plan for an early morning visit to get ahead of the crowds.

reviews.name: Nicole C
reviews.title: Quite the hike back to the top, but the view is worth it
reviews.comment: Absolutely gorgeous views no matter where you hike from, as there are two different paths to take down the canyon.

reviews.name: eke-ono
reviews.title: Another must see
reviews.comment: Another beautiful part of the park. There are a few spots that you can stop to view the valley, waterfall and river

reviews.name: Rebecca S
reviews.title: Fantastic vistas
reviews.comment: A don't miss, must see attraction. Best to view from several different surrounding vantage points to get the full impact. Suggest going in the morning rather than afternoon for best photos due to shadows late in the day.

reviews.name: David B
reviews.title: Named after the Yellow Lava
reviews.comment:
Yellowstone National Park
Before a visit you really have to do some research. The ideal is to stay in the park, which takes a year of lead time or guts and luck. We are always impressed at the quality and service provided by the NPS. Our nation does some things well.
I think it's important to plan the spots you really want to see. Plan on picnics and several hikes. Without planning you will spend too much time in a car. Our favorite was the canyon at the upper and lower falls. Truly amazing, it explains why the park is named Yellowstone.
With no reservations, we found cancellations at several of the prime resorts. That's the guts and luck part. If you find nothing, your forced to stay at one of the fringe towns outside the parks entrance. This option increases your drive time and many of the accommodations are also filled during the summer season. Not the easiest NP to enjoy but well worth the effort.

reviews.name: Hugh F
reviews.title: Great views,but crowded
reviews.comment: Musts do and get out and see all the overlooks. If physically able, you must to the brink of the falls hikes. Breathtaking!

reviews.name: Alex W
reviews.title: Unexpectedly spectacular
reviews.comment: This really is quite astonishing - a surprisingly deep canyon worthy of its name. There are several viewpoints and each one offers breath-taking views. Well worth the crush of other tourists and packed car parks - try and get there early!

reviews.name: HotelierJohn
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: Great views from Artist Point. Parking is a pain because too many drivers block the flow while waiting for another car to back out and leave.

reviews.name: R M
reviews.title: A must see on your Yellowstone trip
reviews.comment: This was absolutely breathtaking!! We hiked down to the bottom to get a closer look at the waterfall - truly spectacular!

reviews.name: Laura C
reviews.title: Awesome view
reviews.comment: Absolutely beautiful. Visited early evening which led to great lighting for pictures. Busiest time for visiting is 10-4 so try to visit before or after

reviews.name: Mark D
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This part of the park is definitely worth seeing. Plenty to see right off the loop or hike a little to see more. Worth a stop

reviews.name: Harishuv29
reviews.title: Must visit preferably in during sun set
reviews.comment: Awesome Artists Point South Rim Don't miss it. You will see why Yellow stone gets its name. The beautiful waterfall and the Yellowstone river cutting into the Canyon with Yellow Stones is a remarkable sight

reviews.name: Elyse D
reviews.title: Stunning, well worth visiting!
reviews.comment: We loved this. Really nice walkway around (took maybe 15 mins in total, including photo time). Stunning views.

reviews.name: Simon B
reviews.title: Stunning drives along both rims of this incredible canyon
reviews.comment: The yellow stone of Yellowstone Canyon gives its name to the park, and for good reason. It is a breathtaking sight which can be enjoyed from a series of viewpoints (with ample parking) along both rims. The waterfall at the head of the canyon can be viewed from several locations along either rim, the best probably being Grand View. Artist Point, Lookout Point, Grand View and Upper Falls View are all well worth a visit to get a different perspective on this extraordinary canyon. When we visited the points on the north rim were significantly less busy than on the south, but this could just be a quirk of wherever the many coachloads of tourists happened to be at the time!

reviews.name: nbrownlaw
reviews.title: Beautiful vistas
reviews.comment: The view of this massive canyon from above is gorgeous. Loads of rock formations, the forest that runs right up to the rim, all combine for an inspirational view.

reviews.name: hannah_wollbrink
reviews.title: Favorite view in Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: If visiting Yellowstone, viewing the Grand Canyon is an absolute must. Uncle Tom's Trail was closed when we visited, but was highly recommended by family friends.

reviews.name: Ellesbells742
reviews.title: Amazingly Beautiful
reviews.comment: Watching the river cascade over the falls into the canyon is amazing. But more so because of the sparkling colors of the canyon. What a site!!! Go see it.

reviews.name: Marjorie E
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: One of the most amazing sites anywhere. We took an easy walk to artists point for this view. Not too crowded on a busy day. Go about 9:45 am and you might see a rainbow over the falls.

reviews.name: MphsQueen
reviews.title: Traveling with a Toddler and Infant
reviews.comment: As we had a toddler we knew we couldn't hike the canyon area and knew the viewpoints had steep drop offs. But there was a turnout with a stone wall that was appropriate for stopping with much better views than the main viewing area.

reviews.name: Matthijs T
reviews.title: South Rim Drive and North Rim Drive
reviews.comment: Great views. We especially enjoyed Artist Point which had a nice view of the falls. South Rim drive was nicer than north.

reviews.name: Sylvia S
reviews.title: Breath taking view
reviews.comment: There are several views . I loved the view at artist point . I had my parents with me and they could not walk to far so this one was perfect for them plus It was an amazing site

reviews.name: Colin M
reviews.title: Briiliant
reviews.comment: A photograpphers delight and offers far more to see than some of the much more publicised areas. Many of the sights along the way are very easy to reach

reviews.name: aprilstein
reviews.title: WOW!!!!! Beautiful
reviews.comment:
Starting at the Wapiti picnic area we hiked easy trails that brought us through mountain meadows, and to a view of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. Hiking made it more special. The walk was 7 miles, but essentially was flat, and easy walking.
The Falls are breathtaking, and totally worth the hike.
You can also get there by car, but walking there through the natural scenery was worth the trip!

reviews.name: Stan V
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This whole area is just beautiful and worth seeing! This was an excellent highlight for this trip. It is a must see area.

reviews.name: Susie W
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring Views!
reviews.comment: Summer 2017,with all the renovation work being done to the roads and parking areas around the Canyon, it can be frustrating to get near the rim and the open viewpoints. But don't skip them! They're among the most beautiful, inspiring sites in the park. Get there early- like 7:00 a.m. early- to have your pick of parking spots, photo ops and trails. Morning 'Must See's' open now on the South Rim: 1) entire Artist's Point viewing area, all 3 levels offer different views 2) a walk of any length on the trail to Point Sublime (many points along this path that we label 'Point Good Enough' if not enough time to do the entire trail!) Afternoon/Evening Must See's open on the North Rim are: 1) Upper Falls Overlook and 2) Inspiration Point. If you go when everything is open again, visit everything on the map on both rims- you won't regret it. Spend the night, go to the North Rim during afternoon/evening and do the South Rim in the morning for the best light for photos. Opinions vary on this, but we've been coming here since the 70's & our pictures tell the story.

reviews.name: Beachgalxo
reviews.title: Just Beautiful
reviews.comment: We used Yellowstone Alpine Guides for an all day guided tour of the lower loop which included this site. They were great as was the site!

reviews.name: DanielPofMI
reviews.title: Best sight in the park!
reviews.comment: Yellowstone is full of natural wonders, but the Grand Canyon is at the top. There are different points to view it from, but Artist Point is an absolute must if you want to get the shot on all the postcards. Get there early, like before 9am, if you want to make it easy to find a parking space. Also, it put's the morning light on the falls for a better picture. There's a chance of a rainbow, too, around 9:30-10am, over the falls. There are basically 3 drives with stops you need to make to see the canyon area, all very close to each other. One is South Rim Drive, which includes Uncle Tom's Trail (currently closed for repairs) and Artist Point. The next is Brink of the Upper Falls. The third is North Rim Drive, which includes Lookout Point, Grand View, and Inspiration Point (also currently closed). All the drives come off of the Grand Loop Road, and are basically just 5-10 minutes away from the Canyon Village area where there is dining, a general store, and a visitor center.

reviews.name: Gina A
reviews.title: Artist Point a Must see!
reviews.comment: If you go no where else you must go to Artists Point - it is spectacular! You can see the falls, a great view of the falls deep down in the canyon, the beautiful colors of the rock and many Opsrey nests if you have binoculars. And Please take binoculars so you can experience the full effect. And go early in the day if you want to avoid the summer crowds.

reviews.name: Katy M
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: We got there in the evening and there was plenty of parking. We chose not to do the hikes. We did get out and look at a lot of the over looks. Worth the drive. Got some great shots.

reviews.name: jeanb1876
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY BREATHTAKING
reviews.comment:
Living in Arizona, I was rather offended to having anything else classified as a "Grand Canyon" since we have the "real" one! Wow, was I surprised and humbled! This area of Yellowstone definitely deserves to be called "Grand." While very different from the "other" Grand Canyon, it is equally spectacular in its own right.
Go early; it gets very crowded at the pull offs later in the day. Walk around and experience the beauty and majesty from various vantage points and various trails. It is one of the most impressive sites in Yellowstone. Take it from an original Grand Canyon snob, you'll be delighted you spent time at this beautiful site!

reviews.name: IndyLiz2013
reviews.title: Don't miss this attraction at Yellowstone National Park
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a MAJOR highlight of any trip to this National Park. It is not visited as much as Old Faithful but it is easily as spectacular to behold!!!
Take the short walk from beginning to end but DO NOT take any photos until you start to trek back to the beginning of the trail. It just gets prettier as you move along. Do not miss this lovely attraction. It only takes a short time but there is MUCH to take in along the way!!!!

reviews.name: Lee T
reviews.title: Great scenery
reviews.comment: This was one of the highlights of Yellowstone. This area is very busy with limited parking. Plan on doing some walking to get good views. The best views are from the lower viewing areas.

reviews.name: wongchizzle
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: This was one of the "wow" moments in YSP. It was raining hard that day so we could not stay very long. From the parking lot, you can take a short walk to the viewpoints along there and check out the beautiful views. Must see!

reviews.name: LKJames
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: We headed to the south rim drive, since the view was supposed to better, but uncle Tom's trail (The classic view) was closed for renovation. We drove to end, artist's point, that was an easy stroll from the parking lot, and the view was definitely worth it!

reviews.name: C V
reviews.title: Great Experience
reviews.comment: We had the opportunity to visit Yellowstone National Park and found it a wonderful place to visit. We did the whole tour and all were amazed at Mother Nature at work. Great visit, recommend it to all.

reviews.name: A_0326
reviews.title: Amazing!! A must stop point.
reviews.comment: The beauty of this pace takes your breath away. I consider this a "must stop" point. You can park at several different places along the way as you get to see and appreciate the magnificence of the canyon. In peak hours day during summer time it can be challenging to find a spot as parking is limited but if you are patient you always find one. The stop is not long (stop, go take a look, take pictures.. admire the place.. then off to the next) so there is always someone leaving every few minutes. We personally found that the best times are before 10 am and after 4 pm, and you also get the benefit of not catching the heat as much either if you come early (and is summer time). You can (of course) drive there at any time but expect crowds between 10 am & 4 pm so patience is key. Remember to park in designated areas as Park Rangers and Patrols are always around.

reviews.name: ack114
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: Parking was limited in lots due to crowds and some trails under renovation but the beauty surpassed the crowds. Definitely go to all areas.

reviews.name: vacationmom56
reviews.title: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing - like a postcard
reviews.comment: We were awestruck by the beauty of this area. We saw both sides of the canyon and would advise visitors to do the same. We would have loved to have hiked along the canyon, but all the trails were closed. There is parking on both sides, although the eastern side is more crowded, with less parking.
