Be patient and parking spaces will open up. Viewing the canyon does not take that long on that side. Some of our pictures look like postcards, like it is not real. Just amazing.

reviews.name: Prescott2007
reviews.title: Excellent Views
reviews.comment: Yellowstone National Park has much to offer and one of the must see places is the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. It's a highly visited place so expect traffic and perhaps a search for a parking place. Park police patrol the area so be careful where you park! It's a short walk from the parking lot to the Canyon and well worth the time. There are excellent views of the falls and the canyon from the South side of the loop. We did not do the north loop of spend anytime at the Canyon Village. A must see.

reviews.name: Jared E
reviews.title: Coolest area of the park!
reviews.comment: This was one of the neatest things to see in the park. we loved it and the waterfall was amazing. Easy hiking around it. make sure you check out both the lower and upper part of the canyon to get the entire view. well worth every minute it takes to get there. (go early, no one in yellowstone does anything until 9 a.m. so if you get to anything early there is no traffic)

reviews.name: James B
reviews.title: My favorite spot in Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
Incredible canyon with amazing colors and multiple viewing locations.
The hike down is well worth the view of the waterfall and down the canyon.

reviews.name: Winslow5289
reviews.title: Super crowded
reviews.comment: Like lots of the Yellowstone highlights, this is packed. Not enough parking and lots of people unaware of those around them. That said, it's an absolutely gorgeous view and worth the chaos.

reviews.name: Stomper81
reviews.title: Grand is Right
reviews.comment: Our last stop at Yellowstone and what a Grand Vista! We hiked down to the top of the waterfall and it was well worth it!! A must see area that shouldn't be past up!!!

reviews.name: PeggyM85614
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone OK but no comparison to the real Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Steep Cliffs and a higher background of pine trees. You could see the river down at the bottom flowing through. Nice view but not quite likely Grand Canyon in Arizona.

reviews.name: LR1905
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: A little crowded, but that is to be expected with the view. Great picture taking place. Would love to paint it.

reviews.name: Peggy R
reviews.title: What a view!
reviews.comment: So different from what you expect in Yellowstone, this is a double waterfall that cuts through the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone river. Saw a badger as an extra bonus!

reviews.name: wrenworks
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: No photo can capture the intensity of the depth, the color, the vastness of this beautiful place. Go early or you'll have crowds to contend with- parking is limited. Bring your camera and spend some time soaking it all in.

reviews.name: Skipper090
reviews.title: Second only to the Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Worth the trip just to see this. You really must see every part of the North Rim (extremely crowded), Brink of the Falls (literally hanging on the edge of the Falls) and South Rim, all within a couple of miles. If you can make it, take one of the trails down into the Canyon (very steep and narrow and probably a 700' drop - think 40+ stories.) You may wait 15 or more minutes for a parking space on the North Rim Loop. Spaces open up further along, but everyone just waits for one in the first lot! Walk the rim trail - if it gets too steep, walk along the road for that part. FYI: Inspiration Point is closed indefinitely - looks like it was falling into the Canyon! Uncle Toms is also closed for a major renovation so a spectacular set of stairs into the Canyon is closed..

reviews.name: Loganberrykai
reviews.title: Hi light of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: We saw Yellowstone as a part of a Backroads tour group. Yellowstone is overrun by so many tourists and majority of them are not American. I do not care for crowds! The best part of Yellowstone is the Canyon where there is less people. We hiked along the cliff side of the Canyon and it was beautiful. If I had to choose between the Tetons and Yellowstone, I would definitely choose the Tetons... the other 4 families traveling with this tour agreed.

reviews.name: Dianne S
reviews.title: Deep
reviews.comment: Parking difficult. Good views but paths a bit tricky. Quite crowded.Signage wasn't the best as how to go

reviews.name: Andy810
reviews.title: Outstanding!!
reviews.comment:
If you're in Yellowstone and you don't see this then you will surely have missed out. Just do it!
Artists point is s great vantage point.

reviews.name: Tricia W
reviews.title: What a view & an incredible hike!!!
reviews.comment: Hiked the south rim ( uncle toms path was closed) but walked around the rim. Breathtaking views!! Take the time for this hike it will not disappoint!! I promise😍

reviews.name: krg999
reviews.title: Our favorite
reviews.comment: Just amazing views and beauty. Must stop. Many overlooks and just breath taking views. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds and tour buses.

reviews.name: Barbara J
reviews.title: A must see but be aware of altitude if you hike down!!
reviews.comment: We hiked to the lowest level (Inspiration Point is closed for repairs until 2018) and really loved seeing the force and power of the falls so close!!! The rainbow is always there and usually a double one. Great camera shots. Just remember you have to climb back up to get to the parking area. Make sure you take water and hydrate both ways. The hike is switch backs but still difficult for anyone who is not use to hiking or who has mobility issues.

reviews.name: mollyham4
reviews.title: First view of canyons - wow
reviews.comment: Truly is Grand Canyon of Yellowstone but more in tune with Bryce Canyon. Artist's Point was gorgeous and if you have the energy and time then follow some of the trails. It's best to get there as early as possible and make sure you stop at the beautiful Lower Falls.

reviews.name: Floridalesters
reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.comment: The long walk down was great! My phone registered a 48 story drop. The top of the falls was a highlight in the Park!

reviews.name: jdeereman68
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: The best place to view this canyon is Artist's Point. Beautiful view of the canyon and Lower Falls. A must see!

reviews.name: TheMaven2u
reviews.title: I liked this better than the Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Take a photo with the falls and canyon behind you and it will be your best photo of your entire vacation. Get there early or you will wait to even get into the lot to search for a parking spot. Well worth any effort you need to put into it, though.

reviews.name: HappyOnez
reviews.title: Awesome views (and visit the big Grand Canyon too :-)=
reviews.comment:
This a truly a wonderful spot to go to when in Yellowstone. Parking can be iffy if you don't get there early.
If this is your first visit, perhaps consider spending a few dollars and take the Yellowstone in a Day tour and let the tour driver worry about parking, plus they will tell you sooo much more about the park.

reviews.name: dave9956
reviews.title: Best attraction in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This remains the best attraction in Yellowstone. Breathtaking views of the water falls and an incredible canyon. Lots of places to take pictures and enjoy this natural wonder.

reviews.name: Kjwachtel
reviews.title: Must See
reviews.comment:
Do not miss. At the rim you can see the river and the upper falls, which are beautiful. Don't pass up the hike to the river level and the crest of the lower falls, which also gives you an extraordinary view of the canyon. It is a steep and fairly strenuous hike down and back-take your time, it is definitely worth it.
Then on the way out, stop at the lookout where you can see the entire lower falls, it also provides you with another beautiful view of the canyon.

reviews.name: MinnGirl2010
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: I never knew this place existed! Really beautiful but supervise young children. We had the pleasure of viewing the osprey best with two young chicks. Quite cool.

reviews.name: kxz255
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: There are 2 water falls you can see from the trail. They are magnificent. So is the canyon. One of the trail goes to the bottom of the canyon in front of lower falls. But it is quite an exercise to climb up back to the parking lot.

reviews.name: Linda A
reviews.title: breathtaking
reviews.comment: I took over 300 pictures in this area. The colors and water are breathtaking. I was amazed at falls and split my time between taking photo after photo and just taking it in.

reviews.name: ANParish
reviews.title: Don't miss it!
reviews.comment: We had only half a day in Yellowstone, and the two can't-miss spots were Old Faithful and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. Traffic might be heavy especially if there is wildlife on the roads (We were in a bison-related traffic jam for about 45 minutes), but take the drive around the loop from Old Faithful to the Canyon - you won't regret it! There are many areas you can stop, park, and get out for different angles of the falls. There are walking paths that take you even closer although we didn't have time to go on them. No matter what you do in Yellowstone, make sure the Grand Canyon is part of it!

reviews.name: Jeroen T
reviews.title: One of the best National Parks in the U.S.A.!
reviews.comment:
Awesome park with much natural wonders to see e.g. geysers, hot pots, colored fields etc. Be sure to take a few hikes as well as bears, elks, buffalo and osprey can be spotted quite easily. I can see why this park was the first to be denominated as a National Park!
Definitely spend a few days here!

reviews.name: ClioCO
reviews.title: Spectacular scenery, don't miss.
reviews.comment: Worth the effort to view falls from Red Rock trail and platform. Take water, wear good walking or hiking shoes/boots. Kids may need extra time to rest during the walk.

reviews.name: Stefan B
reviews.title: Absolute impressive
reviews.comment: The North Rim and South Rim of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon are worth it for a stop. Breathtaking scenery!

reviews.name: Pchee72
reviews.title: Majestic Waterful
reviews.comment: The canyon is full of beautiful color and huge rock formations! The waterfall is magnificent. Along the ride there are signs showing how old the rock formations are, some as old as 400,000,000 million years. So hard to comprehend. It is an amazing site to behold!

reviews.name: Danielle C
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: This is a must see. Both Falls and the Grand Canyon had to be one of the most gorgeous sights in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: nbkda64
reviews.title: Stunning views
reviews.comment: We lucked out and were there in late afternoon. It was still busy but we easily found a parking spot. Only sorry Inspirational Point was closed.

reviews.name: tk22x1
reviews.title: A spectacular view
reviews.comment:
Not as grand as "the Grand Canyon" of the Colorado River, but still a very impressive site.
Read about the geology of its formation given on the display boards, particularly about the bank that are lined at the top with a "rock fence".

reviews.name: Ann Marie F
reviews.title: Bison Santuary
reviews.comment: Come see the majestic Bison in Lamar Valley! We visited during rut, so saw lots of running and action. Be prepared for Bison crossing the road or for slowed traffic - it is their park! It is truly amazing to see these animals so close!

reviews.name: laurenvill
reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.comment: It is busy and parking means waiting, but the view is beautiful. Lots of tourists and people trying to get into a small space.

reviews.name: gypsy039
reviews.title: A real "Wow" moment
reviews.comment: This was my favorite spot in the Yellowstone Park for the stunning scenery and it was a real "Wow" moment, beautiful & I got some amazing photos- make sure you stop here, there is good parking but at the busy season it can be tricky to get one.

reviews.name: cammikey .
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: The subtle colors yet the majestic background is so beautiful. I've been to the Grand Canyon in Arizona and it is mind blowing, this is totally different yet it's still worth a visit. The waterfall is fantastic and it's very easy to get a top notch view. This is a must see in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Tehreem T
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Its one of the best views of Yellowstone! We went in the first week of August, it wasn't that crowded. The view is simply mesmerizing. Do not miss this one if you are traveling to Yellowstone!

reviews.name: Peterpoes
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon and the lower falls are just breathtaking. Great spots from as well the north as the south rim. A walk down to the roaring water is absolutely a must.
Just be carefull in summertime: a long line of cars might be ahead of you (like yesterday) to park at the only parking lot. I turned around, way too crowded.
Early spring and September, October are way calmer and the light is still gorgeous.
A must when visiting the park!

reviews.name: Baseballgirl1975
reviews.title: AWESOME!!
reviews.comment: It was POURING when we arrived, but my husband braved the weather to go see it. He said he couldn't even describe it. I wished I would have gotten out of the car to take a look, now I only get to see what he saw in a picture.

reviews.name: 1805bob
reviews.title: Visit from both sides - wonderful
reviews.comment: Correctly the top rated place in Yellowstone, with beautiful views and an ever changing scenery. While "the" Grand Canyon is spectacular and awesome based on size and scale, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone seems more personal and beautiful. Do not miss its wonderful falls and so many different views.

reviews.name: 1busyman
reviews.title: Just stop by !
reviews.comment: Plan on spending some time at this stop. It's absolutely beautiful! Great place for a photo or two and you will see wildlife all around the roads leading to this area of the park!

reviews.name: John B
reviews.title: Scenic
reviews.comment: Driving the great loop road requires patience. It is common to have long delays for animals wandering on the highway or road work. The pullouts for attractions are always full and crowded, parking can be a challenge, especially for large vehicles pulling travel trailers and motor homes. The traffic in the park is starting to overwhelm the parks ability to accommodate it. Some of the heavily traveled trails around the attractions are in disrepair. Yellowstone is where cultures collide. Be ready to encounter bus loads of foreign visitors that don't have time to respect your space, their goal is to quickly get their pictures and get back to the bus. So sit back and relax put your favorite music on the IPOD. It's all part of the experience.

reviews.name: 19er
reviews.title: Stop Here
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon is one of the prettiest places in the park. It's a very short walk to the vista area although there are three sets of stairs on the path. Not good for baby strollers but for even a poor hiker, it's an easy walk.
The Canyon is not the size or colors of the real one but it's majestic and a real treasure. Absolutely worth a stop. Great picture taking sight.

reviews.name: Andi T
reviews.title: So cool!
reviews.comment: We took the north rim scenic drive and stopped at Lookout Point. It had good parking and was a short walk to the observation spot. We heard the falls before we saw them, and they were amazing! What a view!

reviews.name: Rich L
reviews.title: Highlight of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Simply the most scenic area of Yellowstone. Having been here before about 40 years ago, it still takes your breath away! Pictures can't do it justice as it looks like a painting. Multiple short hikes around the canyon area, but still very good views from the lookouts. Along with the animal viewing, best part of Yellowstone!

reviews.name: KMW-FL
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: No it's not as breathtaking as the 'real' Grand Canyon, but it is beautiful with very amazing views. As with all 'stops' in the Park, it can be crowded in the parking area, but so worth the stop. Enjoy the waterfalls.

reviews.name: Leighann Z
reviews.title: Amazing views of the canyon and waterfalls
reviews.comment: There are several opportunities for viewing the canyon but the best, and hardest to get to, is the brink of the lower falls. This walk is a 600 foot drop in elevation with many switchbacks on pavement that is sandy and broken up. We braved the walk and were so happy we did. Standing on the brink of the falls and looking out at the canyon as the river winds through the canyon walls is amazing. This is not a walk for anyone that has trouble going up and down hills without side rails. Wear sneakers or hiking shoes, not sandals! There are other spots that are easier to access along the rim but the best is the lower falls.

reviews.name: Stephanie M
reviews.title: Serene
reviews.comment: This is a nice, quiet stop along the winding roads of Yellowstone. There is a boardwalk along the ridge and one you can walk down to get closer into the canyon. All you hear are the birds chirping and the riveting rushing. Very beautiful stop!

reviews.name: Crystal S
reviews.title: A Quick Must Stop - Get Here Early
reviews.comment: The view here is beautiful. The massive canyon, huge waterfall at the end and colors of the rock here just have to be seen in person. My husband and I arrived somewhat early (7-8 am) and it was already starting to get pretty busy and I think this is a pretty popular spot so if you really want to spend a lot of time here and get it to yourself you'd need to go early. It does have a pretty big parking lot and a two leveled lookout platform. In my opinion, this is a quick stop but a must stop! You won't be sorry for battling the crowds even.

reviews.name: KLK0829
reviews.title: if you are pressed for time, choose something else
reviews.comment: This canyon isn't even pretty, but then again I have seen the Real Grand Canyon. It is near a upper and lower waterfalls if you wish to stop and see them. But if you are pressed for time, I would skip the canyons. Plus during tourist season it is SUPER crowded.

reviews.name: Twinsmom310
reviews.title: Beautiful area
reviews.comment: This area was one of the most beautiful areas I thought in Yellowstone. The view was incredible. Would highly recommend a stop here.

reviews.name: Udoggie
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment:
You will see an amazing cross-section of the geology of Yellowstone. It's not as large as its cousin to the south, but is just as spectacular.
Its much less crowded than other attractions at Yellowstone, but shouldn't be missed.
If you want to take a little hike, there is a nice trail from near the Canyon Lodge that leads to the lookout for the canyon.

reviews.name: Lisa J
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is Absolutely Beautiful
reviews.comment: Make sure you check out the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone National Park while you are there. It is very accessible, you can drive either the North or South rim road. It is very easy to pull off and walk back a little bit and take some pictures. We visited both rims. You get different views of the waterfalls from each rim. Our favorite was "Artist's Point" at the South Rim. There is a fabulous view of the waterfall from there. We had a perfect day with beautiful blue skies above which contrasted just right with the earthy tones of the canyon. Just stunning.

reviews.name: Robin K
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: Even though a good part of the south rim was closed, we were able to get a good view of the fall from the south rim. We had intended to hike, but the route we initially chose was closed. The ranger was able to give us a great alternative to hike from Artist's Point to Point Sublime. The hike was about 7 mi rd trip. There were lots of great views of the Canyon along the way, though we were a bit disappointed of the view from Point Sublime. There were definitely better views on the hike up than from Point Sublime.

reviews.name: Bill N
reviews.title: Get there early morning
reviews.comment: Gorgeous views, 8 am the buses, campers, dangerous drivers and vandals are up yet and you get a truly enjoyable experience if one of a kind creation.

reviews.name: Ahtrio
reviews.title: Expansive Views that Make You Feel Small
reviews.comment:
Stop here. Take a moment to realize the sheer beauty in the landscape that surrounds you. Listen to the water moving. Take it all in.
Tips:
- parking can be tricky once the crowds start pouring in. We found the parking lots to be the easiest to maneuver before 10:30am.
- walk along the various paths to get different perspectives of Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
- leave the selfie sticks in the car... they're annoying!

reviews.name: SFTRVLR
reviews.title: Gorgeous- one of the more majestic things at Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Yellowstone is amazing for the geologic formations,etc. But, it's not really very majestic. This is the one exception- breathtaking scenery. Make sure you go EARLY to avoid the immense crowds, and view it from several different angles.

reviews.name: Imma B
reviews.title: Dramatic
reviews.comment: Great landscape. The colours, the water, the nature are extraordinary. It's a place to visit and enjoy it

reviews.name: cmariert
reviews.title: What a surprise!
reviews.comment: I didn't know this place existed! We stopped with our tour group and a short walk up some steps and I was amazed at the view! You can view the falls from the side if you can't make it up the steps- but if you can- awesome view! I believe bathrooms are available if needed.

reviews.name: SWVA_Traveler
reviews.title: Wow what a canyon!
reviews.comment: I haven't been to THE Grand Canyon, so for now this will be my wow experience. Truly, though, it's the Lower Falls that steals the show. What a spectacle! The size and power of this waterfall is just amazing. We hiked Uncle Tom's Trail, starting at Artist Point due to the closure of the closer parking lot. This created a traffic situation, but all was forgiven once we parked and began to get glimpses of this canyon.

reviews.name: UltraLimitedTraveler
reviews.title: Must do the Brink and Uncle Tom's Trail while there
reviews.comment: Yeah, it's nice to get a glimpse of the falls and canyon, but if you're physically able, you absolutely must do The Brink and Uncle Tom's Trail. Those are both Bucket List experiences. You don't have to be an athlete;just take it easy and you can do both in just a few hours.

reviews.name: Texcoug
reviews.title: Unbelievable Views - Spectacular
reviews.comment:
Just completely blown away by the views of the canyon and falls. We did the hike down to the falls overlook - we just sat and stared down the canyon, seeing the ribbon of the river while the falls poured over next to us.
The hike down was fairly steep but lots of switchbacks - so everyone can basically do it.

reviews.name: John-frae-Banff
reviews.title: Astonishing
reviews.comment: We visited twice - early morning and late evening. On the second occasion we saw an osprey nest with chicks. Superb!

reviews.name: fiddlestogo
reviews.title: must see
reviews.comment: Every visitor to Yellowstone should visit the Canyon. The overlooks are often full of tourists (go early or late). But, the lookouts are wonderful. If you have a chance, walk between a few of the lookouts or even just several hundred yards before or after the lookouts. You'll probably find yourself almost by yourself. They are constantly working on roads and trails, it is a very real possibility that some of this area will be closed.

reviews.name: nkm615
reviews.title: Our FAVORITE in all of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Worth every stop and every overlook, especially beautiful in the evening when the yellow stone is so yellow!

reviews.name: brooksgallery
reviews.title: Worth the wait...
reviews.comment: It was so beautiful to see the different colors of rock and sand with the falls. Parking was really hard and a wait but it is really worth it to see God's beauty!

reviews.name: Pam G
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: We hiked to the upper and lower falls. We even saw a longhorn sheep. The is a steep walk down on uneven paths, but well worth the effort. The kids are 10 and 11 and did great.

reviews.name: boomervsmom
reviews.title: Worth it!
reviews.comment: By far the most awe inspiring sight for us in Yellowstone. The trails to the upper and lower falls are not for the faint hearted but totally worth it! Such beauty and magnificence! Come early! The crowds get a little crazy as the day progresses.

reviews.name: Wicto
reviews.title: Put this attraction on your plan punch list
reviews.comment:
The canyon view is a must see. Be prepared for Disney sized crowds. The viewing area is just a short ~100 meter walk from the parking lot which is crowded requiring us to ‘spin for a spot’ around the parking to a few times to secure an open parking spot. There is a walking trail that extends out of the main viewing area that is a leisurely walk with magnificent views. I figure less than 10% of overall visitors walk this trail so it’s a wonderful opportunity to see the sights away from the masses.
The views from both sides of the canyon are simply unforgettable!

reviews.name: soldbyshahla
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: Stopping at several viewpoints will give you the experience. We did not do the whole rim. Gods country!

reviews.name: Erica C
reviews.title: So wonderful!
reviews.comment: My partner and I have both previously been to Yellowstone but had not visited the falls. It was wonderful! How have we missed it all the times before! The hike down is worth the views!

reviews.name: Howieboy
reviews.title: What a sight
reviews.comment: I've seen the Grand Canyon, but the colors of Yellowstone Grand Canyon are spectacular. The falls are beautiful. A must see. easy access I was on scooter, very busy this time of year, but patience is the game,

reviews.name: teach1990
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: This is a must see in Yellowstone! The colors were amazing! It was almost as beautiful as the real Grand Canyon!

reviews.name: Mcaltom
reviews.title: Whole area was great, get there really early
reviews.comment: Unfortunately the south rim was closed for construction, but we were able to pull off and see several points of interest anyway. The canyon was very cool, loved the multiple waterfalls. It was not too busy. We stayed in Cody and left at 5 am to get in the park. Did this for two days and tried to see the busy things before 12 and spent the afternoons in more quite areas. When we drove back past this at 2 in the afternoon, there was no way to even get in. Go Early!

reviews.name: EJW3
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the most beautiful places in Yellowstone National Park and it is a sight not to be missed. The waterfalls are amazing and the colors of the canyon walls are unbelievable and beautiful. Artist Point is one of the best places to see the canyon and the falls and the lookout point is only a short walk from the parking lot. The area can get very crowded, but it is worth visiting.

reviews.name: Allisonspring
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: Worth the view and the hikes that are open. The pounding of the water takes your breath away. Very large waterfall with gorgeous canyon scenery. Well worth a trip if you are in the area

reviews.name: Helio1806
reviews.title: What a place!
reviews.comment: I was told this was the reason to Yellowstone become a national park. No doubt it's worth. Put it in your wish list.

reviews.name: luv2trvl1986
reviews.title: Quite a site
reviews.comment: The lookout gives a bird’s eye view of the canyon. It was cool to see actual birds flying at our level and swooping into the canyon.

reviews.name: Elsa C. L
reviews.title: Pleasantly overwhelming vistas and plenty of exercise
reviews.comment:
Artists point and Sublime Point in the South Rim of the Canyon, Brink of Upper Falls, Brink of Lower Falls, Red Rock Point and Grand View in the North Rim all offer varying vantage points of the Canyon, the mighty Falls and the Yellowstone River. Except for the Artists Point, Brink of Upper Falls and Grand View, the rest requires a long and relatively challenging hikes, especially the Brink of Lower Falls; however, each one is a must see!
The Sublime Point, in my humble opinion is over rated. Reaching the end of the .5 mile rugged trail and seeing the view made me exclaim "That' it?". Along the trail from Artists to Sublime Point, there are several pleasantly overwhelming view angles of the canyon and Yellowstone River.
Despite the fact that Uncle Tom's Trail is under maintenance and, therefore, closed, our number of steps for the day exceeded 17,000. We hiked to the Red Rock Point on another day.
Food at the Canyon Village is good with healthy choices. The pulled park sandwich with salad is delicious.

reviews.name: Dana K
reviews.title: Not the REAL Grand Canyon but lovely just the same!
reviews.comment: Highly recommend this hike from Artist Point to Inspiration Point. It's not the destination per se it's all along the way the view of the river and falls and nature! It wasn't too strenuous and actually gets you away from all the people at Artist Point. The parking lot is small there.

reviews.name: DavisFamily_2004
reviews.title: Wow just wow
reviews.comment: We did the Grand Canyon this year and this is still a sight to see! The falls, the canyon, Yellowstone river, all amazing. I'd recommend artist point for sure!! Then walk towards observation point if only for a little over to get a few more points of view of it all!!

reviews.name: AndreaWM
reviews.title: View from South side
reviews.comment: All view are incredible but the South loop was great. Also be sure to do the hikes to the waterfall lookouts.

reviews.name: TigerGordon
reviews.title: An absolute MUST see
reviews.comment: This place is a must see along with old faithful. The views of the falls are amazing. The first turnoff is for the basin view. It is a bit of hike if you have difficulty walking. We prefer to go up to the second area where you can get a look at the falls from the top. Seems like most folks try to get into the first area perhaps without knowing about what's ahead so there were fewer people at the top lookout. We were disappointed that inspiration point was closed. It has some amazing views as well. We visited here 25 years ago on our honeymoon - it was definitely worth coming back to see.

reviews.name: SueGtoo
reviews.title: It is a mini-me of the Grand Canyon.
reviews.comment: It is not the Grand Canyon, but it is awesome and beautiful with its water falls, colorful carved rock sides, and the river flowing through the bottom. Don't miss it.

reviews.name: lovetogeaux
reviews.title: Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous! Absolutely beautiful. Would highly recommend. Not much trekking to waterfalls.

reviews.name: viajera464
reviews.title: Beautiful View from Point Sublime!!
reviews.comment:
The hike to Point Sublime will give you the most beautiful view of the Yellowstone Canyon! It is beyond words. The hike to Point Sublime in a nice hike, but the distance on the sign is incorrect, but it is not a hard hike and the views of the gorge are so worth it.
A piece of advice - Don't forget bug spray, the mosquitos are pretty bad. I do NOT reccomend that you hike to Ribbon Lake!! You will be swarmed by mosquitos (they are not so bad to Point Sublime.) The hike to Ribbon Lake is not really even pretty, through the swamp, pretty much all flat.

reviews.name: fritz s
reviews.title: Awesome. Must see.
reviews.comment: This is a must see in Yellowstone. The closer parking lot was closed when we went but still got a beautiful fun with lots of nice pictures. Easy walk There are a few stairs.

reviews.name: paul3102
reviews.title: Beautiful View
reviews.comment: Though it doesn't compare to the real Grand Canyon it is still beautiful and awesome. Parking at the north and south rims is terrible. Go before 8am or after 6pm.

reviews.name: huadao15271527
reviews.title: Photos are pointless
reviews.comment: I don't care how good a photographer you are, you can't describe this in any way other than "go see it for yourself". We stopped at upper falls and Artist's Point only, during the day, but the views are already breathtaking. One might die of suffocation if coming at sunrise or sunset. Prepare to be amazed.

reviews.name: valenandnico
reviews.title: Best short hike in Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: This has to be the most beautiful part of Yellowstone. Once you get to the brink of lower fall, take the little hike - 3/8 of mile - down to the edge of the river. What awaits you is the amazing view of yellowstone canyon and its waterfall. Bring water for the hike up back to the parking lot. Don't miss it!

reviews.name: petc11 .
reviews.title: Must see in Yellowstone!!!
reviews.comment: Get here early in order to avoid long lines. The views are spectacular here and very worth the visit! We stopped on the north side of the canyon and viewed from the parking lot. We did not have to take any long hikes. Many great photo ops!!!

reviews.name: Margot E
reviews.title: Spectacular view!
reviews.comment: Easy drive around the loop road. Easy pathways to walk around, you don't have to do the strenuous walks down to some viewpoints to get an amazing view. A MUST SEE for everyone as it is amazing!

reviews.name: JennyA1972
reviews.title: Fantastic views
reviews.comment: Must see. Can't fully describe or capture on picture, even on pano. Just can't miss it if you are there.

reviews.name: LoveTrips
reviews.title: So beautiful to see!
reviews.comment: This was one of our favorite stops in Yellowstone! It's beautiful to see the gorgeous blue water rushing through the amazingly colorful rock walls around it. It's also a nice and easy walk to the overlook from the parking spot (once we finally got a spot, ha!) and pretty well shaded.

reviews.name: Valerie P
reviews.title: The best of the best!!
reviews.comment: The Artist lookout and the beautiful upper falls and lower falls lookouts are the perfect way to spend a day at Yellowstone. You won't believe all you can see. There were parts easy enough for the very elderly and small children and parts more and more challenging. This canyon and its falls are grand on so many levels. Take binoculars for bird spotting. The power of these falls is just magnetic. The lookouts are varied and fun. You can ask for specific details from rangers in Canyon Village at the museum and visitor center.

reviews.name: 3catsmary
reviews.title: One of our Great National Parks here in the U.S.
reviews.comment: This park is connected to the Yellowstone National Park, which makes it nice to see two parks basically in one.

reviews.name: Ashley Patton
reviews.title: Not for the faint of heart.
reviews.comment: Winding road through the mountains. Hairpin curves and switchbacks make it quite the drive. Did I mention the view, awesome!!!

reviews.name: Brandon S
reviews.title: Very Cool
reviews.comment: As someone who has been to the Grand Canyon many times I can say this is not even remotely close in comparison. However, it is a very cool canyon and certainly unique. The waterfalls are something you cannot see in the Grand Canyon, at least not for the masses. I found this canyon to be worth the visit.

reviews.name: Mom2Twincesses
reviews.title: Breathtakingly Beautiful!
reviews.comment: A must see. Hands down. As anywhere in Yellowstone, expect crowds. I'll say we did meet only very friendly and accommodating people who gave everyone a chance at the "money shots". There are several stops to see this feature from different angles as well.

reviews.name: sherri g
reviews.title: Hike
reviews.comment: Wow! This spot is incredible. The hike is super hard though. Make sure you are up to it. It's so pretty. The ground is kinda slippery so make sure you have good traction on your tennis shoes.

reviews.name: Petnurse1958
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: I can see why there are so many paintings and pictures of this area and the Yellowstone Falls. Smaller version of the Grand canyon

reviews.name: pjeltravel
reviews.title: Never gets old
reviews.comment: This is maybe my 6th time here and the canyon area never gets old. The views are phenomenal. Just wish the hike to the brink of the falls wasnt so slippery..a bit dangerous for small kids.

reviews.name: SamDE2014
reviews.title: This is nature at its best
reviews.comment: Just Visit Yellowstone. Every Nature lover should plan a visit. It really helps you understand evolution of earth and realise that nature is the almighty.

reviews.name: Laura C
reviews.title: Not as pretty as the actual Grand Canyon!!
reviews.comment: We've seen the Grand Canyon but this is nothing compared to that. It is not even that pretty. We did see a bear pretty close to the Canyon so that was amazing. But if it is far from you don't go here.

reviews.name: TRAVELGIRL-CAD
reviews.title: Magnificent Canyon, Should visit !
reviews.comment:
I see many Canyon and Fall, but the special point here is the color
the cayon has many different color and it looks like a big painting, lovely to see it

reviews.name: Jennifer K
reviews.title: Majestic
reviews.comment: I had no idea what an enormous canyon & waterfalls are in Yellowstone! Loved getting so close to upper & lower falls. Absolutely beautiful!

reviews.name: Julie K
reviews.title: Awe inspiring
reviews.comment: We visited the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone on our Circle of Fire tour and it was an incredible sight. We spent about 15 minutes there, which was a sufficient amount of time to look around and take pictures. Definitely a worthwhile stop while in the park.

reviews.name: Craig A
reviews.title: One of the most beautiful spots I've ever seen
reviews.comment: The GCoY is stunningly beautiful! Any place you go around it has beautiful views and great photo ops. This is a must see place in Yellowstone....if you don't go here you're crazy!

reviews.name: Belle0303
reviews.title: The canyon and falls are breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Make sure you do the switchback walk down to the lower falls. We were tired but did it anyway and couldn't have been happier we did. The rover is gushing and so powerful. You get such different perspectives as you explore around.

reviews.name: Don Anderson
reviews.title: Great Photo Op
reviews.comment: Nice place to visit, but bring your camera. Always crowded and a little difficult to navigate. But once your in position, let the shutter fly. Early morning viewing will provide a opportunity to see a rainbow in the pool at the bottom of the falls.

reviews.name: Ryananthony B
reviews.title: Nature Trip at Yellowstone
reviews.comment: A breathtaking view of this Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is another a must see place. The landscape is so beautiful, however during our visit (May 2017) the lower trail is close for renovation.

reviews.name: boatlover7411
reviews.title: Do red rock trail
reviews.comment:
Find red rock trail
Do it
Be patient on parking far past entrance are usually places
Be prepared for rain showers
Have good nonskid shoes no flip flops here!
It looks like a painting
Rocks have lots of color
Keep your coffee cups as refills at general store are cheaper than buying with new cups

reviews.name: wacotom
reviews.title: Do not miss this Falls
reviews.comment: We hiked on the south side of the canyon although the South Canyon trail is under construction so we had to start at Artists Point. Still this was a great trail and we added a loop to Lily Pad Lake, geothermal area and Clear Lake. Then we drove the North side of canyon stopping at the various short trails and overlooks incredible pictures. Do not miss this

reviews.name: David L
reviews.title: One Hell of a View!
reviews.comment: Now folks may differ with me on this one. But frankly I was extremely impressed by what I saw here. In my not so humble opinion, this place can give the Grand Canyon a serious run for it money when it comes to grandeur!

reviews.name: Patti S
reviews.title: Worth seeing while in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Spectacular falls worth visiting. It gets very crowded so I would recommend early morning or later evening.

reviews.name: JESUSFOLLOWERS
reviews.title: Another Must See
reviews.comment:
If you go to Yellowstone this is a must see and nice hike around both north and south rims.
Trick is to do the main sightseeing spots either early morning or later in the evening
.... or be ready to be frustrated while seeking parking or just being way too crowded.
My wife and I saw all the attractions we wanted to with out the crowds by going early parking & then hitting the hiking trails before the crowds arrived.
we would get back to parking spots ready to leave to find big crowds and long lines of people waiting to find parking ... I said to myself that I would not being having any fun if that was the way I spent my vacation....
A little planning and preparation will go a long way in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Renny J
reviews.title: Very beautiful waterfall with great view.
reviews.comment: The lower falls was very beautiful and a great place to take pictures with great view. Unfortunately the upper falls road was closed for construction and we could not visit it. But the hiking trail was open for the upper fall, but it was a little messy with dirt. So we decided not to go for the hike.

reviews.name: Rick T
reviews.title: A definite worth see...
reviews.comment: Of the areas to visit, this one ranks up there. Go to Artists Point to see the falls. We tried Inspiration Point, but the road was closed to access it.

reviews.name: Carol1650
reviews.title: Wow
reviews.comment: This canyon and waterfall was amazing. So many colors thru the canyon walls. Pictures just cannot compair to standing there and taking in the beauty

reviews.name: URSULA HAND
reviews.title: Ursula Hand
reviews.comment: Beautiful! Amazing wildlife, cool hiking, awesome scenery (geysers etc). Nice shops for souvenirs and the park rangers and staff were always cheerful and willing to help or provide advice.

reviews.name: thumpersmom
reviews.title: Beautiful but horribly crowded late morning/afternoons
reviews.comment: We got here early and beat the crowds. By the time we left the line to get in was all the way back to the main road. We hiked around the south rim, and got off the beaten track by hiking the Wapiti trail to the start of the trail by the main road (had someone pick us up). We only saw a few others once we got away from the falls which were amazing, btw.

reviews.name: NYSPROF
reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Got there and it was empty! Took a chopper tour which was highly over priced ($500) for a couple. Great views. Stayed at the Williams RV park.

reviews.name: wicked1963
reviews.title: WOW-----do the Sublime trail
reviews.comment: Sublime is short and pretty easy to get to. It is a path that leads you along the rim of the canyon. If you hate heights....it might not be for you.....but it is totally safe and offers the greatest views!!!

reviews.name: AritraDG
reviews.title: Great view
reviews.comment: You should visit this place. The sight of the falls along with the color contrast and combination makes this place a must see spot in Yellowstone

reviews.name: G L
reviews.title: Must do
reviews.comment: Really nice. Do the hike to brink of the lower falls if you are able. Is about 1/2 mile and a decent incline. I'd say any able bodied person could do it. Really worth it.

reviews.name: VictoriaAshland
reviews.title: Stunning waterfalls and cliffs
reviews.comment: This is a photographer's delight. The yellow, red and dark rocks are the color and the rushing water is the symphony. Get here early in the AM or just at sunset to avoid the crowds and have time to soak in the energy of the place without a hundred chattering adults and screaming kids in your face.

reviews.name: K Grace
reviews.title: Must see at yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is definitely one of the best views (of many!) in Yellowstone. The colors make it a breathtaking sight. Try to go early in the morning or last thing in the evening for the best views and lowest crowds for pictures!

reviews.name: Greg D
reviews.title: Incredible--Unbelievable--Beautiful !!
reviews.comment:
Started early at Artist Point for a view of the falls at sun up---gorgeous!! Hiked from there along the South rim Trail to Uncle Tom's Trail---Then down the stairs to the lookout point---up close and personal with the falls. Very tough down and back up hundreds of steep stairs and back to the parking lot. Went over to the North Rim for trails of the Brink of Upper Falls and Brink of Lower Falls----then on to the North Rim trail through Red Rock (once again very steep down and back up)---then Lookout---Grand View--all giving a different perspective to the falls. Approx. 10 miles total that gave numerous vantage points for view of the falls--even saw Ospreys in a huge nest at top of a rock formation. Start early as these trails get crowded later on----Parking in this area is a challenge--we found it easier to park once on each Rim---and hike all the trails on that side then back to the car. Carry plenty of water and snacks if you choose to combine trails into longer hikes. It limits the need to keep returning to the car for supplies and finding new parking spots.
Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a very appropriate name---worth spending an entire day there!!

reviews.name: Luannand Colin H
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: My husband grew up visiting this place but even with his stories over the past years I still had no idea how incredible this was. We visited the lower Falls side only. This was one of the more crowded places in the park but it was early afternoon so that was expected. If you only have 1 day in the park add this to your list. There is a short hike down to the falls which I was able to do in sandals. My kids raced back up but they are in great shape- may be tough for elderly. There are some places to take a break though.

reviews.name: Avakelly
reviews.title: Hike away from the falls
reviews.comment: We loved the farthest lookout but the trail leading away was amazing. The hike is very simple and you will only have several stairs equivalent spots that require no skill.......and you will be by yourself since most don't recognize the trailhead from the falls viewing area.

reviews.name: goblin54
reviews.title: Understandably the number one attraction
reviews.comment:
Although not as deep or wide as "the" Grand Canyon, this had a more intimate feel to it and so in it's way was just as impressive.
You can drive or hike along both the South and North Rim's. There are numerous overlooks and trails that provide a different perspective all within a few miles. Some of these were closed for renovation work on trails and roads when we visited, so check beforehand.

reviews.name: Amy C
reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.comment: Yellowstone had such diverse landscapes within a short drive. The canyon is one of the must-see places. It has many pull-offs along the way. Uncle Tom's was closed so it was extra crowded at Artist's Point. Brave the traffic jam and you will be rewarded. Parking gets really congested. The earlier you can go, the better. Also, include the scenic drive on your trip. It's worth it. Then stop for a bite at Canyon Lodge. The scenic drive ends next to the entrance.

reviews.name: Whistledown
reviews.title: Very NIce with Great Walk along the South Rim Trail
reviews.comment:
Great place to visit. The canyon is quite spectacular but it is not the Grand Canyon. There is very nice hike from the Chittenden Bridge along the South Rim Trail passing the Upper and Lower Falls to Artists Point – it was not that busy along the trail except near Uncle Tom’s Point and at Artist Point. Nice colors and rock formations as well as the two falls.
Well worth a visit especially if you take the South Rim Trail.

reviews.name: sri67
reviews.title: Most spectacular landscape
reviews.comment:
Of all the landscapes I have seen till date, the Grand canyon of Yellowstone, with the Upper and Lower falls of the Yellowstone river included, is the Grandest!!
Prepare to spend at least 3 to 4 hours here as you need time and energy to hike the brinks of both upper and lower falls.. its totally mesmerizing to watch the power of both these falls ... Lower falls being the better of the two!!

reviews.name: Richard H
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is really worth a trip or two to see both sides of the canyon. The stained walls are worth a number of pictures as are the waterfalls.

reviews.name: helenandpaul13
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This is another one of those features of the park that you don't really see until you're sitting on top of it. The views into the canyon are beautiful and very picture postcard. Definitely not to be missed

reviews.name: tourist22903
reviews.title: beautiful place to visit
reviews.comment: We enjoyed seeing this canyon although some of the access points were closed off due to re-building of the trails. It is a lovely site, very accessible. Also has restrooms, hiking trails.

reviews.name: Tripletmompearland
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Really unbelievable beauty. Like a postcard. Good trails to hike and soak it all in. Plenty of picture taking opportunities! Outstanding!

reviews.name: rwfishermn
reviews.title: Worth the hike!
reviews.comment: Lots of geological history on view in addition to beauty. But we should be ashamed of how the NPS, our employees, maintain the extremely limited and horrific facilities.

reviews.name: Go-GBP
reviews.title: Don't miss any of the views
reviews.comment: Make sure to hike on both N & S side of canyon. The views are stellar. This has to be a must on any Yellowstone visit.

reviews.name: jane s
reviews.title: Beautiful site--MUST SEE!
reviews.comment: Breath taking view and a must see. Parking can be a challenge so try to go early morning or later in the afternoon. Take your patience with you! It is worth the wait.

reviews.name: Doug W
reviews.title: Yellowstone Grand Canyon - Trail and Road Closures - Summer 2017
reviews.comment:
Based on best 100 hikes in Yellowstone, we were hoping to complete the 3.2 mile shuttle hike from Wapati Lake Trailhead and parking area - just south of Upper Falls on the Yellowstone River, ending at Inspiration Point and including Uncle Tom's Trail.
The trail between Wapati Lake and Uncle Tom's Trail is closed. Uncle Tom's Trail is also closed. The car wait to get to Artist Point was at least 30 points, due to high summer traffic. With limited cell phone coverage, it was a bit of a big problem, as signage was very limited as to the closures. Having dropped off our group before taking our cars, we found that the trail was closed, resulted in our party being separated.
In the end, we returned on another day, earlier in the morning before the traffic going to Artist Point was so backed up. (We were trying to do this about 11 am on June 30). The ranger later told us that between 9 and 5, the road to Artist Point is at least 30 minute backup.
The view is truly spectacular and iconic, so you cannot dismiss it. My best advice, based on other travelers would be to park at Wapati Lake - take the trail to Wapati Lake, then cut over to Uncle Tom's Trail. Find the trail to Artist Point ( the lower 1 mile is open). Unfortunately, you would then need to send someone back (2 miles+) to get a car and wait in line to pick up others.
Ironically, when we did visit the Northern Rim on July 3, there were people on Uncle Tom's Trail and the stairway down to view the Upper Falls. Not sure if it had suddenly opened or more likely - groups were dismissing the "closed" signs.

reviews.name: Dan M
reviews.title: Wow, what a view
reviews.comment: We walked the south rim trail. Many places to stop and view the canyon and river below. This is a must see in Yellowstone. You need to take the Uncle Toms Trail, I'll leave that review next.

reviews.name: New Yorker
reviews.title: Great lookout
reviews.comment:
We stopped by both lower and upper falls.
One thing that I really would like to raise a flag was the look out places were not 100% safe for toddlers or younger kids.
The fence was made for adults' design (small kids may be able to sneak inside and may have a chance to fall off); So adults should hold hands tightly and take very good care of young ones.
The views were gorgeous - people may be confused by the name of Grand Canyon, which is totally different look- but Yellowstone's Grand Canyon is namely Grand Canyon, which offers different charms.
Upper falls' lookout was easy as it's only 0.3mile walk from the parking lot but lower falls could show great landscape.
Highly recommend to see both ones for differences.

reviews.name: TucsonFred
reviews.title: Beautiful falls but very crowded!
reviews.comment: When we visited, 3 of the viewing areas were closed for renovations so the viewing areas that were open were extremely crowded and parking was almost impossible. However it is a beautiful area with amazing waterfalls. Oh and we saw osprey on their nests in this area as well. The rock formations here are unlike any we have seen anywhere else.

reviews.name: Katie
reviews.title: Highlight of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Our favorite spot in Yellowstone. Breathtaking amazing waterfalls and views. Hike down Uncle Tom's trail- a few hundred steps down. The view cannot be beat.

reviews.name: Heather S
reviews.title: Excellent views!
reviews.comment: We enjoyed all of Yellowstone, but the Grand Canyon views are stunning! We every got to view the osprey nest and the momma watching out for her 3 chicks! Must see.

reviews.name: GinnyandRon
reviews.title: Beautiful to behold
reviews.comment: There's really not much to say other than it's a great photo opportunity and there's a beautiful waterfall. There are three stops and we hit the middle one which provided a lovely view.

reviews.name: Amit J
reviews.title: It is Canyon - Beautiful After you Find Parking
reviews.comment:
1. It can be seen from many places so don't panicked. First park and them see.
2. If you are not careful you could be victim of Fender/Bender.
3. It is mostly Yellow in color as park name suggest Yellow Stone.
4. Many photo opportunities

reviews.name: Steve D
reviews.title: Bus tour
reviews.comment: Visited park on bus tour which was excellent. Great guide. Hit all the high points in the park and had a very good time

reviews.name: mcdocs
reviews.title: Inspiring
reviews.comment: Between Mt. Washburn and Roosevelt Lodge. Scenic overlook. Very accessible and well maintained paths.

reviews.name: MagicDreamer
reviews.title: Gorgeous colors
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a sight worth beholding. Though not as vast as the Grand Canyon in Arizona, it is still a natural womder to behold. Great hiking around the rim or if you just want a peek from the top to the waterfall. This is one canyon they figure was really carved out from the river running through it.

reviews.name: nataly02
reviews.title: Another beautiful part of the park
reviews.comment: There was so much to do in this area. We took in a few trails, some water falls and lots of amazing views. We got there around noon and the traffic was not bad. We got lots of nice pictures of the fall and even say an osprey nest on a ledge with babies in it.

reviews.name: outgolfing
reviews.title: Just Awesome.
reviews.comment: This was my favorite part of Yellowstone (with the animals a close 2nd). Unfortunately it was one of the last things that we saw so we didn't get to spend as much time here as I would've liked. I would recommend going here early and take your time to go to a couple different vantage points to really appreciate it. I went on the trail that takes you right next to the waterfall and it is just amazing. The trail is a little sketchy but me, my 5 year old and two 7 year olds did pretty good.

reviews.name: LacyB0404
reviews.title: Beautiful area, lovely views
reviews.comment: Gorgeous views, great hiking trails, lots of parking, safe trails. We enjoyed a quick hike to see the beautiful water and scenery.

reviews.name: Nancy C
reviews.title: A must see!
reviews.comment: Your trip to Yellowstone would not be complete if you don't go and see the beauty of the Canyon. Either go early in the morning or in the evening to avoid the larger crowds. We also enjoyed the hikes that were there, but hiking is not necessary to get a good view of the Canyon, river or the Lower Falls.

reviews.name: Jenny S
reviews.title: Great place to take a family picture.
reviews.comment: This place really has a fantastic view. And a neat story behind it. One of the top three places to visit when you're in Yellowstone. But it is crowded and hard to park. Be prepared to wait a bit.

reviews.name: judyrb
reviews.title: Artist Point is beautiful
reviews.comment: Great waterfall. But go early in morning - gets very crowded. Just a short walk from parking lot. Make sure you have a camera

reviews.name: sheila J
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: Old Faithful is what you hear about most, generally, related to a visit to Yellowstone. I found the Grand Canyon to be much more impressive. We saw it from a distance down the river (not the closer vantage point) and, even from that distance is was incredibly impressive. The sheer power of the water was daunting and there were a couple of great vantage points plus as lovely shaded picnic/sitting area nearby. Well worth the parking hassle to see it!

reviews.name: PattiP523
reviews.title: Splendid
reviews.comment: Just WOW! The canyon and the falls were breathtaking. This is a must see at Yellowstone. We weren't able to hike the Uncle Tom steps but the Artist Point gave us the money shot with no problem!

reviews.name: Yair K
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment:
While visiting Yellowstone National Park, we had a very nice view of the Grand Canyon and Lower Falls from Artist's Point.
Great lookout, highly recommended!

reviews.name: Doron S
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment: The views from the ramps are spectacular and beautiful, the yellow walls of the canyon are impressive.

reviews.name: embeyfar
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This is absolutely beautiful! The kids even enjoyed the pretty view during a rain storm!e I wish we would have had more time.

reviews.name: xiolung
reviews.title: great hike
reviews.comment: This is a great hike but with the mountain air it may take you a bit longer to get back up than it sis to get down to it.

reviews.name: Barbiegirl72
reviews.title: Just Amazing!! God's creation....
reviews.comment: My second time here but i'm always amazed at the wonder of it all.. I could stand and look at it for hours.. Watched creatures enjoying it also.. The colors of the canyon's are so beautiful.. Can't wait to go back..

reviews.name: Harriet T
reviews.title: So much to see, so little time
reviews.comment: We enjoyed the canyon area of Yellowstone more than the geyser attractions. So many trails and scenic driving roads. If you go here, do not miss the upper and lower brink of the falls. For us, where we love waterfalls, this was the best thing in all of Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Jurgen B
reviews.title: One of the two highlights of the park
reviews.comment: the falls, the canyon itself, the colours, the trails, the whole experience is just fantastic, even with parts closed

reviews.name: Italytwin
reviews.title: Wonderful Canyon views; Beautiful Waterfall
reviews.comment: This is one of the stops on the Grand Loop. Easy to admire from the Lookout Points. For the athletic, plenty of hiking opportunities and to see the Falls up close!

reviews.name: krf-NJ
reviews.title: Awe-some views!
reviews.comment:
Awe inspiring views and hikes within walking distance of the Canyon Lodge. Be careful of the several strenuous hikes down to the brink of the lower falls...the altitude can make you winded very quickly.
Go early in the morning (730-8a) to avoid the crowds as parking is limited.

reviews.name: RosaRosaRosa
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment:
It's quite an awe inspiring sight.
We also took the hike down to the brink of the lower falls. I would not recommend this for anyone with walking difficulties or health issues. There are quite a few switchbacks and the uphill can be long and difficult. But you get right next to the falls and is totally worth it!!!
Stay at the overlook up top for views of the canyon if you can't do the hike.

reviews.name: nielmala
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: We just took in the views from the upper falls...spectacular! Will return when our children are older and we can do the full hike and see it all. But so glad we at least got a glimpse!

reviews.name: JCStover
reviews.title: Be in good shape!
reviews.comment: Do not go here unless it's before 10. It gets so busy during July and August. Artist point is a precarious hike that parallels the canyon until you get to a set of wooden steps that lead you to the bottom of the falls. Not a great hike for young kids. We also did the Lower Falls hike. It's steep and long but worth it. It takes you to the top of the Falls. There are breathtaking views. There are lots of benches along the hike so you can rest. We were a group of 5 from the ages of 12-65. Loved it. We also checked out the canyon visitor center. Lots of information, flush toilets, and tourist shops/eateries.

reviews.name: mleese
reviews.title: Beautiful but crowded
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is beautiful. It's particularly impressive in early summer when there's large amounts of water flowing through it. The only downside is how crowded it gets. Try to arrive early to avoid the tour buses.

reviews.name: jefftx88
reviews.title: Incredible!
reviews.comment: Get there early before the crowds and make sure you experience Uncle Tom's Trail! Breathtaking views and the power of the falls is incredible

reviews.name: Michelle S
reviews.title: Rated #1 for a reason! GO!
reviews.comment: This is one of the most spectacular views in Yellowstone. Do not miss this! Although parking lot was full, if you are patient a spot opens up often enough. Go early morning to avoid more crowds.

reviews.name: MKP5456
reviews.title: Wow what a view!
reviews.comment: Best to get out there early as it gets packed quickly. The views were spectacular! We wanted to go to Artist Point and at the Brink of Upper Falls bust it was closed. We did not do Uncle Tom's Trail as we could see lots from the observation points. From other side We could see it's very seep climb to come up. Lookout Point and Grand View point gave us great views of the canyon below. Inspiration Point and Inspiration Point road are closed for reconstruction: expect completion in fall 2017. Uncle Tom's Point and Parking Area are closed for reconstruction: expect completion in fall of 2019 This deprived us to go there. ( We read this at site of YS).May be we will visit again in 2020.

reviews.name: Brenna C
reviews.title: Beautiful views, a little busy
reviews.comment: Stunning views, but the crowds take away from it a bit. Great for pictures, the sides of the canyon are beautiful tones of yellow and red. If I came back again I'd set aside more time to hike along some of the nearby trails.

reviews.name: MusicTraveler78
reviews.title: Great hiking
reviews.comment: You should definitely hike the trail from Wapiti Lake to Artist Point. Make sure you check current maps so you're aware of closures.

reviews.name: KristinalynRN
reviews.title: Our Favorite Spot in Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: Parking can be a bit of tricky thing in this area during prime time. That being said, it is totally worth it. We entered on the East side of Yellowstone and drove all around Yellowstone for the day and exited on the West side. We saw bison, elk, and deer as well as other fantastic things....but nothing tops the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Be sure you stop here and check it out.

reviews.name: 574bobv
reviews.title: Awesome watefall with many viewing options.
reviews.comment: Both the North and South side of the falls offer trails and options to get closer for views. Some are very strenuous. All of them are rewarding. This place is gorgeous.

reviews.name: Pete H
reviews.title: What's Not To Like?
reviews.comment: I didn't bother to read their reviews because they can't be taken seriously, but I see that a few people rated this as poor or terrible. Makes me wonder if they were blindfolded or in a coma at the time. It can be overly crowded, but this has to be one of the most impressive canyons on earth. Yes, it's dwarfed by the THE Grand Canyon in Arizona, but when you stand at the brink of the Upper and Lower Falls and feel the ground rumble beneath your feet and watch the tons of water tumbling into the abyss below, it's a humbling experience.

reviews.name: Anna H
reviews.title: Too much construction
reviews.comment: The canyon never disappoints. But several trails and overlooks were under construction. So it was hard to get the full effect. Call ahead if planning a trip. Maybe construction will be finished by 2018.

reviews.name: jtwmi
reviews.title: Unbelievable
reviews.comment: This was one of the best sights of the park! It was incredible to see "the grand canyon" so far north. It is accessible to all ages. It is a must see.

reviews.name: Bruno F
reviews.title: Really awesome place
reviews.comment: If you plan to visit, go early, when it's not crowded, it's worthwhile going to. Might be able to see wild animals too

reviews.name: Bridget-Gary F
reviews.title: Nature at it's finest
reviews.comment: This was a beautiful not to be missed portion of Yellowstone. The Canyon. It was a beautiful wonder. The walls are so tall with the water rushing below!

reviews.name: SilverFox925
reviews.title: Stunningly beautiful!
reviews.comment: This grand canyon has the colors of geologic formations of eons past along with the thunderous Yellowstone River that rushes through it. The falls can be accessed in a couple of points. There is even a hike to the bottom of the Upper Falls. Follow the road to the Grand View and you can see the Upper and Lower Falls cascading through the canyon. While there, be quiet and listen to the sounds of nature and the falls. This wonder of nature is breathtaking.

reviews.name: Irene F
reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.comment: This is really a must do. In Yellowstone you expect the thermal features mostly, but this is a view unexpected. Easy walk from the parking lot, which wasn't that crowded in May but I understand can be quite packed later in the summer. Restrooms available in the parking lot (pit toilets)

reviews.name: Dave C
reviews.title: From the South Rim perspective
reviews.comment:
We drove down South Rim road to the end where there are several ways to see the canyon and falls. This area seems to be the most popular in Yellowstone aside from Old Faithful but with about 1/3 the parking - so plan accordingly.
We could see people across on North Rim as well - so either way works. We went South Rim because of the easy access to Uncle Tom's Point to overlook the upper falls - then off to Artist Point to overlook the lower falls. A mile long hike beyond took us to Point Sublime and a fantastic overlook with 10% of the crowds. People tend not to venture too far beyond the main areas.
To go down into the Canyon area vs. look from the top - there are a lot of stairs - yet this isn't necessary to get the grandeur.
To see both stops and take the trails - allow at least 2 hours; probably 3

reviews.name: Tom B
reviews.title: Best place between valleys
reviews.comment: The hotel is located halfway between the Lamar valley and Haden valley where most of the animals are. The breakfast is excellent and relatively economical. The area itself has buffalo, deer, elk, bears, and sometimes wolves. The two biggest water falls are within walking distance.

reviews.name: VanEsq12
reviews.title: Raw Power!
reviews.comment: On the day of our visit, it was raining and windy. And yet we could still feel the mist from the waterfall, and the wind coming off the water and up the canyon walls was strong enough to blow your hat and glasses away. This is a beautiful pull-off in the park. The sound of the rushing water is awe-inspiring. Such raw power!

reviews.name: Ross A P
reviews.title: What Beauty and View
reviews.comment: Each turn of the park you find something different, interesting and most of all beauty. It's a most stop and you can see a lot just from the roadside. I can't imagine what the view is like is you hike in. For these seniors that is out of the question. If you have a handicap or disability don't let that discourage you from seeing this beautiful park.

reviews.name: Carolinesc7
reviews.title: Hike the trails
reviews.comment: We enjoyed getting out and hiking the trails around this area. I've never seen the Grand Canyon in person, but the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was impressive! There are several places to take pictures. As with most of Yellowstone, children should be watched closely. Some of the trail areas are a little steep, but manageable.

reviews.name: tractors
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Worth the wait if you go to the Artist's Point!! We were not sure but stuck it out and very glad we did! (Backed up traffic due to "small" parking lot.) I am afraid of heights but I just loved this place! Just amazing to look at! We also saw it from the Falls.

reviews.name: Cindyab
reviews.title: Family vacation with adult children
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was awesome! It was so much like the Grand Canyon in Arizona but on a smaller scale. We really enjoyed the beautiful mountains.

reviews.name: mkenneth
reviews.title: Make sure you explore all the stops!
reviews.comment: I would recommend you take your time and visit as many of the stops as you can both on the north and south rim - the views of the canyon and waterfalls change during the day with the angle of the sun and the distance down the canyon. If you have the energy, take the steps down Uncle Toms, Grand View and the hike down to the upper falls - all worth the effort!

reviews.name: StLJune
reviews.title: Always gorgeous!
reviews.comment: My third visit to this spectacular site and it is so breathtaking. One of our family's favorite spots in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Roundtreerover
reviews.title: Incredible views
reviews.comment: Super views of the canyon and the river far below. Highly recommended. The first parking lots were full but we parked in the last one and really enjoyed the walk back along the canyon rim.

reviews.name: quiinc
reviews.title: A must-visit part of the Yellowstone experience
reviews.comment: The Yellowstone River falls, seen from Artist's Point or Uncle Tom's, is really a mandatory stop when you visit Yellowstone. The best time of day is morning, and the earlier you go, the better your chances of not getting stuck in a massive traffic jam. 8:30 seems to be about perfect, although the rainbow appears in the mist about an hour later in summer.

reviews.name: Ray L
reviews.title: Allot Sufficient Time
reviews.comment: We had only a day & a half at the national park & wished we had 3 times the time to sample everything. The park gives you a 7-day pass for the price of admission, & just the 3 drives at this Grand Canyon will take you a day. Plan better next trip.

reviews.name: David B
reviews.title: Must Do
reviews.comment: This is right up there with Old Faithful as a Must Do in Yellowstone. Make sure to hit all the view points. We really enjoyed the Red Rocks Lookout trail off of the Lookout Point stop along the North Rim. Don't miss the brink of the upper falls either.

reviews.name: Thomas P
reviews.title: Worth the visit
reviews.comment: Take the time to see. One of the sites well worth visiting. Traffic can be congested but people come and go creating parking spaces

reviews.name: PucksterColorado
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: It seems silly, but I'd never understood that Yellowstone got its name from the literal yellow stone of the canyon. A phenomenal site, and gorgeous. With the falls, it's quite a sight. Go to the brink of the Upper Falls: the power and pull of force is truly astounding.

reviews.name: Michael S
reviews.title: Very impressive and colorful
reviews.comment: The coloring of the strata here is really amazing. The river cuts deep. We must be looking at millions of years of history here. Plenty of excellent photos to be had at this site.

reviews.name: TheBel
reviews.title: This Is So Deep and Steep
reviews.comment: You can see the sign posted on the main road to visit this section of the Loop. It is so deep and the sound of the water cascading down is loud and powerful. Check out the rock formations and you can guess on the age of this wonderful park. This just jumps out at you.

reviews.name: JVPG
reviews.title: Spectacular views
reviews.comment: This was a surprise as although we had heard of the canyon we had no idea how spectacular this sight was. There are plenty of access points with good views, however, if you can get away from the crowds on one of the many trails you will be rewarded with truly fantastic views. We walked both the South Rim and the trail to Point Sublime and the views just got better and better. If you intend to visit the park you must include a visit to the Canyon. It is well worth stopping at Canyon Village and the Educational Centre where rangers can give you up to date info on the various trails. You will find their advice very helpful.

reviews.name: jenleisoc
reviews.title: Easy hike hell of a virw
reviews.comment:
Beautiful
Absolutely breathtaking
Parts of this was shut down so we couldn't experience all of the falls but it was very pretty.

reviews.name: AllSpin
reviews.title: Worth the crowds
reviews.comment:
We visited Yellowstone 6/16-6/21. Everything was jammed packed with cars and bus-loads of tourists. Most of the park was un-visitable because of this, or when a parking lot wasn't full/closed, the trail or site was stuffed with throngs of people.
This was one of the first sites you come upon if you take the road that loops to the right when you come in. I would have stayed to see it even if there were thirty busses filled with tourists. It is striking and the best thing in the park, in my opinion, unless you get to go off the beaten path and stay (camp out) inside the park away from the crowds,

reviews.name: Kelly W
reviews.title: A must see.... early
reviews.comment: Yellowstone in itself was way to busy for me, so if I return it will be in the fall or spring. Too many rude tourists right now. This spot though is A must see, I suggest going at the crack of day break to avoid the mess of people that quickly ruins the beauty. The view points are great and a few great hikes off it too.

reviews.name: Susan A
reviews.title: Awesome hike and view
reviews.comment: This is a must see in Yellowstone. The hike is short, but if you can't walk up hills or stairs, this is not for you. For everyone else a real treat.

reviews.name: Dawn M
reviews.title: Yellow Stone
reviews.comment:
We visited GC of Y during a late spring snowstorm and it was beyond beautiful. We had the rare chance to experience a day of winter in June and hike the upper rim. View the falls from Look Out Point, Red Rock Point, Artist's Point, & Brink, each offers a different point of view and adds to the experience. Late Spring offered a tremendous amount of water flow and with the snow, made for exquisite photos.
We were disappointed we could not go to Inspiration Point, or Uncle Tom's Trail. Artist's Point was our favorite and is an absolute must see.

reviews.name: kbruce742016
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Absolutely amazing. Worth the hike or the stairs to get to it. You will not want to miss this if you make the trip to Yellowstone.

reviews.name: NancyGrace77
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: This is a spectacular natural locale that is not to be missed. Does require some walking so be aware of that. Several very scenic views/walks. Some longer than others. The views are breathtaking, but some are very high up.

reviews.name: Cliff T
reviews.title: Don't miss this one!
reviews.comment: Best part of Yellowstone by far. Far exceeds expectations and other attractions like Old Faithful and Lamar Valley. See how Yellowstone got its name.

reviews.name: donna f
reviews.title: Go early or late!
reviews.comment: Gets very crowded so go early. Beautiful views. Limited parking and tour buses empty out making it crazy. We tried one afternoon but it was so crowded. Came by the next morning around 9:00 and it was almost empty.

reviews.name: TheNike
reviews.title: The force of nature
reviews.comment: This wonderful creation of nature can be seen from different points of the park, I suggest Artist Point for the Lower Yellowstone Falls and the canyon itself (here you have an amazing view), but another good place to see it (with Upper Yellowstone Falls) is Uncle Tom's Trail.

reviews.name: HelenWanderlust
reviews.title: Gorgeous Grand Canyon of Yellowstone National Park
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone River and its waterfalls is an alluring and must-see attraction / tour of the Yellowstone National Park.
You can start from the Canyon Village's Canyon Visitor Education Center.
It is fascinating that Yellowstone NP also has its own 'Grand Canyon'.
As the first and very popular National Park established in USA since 1872, Yellowstone does get very crowded during summer time.
More than 4 million visitors admire and experience the Yellowstone National Park, annually.
Hot water acting on volcanic rock created the canyon's colors.
There is a few minutes walk to get to the view point which is well worth it for the magnificent views and sublime picture-taking.
Lookout Point has a vista of Lower Falls (308 feet) and walkways along the canyon's rims.
Grand view gives spectacular views of the canyon.
Helen Lim
Singapore

reviews.name: Amber A
reviews.title: WOW words can not explain the beauty here!
reviews.comment: My family and I went here in July and it was so breath taking I can not wait to go back! The views were stunning, the water was the prettiest shade of blue I've ever seen! The hiking was wonderful!

reviews.name: Amanda T
reviews.title: Walk it or drive it!
reviews.comment: Whether you walk it or drive it, you won't be disappointed! It is not a strenuous hike. Once you see all of the grand beauty that it has to offer, you will be glad that you even came to Yellowstone. This was one of the highlights of our trip. It was very beautiful and offered views like none other. Definitely stop and see.

reviews.name: mfaggella
reviews.title: Not quite GRAND but a very impressive sight
reviews.comment: We saw it from a number of vantage points each with a unique look easily accessible on the road without long hikes if you choose.

reviews.name: 106janaj
reviews.title: breathtaking
