reviews.comment: If here during busy season might be difficult to manage but we were here early. Some animals but they had not all came and there was still snow on ground and ice on lakes.

reviews.name: NewYorkWendy
reviews.title: Spectacular iconic view
reviews.comment: Well worth the trek to the end to see the falls, river and valley. This is the most iconic view seen in paintings and it's clear why when you see it.

reviews.name: Heather F
reviews.title: Just beautiful
reviews.comment: We went in June and the water was raging. Falls and rivers were going crazy. This was a nice stop for a family photo.

reviews.name: fjab
reviews.title: Attractive area
reviews.comment: We only went to the north side. Some lovely high view points and a number of trails below the rim. Some have quite steep switch back turns so be aware as coming back up to the top is much harder (obviously.). All well maintained and signposted. Very different in terms of colour and scale compared to the actual Grand Canyon but very manageable. As with the whole park remember binoculars.

reviews.name: Ling Ren
reviews.title: Not sure why this is rated No. 1
reviews.comment: Don't get me wrong, the Yellowstone canyon is majestic and beautiful, but I don't think this is the best of Yellowstone. The view is nice, but comparable to Grand Canyon. There are falls, but smaller than Niagara. There are trails, but they do not beat those in Zion. I personally would spend more time watching wildlife and visiting geysors in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: nbh_n
reviews.title: Wonder of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The views are breathtaking. Falls are so beautiful. The walk way down to view the falls is so easy. Must see.

reviews.name: Charene D
reviews.title: Amazing Views
reviews.comment: It was totally unexpected for us. The views blew us away. We drove from view point to view point on the north rim, but you could easily walk/hike it.

reviews.name: Amber S
reviews.title: Yellowstone National Park trip
reviews.comment: Spectacular, amazing, breathtaking, scary, and beautiful! Pics don't do it justice! You must see this when visiting Yellowstone.

reviews.name: mrjorgensen109
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: To see the view of the falls and then look the other way and see the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a sight to see. It is endless and breathtaking. I was so amazed by the sights and could not get enough of it.

reviews.name: T G
reviews.title: Spectacular Canyon - Check out the Pics
reviews.comment: Easily assessable with many vantage points the canyon is long and wide and provides another deep level to the diversity that is Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Brad M
reviews.title: One of the most beautiful vistas in the park
reviews.comment: Yes it's packed with tourists, but the view is still worth it and you've GOT to get a photo of yourself with the falls in the background. Along the canyon rim there are lots of opportunities for short hikes as well.

reviews.name: ncgd52
reviews.title: 1Don't miss the waterfalls and canyon
reviews.comment: The waterfalls are spectacularly beautiful. I thought they were the most magnificent site at Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Sharon E
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
reviews.comment: OUTSTANDING, There are many pull outs, parking lots and trails. A lot of different ways you can enjoy the beautiful views of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. All get really crowded in the middle of the day. Brink of the Lower Falls and Upper Falls has many views that are easy and not so easy. Over looks and trails, you take you pick. They are all worth the walk.

reviews.name: crlong81
reviews.title: Amazing place to see!
reviews.comment: The waterfall was amazing! Loved the scenic view! It was slightly raining when we visited and a beautiful rainbow shined across the waterfall. It was amazing!

reviews.name: Kyle W
reviews.title: Stunningly Beutiful
reviews.comment: There are several vantage points you can see the Canyon view from in the park and regardless of which you choose the view truly is stunning. Also each view gives you a different perspective so it's worth it to make the stop no matter how many times you have seen the Canyon.

reviews.name: Connie R
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Just beautiful, pictures do not truly show how big this is. Temps were mild in first of June but lots of people and lines to see things.

reviews.name: bmccrery
reviews.title: Beautiful views of the canyon, river & falls
reviews.comment:
This was one of the more crowded places we went. Arrived shortly after lunch. Nonetheless, it's still worth seeing even if crowded.
Drive the north & south rim roads. Walked to Inspiration Point & Artist Point. Views are absolutely gorgeous. There are plenty of great views if you're looking for short, easy walks from the parking lot.
There are also fairly short trails to get into the canyon & close to the falls. Those trails have some steep grade and/or lot of steps - somewhere around 120 one way. Uncle Tom's Trail was closed. If you're physically able, it's worth taking the trails.

reviews.name: dogchow2016
reviews.title: A Breathtaking Canyon in the Heart of historic Yellowstone National Park
reviews.comment: This beautiful canyon, while not on the same scale as Arizona's Grand Canyon, is a wonder to behold. The canyon, which beautifully frames the Yellowstone River and lower falls can be viewed from above or below. From the upper rim there is a beautiful view of the falls and canyon below and if you're lucky you'll see an Osprey soaring overhead. For those who are able, a 10 minute descent down a winding, somewhat difficult paved trail affords gorgeous views of the canyon and falls close-up. The climb back up to the rim and parking areas is a good 25 minute walk requiring a moderate level of activity. Definitely wear hiking shoes or boots!

reviews.name: jamielaub
reviews.title: Best view from Artist Point
reviews.comment: The Uncle Tom's Trail was closed for renovations, but we weren't sure for how long. If you cannot hike down Uncle Tom's Trail, then spend extra time at Artist point.

reviews.name: clearfieldtoothpullr
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment:
What can I say. Look at some pictures on line. These don't due the actual location justice. It's breathtaking. Very crowded. Hard to park-we came on a bus tour so this wasn't my concern.
A must if at Yellowstone.

reviews.name: AggieProf
reviews.title: South rim view from Artist Point
reviews.comment: We stayed in the Canyon Lodge and visited the Grand Canyon on the south rim at Artist Point two evenings after dinner. it's only about a five minute drive from Canyon. Spectacular views.

reviews.name: Raul V
reviews.title: Since you can see from different places you see the magnificent Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: In some views you just must stop and contemplate what many thousand years have done to let us see this magnificent place. this is a must visit if you are in Yellowstone , and tried to see it from all of the different sites they have .

reviews.name: Marc B
reviews.title: June Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Nice waterfall. Alot of viewing points accessable (if you don't mind taking alot of stairs). Some nice birds nests for viewing

reviews.name: Lincious
reviews.title: Gets its name for good reason.
reviews.comment: While completely different landscape you can quickly see why this place is named the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. It's breathtaking. Worth the hikes to the lower Falls to view the Canyon.

reviews.name: Michelle A
reviews.title: Many different places to view
reviews.comment: Really looks like a smaller grand canyon. Very windy! There are several pull offs and it is worth hiking around a little at each one to get different aspects.

reviews.name: shoppingfun123
reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.comment: Recommended by friends not to miss. Beautiful waterfalls! The colors in the rock were magnificent! Truly worth seeing.

reviews.name: Dena K
reviews.title: Beautiful views with a short walk
reviews.comment: Park in the lot at the end of the South Rim road and it's a short walk to one of the most beautiful sights in the park. The beautiful canyon with the waterfall is breathtaking, a perfect site for a photo op and taking in the scenery of the canyon. I wouldn't miss this stop if you're at Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Goddessboxer
reviews.title: Must SEE in your travels around Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is fantastic. We stopped at one of the overlooks. A short walk down and you have a gorgeous view of the falls, canyon and an ospreys nest. I also recommend getting an app called Just Ahead... this app gives you a tour and told us about so many sights and information we would never have known about! It was excellent!

reviews.name: Jones_fromSouthGA
reviews.title: Great photo op
reviews.comment: Very pretty, some of my favorite vacation photos came from this spot, especially Calcite Springs Overlook.

reviews.name: Jame C
reviews.title: Parking access can be frustrating
reviews.comment: We drove both the north and south canyon viewing roads and found parkin on the South Canyon view to be very congested. The views of the canyon, Osprey nests and other birds were great. The trails had some snow remaining and required caution. Restroom facilites are available if inadequate for the number of visitors.

reviews.name: David C
reviews.title: What can you say that hasn't already been said
reviews.comment: Simply a fantastic place to visit & one that will stay with you for a very long time. Throughout the area the scenery is lovely& the wildlife everywhere, bears, moose, wolves etc.

reviews.name: Texas_suz
reviews.title: What a view!
reviews.comment:
We went in mid-May when some of the roads were still closed due to snow - so we were only able to visit the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone from the North Rim but it's still so breathtaking.
You can see all the colors throughout the canyon, the powerful river below (with steam in some places), and the Lower Falls which super powerful, even when you don't get to walk up close.
There was an osprey nest on one of the rock spires that looked huge and you could see two osprey chilling. I've read they keep reusing the same nest for years, so I can imagine how long it took to build up to that size.
When we went there was mild snow falling, and there was a rainbow across the Lower Falls. Definitely worth a stop at each of the viewpoints.
Logistically, we entered from the town of Canyon to the North Rim one way road. There are several places along the road to stop and walk a short distance to an overlook or vista - or you can park and walk along the North Rim Trail, which walks along them, too.

reviews.name: fik2000
reviews.title: Noisy beauty
reviews.comment:
The waterfall is wonderful. I would recommend driving the North Rim - less people. Take the short strenuous Red Rock trail from the North Rim to get a closer view.
Unfortunately the road to Inspiration Point was closed in beginning of June 2017.

reviews.name: Mathew G
reviews.title: Beautiful falls
reviews.comment:
Great view of the lower falls. The power of the river seems awesome.
The south rim viewing area was great with plenty of shade & room to move around. The outhouses were pretty dirty though.
We also stopped @ the north rim and that view is great too but parking is trickier.
Both rims have trails to get REAL close but we didn't go down because of the hike it would have been with the 1 & 2 year olds.

reviews.name: Jaspreet Kaur O
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: When you are driving on the grand loop this is one of the attractions you must see. Its a beautiful canyon and you can see the biggest fall from this point.

reviews.name: Morgan C
reviews.title: Worth the Hike
reviews.comment: Part of the trail was still snow covered when we visited in late May, it was still worth the hike. The views were gorgeous. There are a lot of places to stop and get amazing pictures. The canyon is other worldly. To think just a small river created all that. The geological history you can see is also amazing. Go in May and go early to avoid crowds. It was not crowded at this stop and the paths were moderate. Don't wear flip flops.

reviews.name: Bob19512014
reviews.title: Emotional Views
reviews.comment: The views are unforgettable. One could stand here for hours and just admire the beauty of nature. Put this on your to see list.

reviews.name: Kip L
reviews.title: Photographers Heaven
reviews.comment: Make sure and hike the Brink of the Upper and Lower Falls on the North Rim.. and then visit Artists Point on the South Rim...

reviews.name: Gerard P
reviews.title: Very colorful canyons and raging rivers
reviews.comment: Amazing the varied topography of yellowstone and the geologic forces that created the beautiful scenery. We came in late May, the perfect time, after the melt, and ahead of the summer crowds.

reviews.name: Suzann47
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: This was out of our way about a half hour but definitely worth seeing. It is just beautiful with the long waterfall coming down the canyon. I definitely recommend seeing this.

reviews.name: RoseKala15
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment:
When getting in the parking lot, I was a little put off by how many tour buses were there and how many people were seen but it was totally worth it.
The views are amazing, the waterfalls are breathtaking. Its crowded but once you get to your spot along with the view, it's all worth it.

reviews.name: Robin S
reviews.title: I Love That SOUND!
reviews.comment: Love the sound of a waterfall, the power. I would have rated it a 5 but the access to the falls themselves, Uncle Toms Cabin & the stairway down was closed, Maybe next time. Great photo op. Close your eyes for 30 seconds and just listen.

reviews.name: Po143
reviews.title: Spectacular and Powerful!
reviews.comment: Can't believe the beauty of this place! The canyon is amazing. And the drive is thrilling! Take a hike to the falls! It's worth the effort if you are in good health!

reviews.name: Marcia M
reviews.title: Absolutely gorgeous!
reviews.comment: Not everyone knows that Yellowstone has its own grand canyon--and it's magnificent! One of the most amazing natural scenes I've ever visited.

reviews.name: jmdeering
reviews.title: Phenomenal
reviews.comment: Beautiful beyond belief. Pull overs on the road have beautiful views of the canyon. A definite must see while in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Graham D
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Yellowstone has some outstanding scenery but probably the best is the Grand Canyon. Splendid cliffs and white water river. Quite easily viewed particularly from the North Rim drive.

reviews.name: nevadatraveler13
reviews.title: grand canyon
reviews.comment: We did take the 300+ steps down to Uncle Toms. It was worth it. Is it scary climbing metal stairs bolted to the side of a cliff, for me yes. My husband is usually wary of heights but he was fine. Much better view if you can handle the stairs. I'm 57 and did have to take a few breather stops. Go for it, you'll be glad you did.

reviews.name: M R
reviews.title: lower falls are must see
reviews.comment: The walk down is fine if you have no fear of heights. The walk backup the switchbacks is strenuous if you have any conditions. Take your time and you should be fine.

reviews.name: icjg
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: There are many different viewpoints. Visit them all because you can see the falls from many angles, but also different views of the canyon. Hiking along the south rim gives the most interesting view and it's just a nice hike

reviews.name: TourDawg
reviews.title: Beautiful Part Of The Park!
reviews.comment: Very different than the rest of the park, great view of the falls and gorge from the overlooks. Keep children close, the trails are safe but the overlooks are perched on the edge of the canyon walls.

reviews.name: VailAZTraveler
reviews.title: Great Views
reviews.comment: Recently visited Yellowstone and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone - spectacular views along the rim drive. Great canyon views at the several overlooks along the drive. Great colors in the canyon and spectacular views of the river below.

reviews.name: Angiefl
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment: This is one of my favorite spots and worth taking the time. Currently there are some closures around it but you can still get to most of the picture perfect spots.

reviews.name: Bronie_1997
reviews.title: Wowwwww!
reviews.comment: So much fun, hiking spots, and breathtaking views. Love the river! Such a pretty place to hike the trails. Two of the trails (Uncle Tom's and another one that led to a good view of the fall) had snow on it. Sketchy! We tried hiking Uncle Tom's trail, but the snow was just too much. And it was muddy. But still, cool to say we hiked in the snow.

reviews.name: Gaylen W
reviews.title: Beautiful falls
reviews.comment: Was very crowded, but worth it. Beautiful falls and deep chasms. Some walking, but not difficult with only a few steps to go up or down.

reviews.name: heidi317
reviews.title: Wonderful Views
reviews.comment: Amazing landscapes! Try watching the birds and waterfall instead of taking selfies they are grand. Also stay on the trails and hold onto your hats in windy days!

reviews.name: Vacationer2Maine
reviews.title: Do Not Miss This
reviews.comment: Probably the prettiest thing we saw in the park. The view is amazing. Our guide suggested we avert our eyes from looking at the canyon until we could see it full on to augment the impact, and he was right! The first glimpse is breathtaking. We even saw an asprey nest! Save some time and make your way to this. A trip to the park is not complete without it.

reviews.name: robertwD7057IG
reviews.title: Impressive Deep Canyon
reviews.comment: Most people come to Yellowstone to see Old Faithful and the bears and bison, but the Yellowstone Grand Canyon is definitely worth a visit. The river has carved a very deep gorge with two large waterfalls and numerous rapids. There are a number of trails and vantage points.

reviews.name: Lisa Y
reviews.title: Lots of great views
reviews.comment: The sun off the rocks was incredible the canyon is deep. If you want a good view if lower falls uncle Tom's steps good going down takes your oxygen away come back up at 380 steps

reviews.name: Ticolover
reviews.title: Crowded but great...
reviews.comment:
Part of the road was still closed for snow/ice. It's a record snow year in the park so the melt right now really creates some wonderful waterfalls.
Restrooms had long lines & parking limited in some stopping areas. Also, a lot of trails in both Yellowstone & Tetons are still too snowy or muddy to safely hike.
Plan with caution & always be open to "plan B".

reviews.name: 2BWanderlust
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The lower falls are lovely. I was here in spring so the amount of water flowing was amazing. Birds soaring and bright colors on the canyon.

reviews.name: meischad1
reviews.title: Do not miss this!!
reviews.comment: This was one of the most incredible views we had ever seen. Specifically, we went to the Artist Point stop in the south rim of the canyon. There is some hiking available there, but we just enjoyed the views, which are really awe inspiring.

reviews.name: Jackie B
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: We only got to see a bit of the area due to snow and road closures, but well worth the time and effort.

reviews.name: Travelmoorenow
reviews.title: Love the views
reviews.comment: Be sure to check out the waterfalls. They are great in the spring with the spring run off from the snow.

reviews.name: Tanzey K
reviews.title: Beautiful and awe-inspiring
reviews.comment: We walked to the viewpoint and part of the trail and loved the views. We were also lucky enough to see a soaring osprey.

reviews.name: ColdMamaMN
reviews.title: Busy but beautiful
reviews.comment: Yes, there will be tons of other tourists there taking pictures, but relax and enjoy the global camerade of sharing this truly magnificent sight. With patience, this is an easy place to get epic photos.

reviews.name: Pickypickypickyman
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: An iconic American landscape that should not be missed. Beautiful in every direction. You need to keep an eye on your kids because even though there are walls, they are easily climbable!

reviews.name: Jose Ernesto S
reviews.title: i gotta take a leak.
reviews.comment: Absolutely must see. Section of the park was closed so couldnt see up close. That was a shame. Maybe next time.

reviews.name: Charles R
reviews.title: One of many beautiful places in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: There are more beautiful locations in Yellowstone than any website can cover. Check out several locations / angles. The Canyon and falls look different from each.

reviews.name: DocArch65
reviews.title: Do not miss
reviews.comment: All you have heard is true. Unbelievable view. Color tells you why it's called Yellowstone. Must see. Come early in the year to avoid lines. Will not be disappointed.

reviews.name: uncnme
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Gorgeous views of the canyon, river and striking water fall images! Walk the trail that follows the river canyon to see a new sliver of beauty at every turn!

reviews.name: Arkansastraveler74
reviews.title: Must do in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Beautiful part of the park... must do in Yellowstone. If you are going in May, be careful with the snow and ice on the trail as they were not cleared.

reviews.name: susie c
reviews.title: Almost as good as Washington state
reviews.comment: Really nice but not up to Lamar Valley and we preferred Lamar Valley. Gorgeous scenery but not many animals

reviews.name: Ashley S
reviews.title: Wish I had more time!!
reviews.comment: So perfect! So beautiful. Wish we would have had more time to see more things. But this place and the waterfalls were so beautiful!

reviews.name: Dennis W
reviews.title: Where erosion looks beautiful.
reviews.comment: Not as big as the Grand Canyon but equally if not more interesting regarding the forces at play that formed it. Great colors and multiple viewpoints to enjoy the spectacle.

reviews.name: WearyTraveler1121
reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment: This is a must see!!! Very beautiful location. I had my two little blonde blue eyed babies with me and I was swarmed by Asian tourists snapping pictures of them. It was crazy! Back to the point...this place is beautiful! Don't miss it!!

reviews.name: Rick S
reviews.title: Beautiful views!
reviews.comment: Over the views! My wife has some trouble hiking but this was not a problem. A short walk and we were at the lower falls! The road was still closed to the upper falls.

reviews.name: supermomva
reviews.title: A must do for all visitors!
reviews.comment: Beautiful location! Try to go early in the morning or late in the evening to avoid crowds. Take your camera!

reviews.name: gfm1118
reviews.title: Great Yellowstone Attraction
reviews.comment: This location is a must stop in a visit to Yellowstone. It is colorful, dynamic, unique and bursting with energy from it's water flow and falls. The canyon is dizzyingly steep and deep. The vistas are well placed and could keep you looking all day.

reviews.name: Julie R
reviews.title: Just amazing
reviews.comment:
Stayed at West Yellowstone for 5 days, entered the park by 8am most mornings.
Our first day was a nature overload, we saw bison, elk, a bear, a coyote.
Car parks were mostly quiet, although the coaches did turn up from time to time but we just moved on to quieter areas.
Route from Norris to Mammoth has roadworks so a bit of a hold up there.
Wonderful falls and geysers, we will return.

reviews.name: Shefali M
reviews.title: Must visit!
reviews.comment: Awesome place ...very scenic...however most hiking trails were closed during the month of May. Wud suggest covering the sightseeing locations both in the north rim and the South rim.

reviews.name: Tita T
reviews.title: Beautiful area
reviews.comment: This is the first time we have been here this early. The snow was so beautiful. There seemed to be a lot tourist here for the first part of May. We didn't have any trouble finding a parking place.

reviews.name: Venkat
reviews.title: Astonishing Landscape
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a must see item in your Yellowstone trip.
There are 4 view points to enjoy the magnificent site. 2 of the points are on the rim and are accessible for strollers and where chairs. Other two view points take you closer to the water falls but they need effort as you will walk down around almost 200 feet below the rim level. You can hear the roar of the waterfalls and there is a good view of the falls itself.
It will take almost one full day to enjoy the beauty from all view points. The best time of the year is June-July or Oct-Nov time frame when the temperature above 50-60 degrees.
Please make sure you are wearing sneakers/sport shoes to go the lower view points.

reviews.name: Ajit M
reviews.title: Amazing colors and views. A must see.
reviews.comment: The canyon has amazing color variations in the yellow/orange/sienna palette. We did a couple of short hikes on both side and took in all of the falls in addition to the canyon itself. Allow for three hours to enjoy it all.

reviews.name: Caitie93
reviews.title: Its in the name!
reviews.comment: If you have even wondered how Yellowstone got its name then look no further than the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. Looking down into the Canyon is breathtaking as well as the views up and down the canyon.

reviews.name: tornillo2015
reviews.title: Must see this Natural Beauty
reviews.comment: The Falls area is one of the most beautiful areas of this park. Stunning scenery with tremendous falls and unique beautiful soil in the canyon...has got to be one of the most gorgeous places on earth. Lots of trails and varied overlooks....plan on several hours here to take it all in.

reviews.name: Gary V
reviews.title: Canyon
reviews.comment: The name is very appropriate. "Grand Canyon of The Yellowstone". Scenery is breathtaking. Watching the water is mesmerizing. The power of the water is humbling.

reviews.name: Hulafille
reviews.title: Yellowstone is magical.
reviews.comment: We went on a lot of ranger led hikes as well as private hikes with Yellowstone Association Institute here. There are strong winds here. We had to really hold onto our little kid here. Absolutely beautiful and must see. But then again, what part of Yellowstone isn't beautiful and must see. Be careful of the trails. We saw a lot of young twenty year olds taking selfies and self videos as they walked the trails without paying attention to where they were going. Please take time to take in your surroundings- it is absolutely more magnificent then a selfie.

reviews.name: Feb58
reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.comment: One of the many wonderful places of the park and if you are there then you should visit and enjoy the view.

reviews.name: Mike C
reviews.title: Scenic tour of the west!!
reviews.comment: One of americas most beatyfull spots!! Take the walk out to the point about-a Half mile walk for best View of the falls.

reviews.name: Michael T
reviews.title: Natural Art
reviews.comment:
Are you looking for inspiration? Do you need to see God's glory in His creation? Do you need to be near the natural art left behind by the forces of nature? Look no further. The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a natural wonder that changes lives every day. It is that special.
It is not to be missed during a visit to Yellowstone; especially if it is a once in a lifetime visit for you. Take your time. There are some great hikes at this canyon one might miss, if not made aware. Uncle Tom's Trail will get you a great vantage point of the Lower Falls. Red Rock Point is a trail accessed from Lookout Point. You can get a more direct, straight on view of the Falls from Red Rock Point. It's worth the hike. Both hikes are not too long. But both are steep.
Uncle Tom's Trail has an abundance of steps to conquer. Red Rock trail is steep, but no steps. Have fun!

reviews.name: bittychicken
reviews.title: One of the best views in park
reviews.comment: This really is one of the prettiest sights in Yellowstone. Many people miss this area on a quick drive through the park. I would skip Old Faithful before missing this stop. You will be amazed with the beauty.

reviews.name: Rubpy
reviews.title: JUST GORGEOUS
reviews.comment: Amazing views!!! Yellowstone is just fantastic and unique. Loved everything in this National Park. A must for National Park lovers.

reviews.name: jediknight101
reviews.title: Makes you feel the size of an ant.
reviews.comment: There are many spots to stop and see the canyon. All of them make you feel small next the huge canyon cut down by the Yellowstone River. If you plan on hiking any of the trails, make sure to take along bug spray. With all that water, it is easy to run across a lot of mosquitos.

reviews.name: Hostelkorcaxharshe
reviews.title: Extraordinary place
reviews.comment: Very beautiful view and amazing landscape. Wildlife and nature is impressing. You should pass same days to visit all this park.

reviews.name: Jim S
reviews.title: Breathtakingly beautiful!
reviews.comment: What more needs to be said. The water of the Yellowstone River cuts through the rocks falling many feet. The vantage point is increible! v

reviews.name: Cathy W
reviews.title: Snow Coach Tour is a Must!
reviews.comment: We had a wonderul Xanterra guide that was very funny and witty. He seemed knowledgeable about the area. We a great experience everywhere we stopped and explored. The frozen and half frozen waterfalls were breathtaking. The view of the Tetons from Yellowstone Canyon was amazing! Winter in Yellowstone is a once in a lifetime bucket list absolute must!

reviews.name: IheartZephyr
reviews.title: Stunning Colors
reviews.comment:
In addition to famous and wondrous geothermal features, Yellowstone is also well known for its spectacular canyons and waterfalls. When you visit Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, you can enjoyed not only the beautiful colors of the canyon and its magnificent height but also marvelous sights of the Lower, Upper, and Crystal Falls.
There are numerous views of the Falls and Grand Canyon from both the north and south sides of the Grand Canyon, most of which require only a short walk or virtually no walk to see. However, this is one of the most famous spots at the park so during the peak times of the day, it may be hard to find a parking space. It's always wiser to start the day early for the most famous areas of the park or visit them later in the day.
- From the north side of the canyon: Using the North Rim Drive, you can stop and view the Lower Falls and Grand Canyon of Yellowstone at Inspiration Point, Grand View Point, and Lookout Point. On this side, you can also journey to the top of the falls and feel its extreme power, commanding respect, and intense roar as it drops into the rainbow of mist beneath by hiking down the Brink of the Lower Falls Trail. This is a short 3/4 mile hike but intense with great drop in elevation and a lot of switch backs.
- From the south side of canyon: Using the South Rim Drive, you can stop and view the Lower Falls and Grand Canyon of Yellowstone at Artists Point. Artists Point is where you can have the most beautiful grand view of the Lower Falls together with Grand Canyon of Yellowstone and the snaking Yellowstone River below. On this side, you can also journey down the Uncle Tom's Trail to have a close-up face off with the electrifying Lower Falls.

reviews.name: Patty F
reviews.title: Breathtaking! Have your camera ready!
reviews.comment: There are areas of Yellowstone that are not to be missed and this is definitely one of those! If possible opt for ranger guided walks/talks as the knowledge they share with visitors makes for a more complete park experience!

reviews.name: Coltcritic
reviews.title: Number One
reviews.comment: This is by far the best thing in the park for a reason. Perfect for nature-lovers, national park aficionados, photographers, artists, writers, sightseers, basic tourists, and those who have seen it all. Every perspective is a masterpiece to inspire an artist and to awe any viewer. No wait is needed to see this like Old Faithful, no large crowds at one spot like other geysers, and no need to move around to feel like you have fully experienced it as this canyon feels like every single location is a new experience. The falls, the river, the hikes (both the strenuous and easy ones), and everything in between were some of the best experiences of my life. Even the large stairway to get to the falls isn't enough to hinder my opinion on this wonder of the world.

reviews.name: tonyadamron
reviews.title: a must see for photographers
reviews.comment: take the time and go, you won't be disappointed..as a photographer it was just something beautiful to see

reviews.name: Lhotse Q
reviews.title: Amazing! Be prepared to climb stairs!
reviews.comment: This place is one of the highlights of the park! The waterfall is amazing and there are different places you can climb down to see it from different angles!. The trails are safe, but they are not recommended to people with knee or back problems (you need to climb a lot of stairs), however, there are accesible places to look at the Canyon from the top.

reviews.name: J3_Rye
reviews.title: One of the high-points of the park
reviews.comment:
Gorgeous views from many different perspectives. Should not be missed during any season in the park.
Can be extremely busy during the peak season

reviews.name: elyhtak
reviews.title: Beautiful views, great hikes
reviews.comment: We hiked the north and south rim trails with a 2 year old. He was able to walk good portions of it and we wore him on our backs the rest of the way. Some parts are more strenuous than others so I think you can plan to do portions according to your abilities.

reviews.name: NG F
reviews.title: This is one of my favorite spots in the park.
reviews.comment:
There is a view point with benches and we just sit there and look and listen.
Near sunset is especially spectacular.
There are vintage and vintage copies of photos and postcards of this spot.
This is my happy place.
When I'm stressed, I just remember my last visit. :)
There are some stairs but not like some parts of the park which are up and up and up and down and down and down and can be slippery.
(June 2015 and two visits before.)

reviews.name: TreadingGrain
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: One of the highlights of Yellowstone. Our favorite time to visit was at twilight as the setting sun made the river look like molten, flowing, gold.

reviews.name: John Sowell
reviews.title: Great part of the park.
reviews.comment:
I stopped first at the Brink of the Lower Falls, the initial stop on the one-way, mile-long North Rim Drive located just south of Canyon Village.
There's 10 switchbacks on the trail that bring you down 800 feet in altitude to reach the top of the lower falls and the magnificent views of the canyon. Don't think about the hike back up. Just know that the views at the bottom are so worth it.
This is one of the highlights of Yellowstone, yet one that can be easily missed by those who don't realize how spectacular the Yellowstone River canyon is.

reviews.name: JessMTATravel
reviews.title: Wildlife Haven
reviews.comment:
This is more of a review of the park as a whole and covers a variety of sights. Be prepared for a long wait to get into the park if you are visiting in the busy months of July / August. I think we were lined up outside of the park for about 30 mins just trying to get in. This was in the South Entrance. We first went to the West Thumb area where we saw 6 female elks lazing in the grass. There is a walk here which is about 800 meters around the various types of Geysers. Also stop at the Volcano Mud Pools which is pretty interesting. Here we got up close with some Bison that were sunbathing on the path. Then stopped at the Lower and Upper Falls. Not far from here is the "Grand Canyon of Yellowstone" which is a large canyon filled with beautiful reds, oranges and browns in colour. Head to Norris Geyser Basin which is a 1.6km round trip with lots of colourful Geysers to look at. Gibbon Falls is a great waterfall if you just want a good view from the parking lot. The Middle Geyser Basin is home to the famous Grand Prismatic Geyser - this is the colourful one always used in the brochures. It is extremely impressive but if the weather is bad or windy you won't see too much. We had a lot of steam and wind and really couldn't see too much. We had to wait for a break in the wind before we saw the colours.
One thing to note is that the parking in the park in summer is ridiculous. There are not enough car park spaces for the large amount of tourists especially in summer so you will end up parked on the side of the road and walk in. Be mindful do not park in spaces that say no parking. We did see people checking parked cars and writing out tickets.
Overall the park is just amazing. It is mostly all about wildlife and geysers so if you like them then you will have a blast. Try and go in either May or late August early September to avoid the traffic madness.

reviews.name: Meri C
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: Had never heard of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone before this trip, but we were very impressed. The different colors and layers of the walls look like a child's kaleidoscope, changing as the sun moves.

reviews.name: AlaskansinOR
reviews.title: Spectacular in Winter
reviews.comment: Even in the cold/wind/fog and rain this is a spectacular canyon. Snow coach ride there was quite fun. Viewed the canyon from both sides and various points.

reviews.name: Denise M
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: We loved hiking in the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone! We hiked both the Lower Falls Brink Trail (3/8 mi. and 600 foot drop) and the Uncle Tom's Trail (328 steps down in the canyon for a beautiful view of the Lower Falls), and although both trails were steep, they were both worth it! We also stayed at the new Canyon Hotel, and everything was brand new and lovely. We walked over to the cafeteria for breakfast, which was nice because it was quick, cheap, and had good options. We liked staying in the Canyon Area because of it's central location ... we would stay here again. We liked that it was less crowded than either the Old Faithful or Mammoth areas, and yet we could easily drive to both locations.

reviews.name: s00ziStL
reviews.title: The best views are had early morning when the crowds are still waking-up.
reviews.comment:
Busses crowd into the parking lots all year round.
Go after Labor Day and get up early to beat them to the best spots.
Don't be afraid to pull off the road into one of the hundreds of spaces to enjoy your little piece of Yellowstone to yourself.

reviews.name: Chloeferg192
reviews.title: Can't Miss It.
reviews.comment: The stairs might get you on the way back up, but it is an absolute must. Really remarkable and great for young kids. We cannot wait to go again.

reviews.name: rich n
reviews.title: In the winter it is a whole different park
reviews.comment: This is a great place to stop off at, and take some time to look around, remember don't just take pictures try videos too with sound

reviews.name: Ivette Reviewerson
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: Such a beautiful and magnificent place. They have some steps to go down and get best view but are pretty steep and before you even start the trail to descend it warns you of who shouldn't attempt it. I didn't do it as I'm affraid of heights and wasn't in good physical shape but my daughter and husband went down and they loved it. They did say it was slippery at times.

reviews.name: tritschsydney
reviews.title: Exploring the Beauty of Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
Yellowstone National Park holds beautiful and untouched land of the United States. My family and friends took part in the Yellowstone Lower Loop full day tour, stopping at many attractions. On the tour, we went to Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, Grand Prismatic Spring, and Firehole Canyon. Yellowstone opened my eyes to how beautiful the natural world is.
One of the places we went was the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. The tour bus stopped at the entrance, so we could hike to the canyon. Our tour guide informed us about the area of Yellowstone and the wildlife it contained. On the journey to the canyon, I saw lots of wildlife I hadn’t seen before. The wild animals were ginormous and fascinating. The canyon was astonishing. Canyons and mountains surrounded a giant waterfall and a blue river. Looking around, I saw the most beautiful picture of the earth and wildlife engulfing me. Until I went to the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, I never realized how big the world was compared to the small town I live in.
In Yellowstone, the tour took us to the Grand Prismatic Spring. The hike to the spring was enjoyable because there were small hot springs all around that you could look into. It was important to stay on the path so we didn’t disturb wildlife or accidentally step in a boiling spring. After being amazed by the hot springs on the way, my mind was blown when I finally reached Grand Prismatic. In order to get a view of the entire spring, we had to climb a hill that looks onto it. The vibrant colors of Grand Prismatic make it a must see. Blue, red, orange, and pink filled the steaming water below us. Grand Prismatic is the most fascinating sight I have ever seen. I had no idea the world contained such breathtaking features.
The excursion to Firehole Canyon was my favorite adventure during the Yellowstone tour. Firehole Canyon is a beautiful canyon connected to the Firehole River. Part of the canyon consisted of still, warm water that we got to relax in. The water was the perfect temperature for swimming because the river is connected to various hot springs in Yellowstone. It was very peaceful relaxing on the rocks in the water and looking around at the beautiful cliffs and mountains surrounding me. Firehole Canyon also has an area with cliffs and rapids. It was exhilarating to jump off of the cliffs and into the rapids. My friends and I spent hours flinging ourselves into the fast-moving rapids. We had a lot of fun at Firehole Canyon, while still enjoying beautiful scenery.
Yellowstone National Park opened my eyes to a world outside of the city. I recommend going on the Yellowstone tour to enjoy beautiful scenery and wildlife. The tour provided lots of information and fun as we traveled through the park. Taking part in the Yellowstone tour allowed to me to experience and see sights that were once unknown to me.

reviews.name: GMS1556
reviews.title: OK not the Grand Canyon, but pretty cool
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful geological feature. There are several access points and all are worth a visit. The Yellowstone River has cut this 20 mile canyon with 3 outstanding water falls, the Lower Fall being the highest.

reviews.name: Gary M
reviews.title: Beautiful in winter
reviews.comment: Once in a lifetime experience in the winter. Spectacular view of the canyon with ice formations everywhere.

reviews.name: pedz55
reviews.title: Unexpected!
reviews.comment: This was sort of a bonus for us. We were expecting geysers, pools, bison, mountains, etc. I didn't realize how significant this is. It is a beautiful canyon with a very dramatic waterfall. There are multiple look out points which I recommend trying for the variety of views. There is also a hike to the bottom that we didn't get a chance to try, but I hear is worth it. Try visiting at different times of the day, the colors vary significantly.

reviews.name: jbwhitehouse
reviews.title: Special in the Winter
reviews.comment: Snow blankets the canyon, but Clark's Nutcrackers happily sings their song. The waterfall is partially frozen. A big "snowball" is formed in front of the falls as water spray from the waterfall freezes. Beautiful. Grateful to behold such a vision. Fabulous view.

reviews.name: Hattie748
reviews.title: Can't Miss....Fantastic, more than words can express
reviews.comment: it is worth the short walk to get a full view. Be sure to bring your camera and just stay a while and just listen, look and meditate on this great beauty, God's creation.

reviews.name: catherine m
reviews.title: dream come true
reviews.comment: My fiance and I were a little shocked by the colder weather during October this past year but we didn't let that stop us from adventuring down to the scenic spot to see the breathtaking site. Not only could we feel the cool water spraying our face, the sun reflecting on the water making it look like 100 colors, but most importantly we saw how truly beautiful nature can be when its properly preserved. Even though we didn't plan on it being as chilly as it was i would still visit during this time because we almost had the park to ourselves!

reviews.name: angelina
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: This is one of the best things I have ever seen. This view is absolutely stunning. I did the walk down to the lower view of the waterfall. I am not sure this was necessary. It is quite a trek back up. This is a must see!

reviews.name: nevadatraveler13
reviews.title: grand canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: It's harder than you think doing the littel switchbacks to get to the falls. I lived at high elevations (4400 ft. ) at the the time and still had to take a few rests. Was it worth it? Absolutely. Take a few breathers on the way back up, you'll be glad you did.

reviews.name: Saumyashree M
reviews.title: Awesome!!
reviews.comment: The view was spectacular. we took the little hike down to the scenic spot. I remember seeing a rainbow. You have to see it to believe it.

reviews.name: AvidTraveler1515
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Awesome waterfall(Lower falls). Uncle Tom’s Trail is totally worth it.The trial goes from the top of the canyon to the base of lower falls.

reviews.name: SteveParker116
reviews.title: An amazing spot in an amazing park
reviews.comment: The mostly frozen waterfall is always a treat. We skied into a spot and hiked down a trail to get full frontal views. Not a hard hike.

reviews.name: More Than B
reviews.title: Amazed!
reviews.comment:
Incredible views of this spectacular nature gift.
Visited on September and was supposed to be "low" season, we had to drive a bit to get a spot.
Easy walks to viewpoints.

reviews.name: gitdownbrown1972
reviews.title: Amazing Grand Canyon of Yellowstone!
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful waterfalls you could ever see. You don't want to miss seeing the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone on your visit to Yellowstone. It is absolutely beautiful.

reviews.name: SusanMFlorida
reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.comment:
We have been misled by other sites that call themselves
the 'Grand Canyon of the ---' before, but this stop actually lived up to it name, somewhat. It's not the Grand Canyon, but it's a deep sliver of a canyon with an impressive falls and a river cutting through it that is worth the short hike to view it.

reviews.name: Jon A
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: This is really spectacular. The canyon really beautiful. Wonderful for nature shots and getting pictures taken with a loved one. One of the must sees in the park.

reviews.name: JakubWrobel
reviews.title: Unbelievable place!
reviews.comment: It's been years since I've been, but this place is unbelievable. The views are breathtaking and just being in the middle of one of the most famous National Parks is just amazing.

reviews.name: idle_indian
reviews.title: Treat for eyes !!
reviews.comment: This has to be one of the most beautiful places in Yellowstone national park. There is a medium level hike before you reach to the view point both from North and South rim. Really a treat for the eyes

reviews.name: Samantha
reviews.title: Great Views, but crowded look out
reviews.comment: I've stopped here on both of my trips to Yellowstone. It is worth a visit, however tour buses are also always dropping people off so there are always large crowds.

reviews.name: indyemmett
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: We loved Yellowstone, but this isn't the most spectacular canyon our country has to offer. It is still amazing and beautiful and a Yellowstone icon that you cannot miss.

reviews.name: Brian O
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: No matter where you view from, North Rim, South Rim its Spectacular! The yellow canyon walls gave Yellowstone it's name. Upper falls, Lower Falls visit them all, you will be impressed.

reviews.name: Golgina
reviews.title: A Must See
reviews.comment: This should be the top hike of Yellowstone. There are beautiful sites after every turn and it is well marked. After you hike about 1/2 mile or less, you will leave behind the point-and-shoot crowd and have the entire path to yourself. Our six and eight year old grandkids had not trouble with this.

reviews.name: maskiano
reviews.title: Awesome Experience
reviews.comment:
Whoever said that the us does not have natural tourist spots has not visited this place!
Even for seasoned travelers, this place is a must-see! Words would not be enough to capture the beauty of this place!
It is a great place for family or friends!

reviews.name: 04Beau99
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Beautiful views, definitely take your camera. It can get crowded so earlier is better to visit, parking is limited.

reviews.name: Bethney D
reviews.title: Beautiful and a MUST SEE
reviews.comment: Breathtaking and a must see if you are going to visit Yellowstone. We took our time and sat quietly to take in the beauty of the scene. We went in August and didn't feel like there were too many people around, some crowds but manageable.

reviews.name: adamreebel
reviews.title: Truly is the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: I went here when half the park was closed due to snow. It's a stunning waterfall and the views from all lookouts are amazing! The hike down the the brink is not long but does have elevation change. I would spend at least an hour or two here to see the falls from different views and spend time hiking around!

reviews.name: Yongliang R
reviews.title: Fantastic Hidden Gem of Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
When I heard of Grand Canyon, I only thought of the one, you know, the GRAND CANYON in Arizona. I didn't know there was one in Yellowstone. When I reached around 4pm. Damn, was I delightfully surprised. You could hear the roar of the tall waterfall. I think there was a path to go near it, but I didn't go down. I stayed on the safer and higher side of the canyon.
The path were well-paved, it ain't muddy nor rocky, quite feet-friendly, most of the path were wheelchair friendly too. Looking across the canyon was nothing very spectacular. The best part was looking down into the canyon. The sunlight, on that day, was bright and brought out the contrast of the rugged surface of the cliffs. The colours of the canyon walls and the blue water of the river was beautiful without photoshop.
I believe the trek can go on and on and on, I didn't venture too far. I do see there are people across the canyon on the other side. So, you probably could spend a good half a day if you are into photography. If not, just 40min - 1hr is a pretty comfortable time.
Oh, we got a bonus to see a hawk chasing off a raven which flew too near to its nest.

reviews.name: lmitravel
reviews.title: Beautiful view indeed!
reviews.comment: Tremendous view over the canyon towards the falls. Nice hiking in the area. We went in early October 2016 and it wasn't crowded at a. The weather was perfect and the early afternoon sun was lovely for photos.

reviews.name: GatorGirl428
reviews.title: Breath taking
reviews.comment: I haven't been to the Grand Canyon, but I am amazed that it is more grand than this. It is so neat to look at the layers in the canyon walls.

reviews.name: ClaudiusSapiens
reviews.title: Yellowstone - grand canyon
reviews.comment: Superb and amazing. Best outside the highly touristy season (avoid the summer). Use the maps provided to find the best spots.

reviews.name: Kathy K
reviews.title: Another must do
reviews.comment: Can't describe the scenery and how beautiful it is. Make sure you get out of your car and take it all in. Many hikes in the surrounding area. All worth it

reviews.name: awchandc
reviews.title: Stunning views!
reviews.comment: You must stop here. The views of the canyons are spectacular. I would say they rival the Grand Canyon in AZ.

reviews.name: SCF314
reviews.title: Beautiful views and good hiking!
reviews.comment: This is a must-see. There are several trails to take, some easier than others. We took the Lower Falls trail (was with my two children, 10 & 12), and that was a good distance and difficulty, basically straight down and back up. Beautiful view of the falls, river above and beyond, and canyon. We were even treated with a rainbow!

reviews.name: WmacEureka
reviews.title: Just amazing
reviews.comment: We enjoyed absolutely everything in Yellowstone and this was one of the highlights. The view from the top is spectacular. Unfortunately, due to time constraints, we were unable to hike to the bottom but we spoke to a lovely couple who said it was well worth it. I can't say enough good things about Yellowstone. I think everyone should visit, we certainly plan to do so many more times!

reviews.name: Reed W
reviews.title: The topography is amazing
reviews.comment: Had to stop and visit this site during a recent cross country road trip, it never disappoints one. A hidden favorite!

reviews.name: Victoria M
reviews.title: Scenery Splendor
reviews.comment: If you're doing Yellowstone you have to do this little trail. It is part of Yellowstone's grandeur and everywhere you look there's something special. We enjoyed the time spent here.

reviews.name: Gill69
reviews.title: Picture postcard views
reviews.comment:
Just amazing views - felt like we were in the pages of National Geographic magazine.
Not much more to say than don't miss it.

reviews.name: Norman B
reviews.title: My favorite view...
reviews.comment:
This is an amazing part of the park!
Check it out, take pictures and make sure you walk around the trails around it.

reviews.name: Apisak J
reviews.title: Fantastic Canyon, IMO better than The Grand Canyon in Arizona
reviews.comment: I have visit this place during the summer break, then went to Arizona Grand Canyon. In my mind, the Yellowstone is a must-once-in-life visit place. The whole scenery is excellent and unique. The air is clean and fresh. During the trekking, I even saw some of the bear's claw scratch on the tree. Definitely this must be heaven on earth. If I have any chance I will make another visit again and keep my finger crossed that I would run into a bear within a safety distance.

reviews.name: Lkrr99
reviews.title: Park
reviews.comment: Great place to stop for something to do and look around. Everything from visitor center to general store and restaurant. A little something for everyone .

reviews.name: Sampath D
reviews.title: Fantastic and better than Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: I went during summer time with family and wasn't sure whether it's worth all the way going up north but we're simply blown away by the beauty of the canyon. I felt better than Grand Canyon!!!

reviews.name: Denise B
reviews.title: Am I Looking at a Postcard?
reviews.comment: The view of this magnificent water fall is amazing at any lookout point or from any angle. This is what makes Yellowstone so special. There is such a wide diversity of things to see. If you don't visit this side of the park, you won't realize there is a beautiful canyon with many colors and with a waterfall that is still rushing in September. While on this side of the park, see the wild life in Hayden Valley. Wherever you choose to view this magnificent canyon, please stay on the correct side of the rope/handrail. Do not put your life at risk to get the "perfect picture".

reviews.name: Donna S
reviews.title: Beautiful! Be sure to visit both upper and lower falls.
reviews.comment: We enjoyed the hike down to the "Brink of the Falls" for the upper falls, bit the brink hike for the lower falls is crazy difficult! You can see them in all their beauty from afar at Inspiration Point and Artist Point.

reviews.name: dianakh
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Wow what a place to see, takes your breath away, so many different colours in the rocks - our photo of the view is my screen saver!

reviews.name: Garrett
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing
reviews.comment: Now don't get me wrong the Grand Canyon is much grander so I came here not expecting much however I couldn't be more wrong the colors were amazing I had to force myself to put the camera away so I could simply gaze out at the natural beauty. If your at Yellowstone don't miss this its number one for a reason

reviews.name: sorabh
reviews.title: Nature
reviews.comment: We were there during a day with rain and snow. View was breathtaking and peaceful. It is certainly deep but enjoyable for die hard hikers. The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is favorite stops for great hiking around the rim but be careful for wildlife. Take precautions accordingly. Steps down to the waterfall are hard. Adequate parking but it could be nightmare in tourist season

reviews.name: JohnandPam
reviews.title: Unexpected
reviews.comment: This was an unusual attraction that we saw on our Globus bus tour. We did not expect to see this canyon in Yellowstone. It is a prime spot for taking many pictures.

reviews.name: Vad A.
reviews.title: Not a Grand Canyon, but still great
reviews.comment:
When I first visited the Park 10 years ago, this was what impressed me the most.
The combination of the water power, canyon geometry and different colors gives a great impression. Definitely try to go to the Artist Point, but the crowds can spoil the whole ting: I was there about 4 PM and it looked and sounded like a market place! Try to go late in the sunset instead (the mornings are for animal watching here).
In terms of getting there - one of the easiest, right at the canyon village, and closest to the East entrance (towards Cody, WY).

reviews.name: Harrison F. Carter
reviews.title: A definite part of any visit to Yellowstone NP
reviews.comment: This is something that is often said, and I don't often agree with - but in this instance, photographs do not do this place justice. It was way more impressive than I was thinking in the build up to the visit. It is worth seeing from both sides - each offer very different worthwhile experiences. Get up close with the waterfall. The volume of water (both in terms of the capacity and the noise) is extraordinary. Quite a lot of descending to do in both cases, and therefore the return ascent - so bear that in mind before heading down. Wonderful.

reviews.name: cindy b
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: The best of Yellowstone - experience both upper and lower falls hikes to awesome views of the deep valley and waterfalls.

reviews.name: LoriM
reviews.title: The view is GRAND
reviews.comment: We were there during a few days with rain and snow and the waterfall was full and wonderful to see. The view was breathtaking and peaceful. I didn't want to leave that sight.

reviews.name: betty f
reviews.title: A must SEE
reviews.comment: We go to Artist Point around 10:00am and had a great view of the falls. from there we did Uncle's Tom trail, the brink to the upper fall and the brink to the lower fall, and at last the red rock look out point. There are a lot of steps down and then up on all of these trails, but you must do it to see these falls from all points of view.

reviews.name: TDHSNJ
reviews.title: Soothing waterfall
reviews.comment: Go to the middle vantage point and walk out area to see this picturesque area of Yellowstone and if you catch it in the right light, you'll get some great photos.

reviews.name: Elizabeth W
reviews.title: Must do...and from all angles
reviews.comment: We caught this from artists point in the fog, hiked uncle toms trail, and then caught it in the cloudless sunshine. One of our highlights of the park.

reviews.name: Alex
reviews.title: No, it's not a comparison to the "real" Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: So, enthused by the many reviews I went with too high expectations. Yes, it is certainly deep and impressive. No it isn't one of the seven natural wonders of the world! Enjoy it for what it is, but Yellowstone has much more amazing wonders to behold like Hayden Valley with bison and grizzlies, geyser fields galore and wolves in Lamar Valley.

reviews.name: Road_Bear57
reviews.title: Great views!
reviews.comment: We love seeing the canyon and waterfalls from different angles. Even amateurs can get fantastic shots here. You can choose easy walking paths or strenuous hikes, depending on your ability. A must see.

reviews.name: aboyer8
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was one of my favorite stops in the park. There is so much great hiking around the rim offering breathtaking views. Some of the trails were closed for the season by the time we got there in mid september, but there were so many other trails open, it didn't matter.
If you are going to hike (and I mean really hike, not stopping where the sidewalk ends) the trails, just like everywhere in Yellowstone, be prepared! Have water and bear spray. Try to go in groups and talk loudly to scare off any bears or other wildlife that may be near by. While we didn't see any bears, we saw plenty of things that let us know they were nearby (... big piles of fresh poo...). I don't say that to scare anyone off from hiking. Just be prepared so you can enjoy it!
The steps down to the waterfall are hard, but so worth it! Please seriously consider if you think you are up for it. I am pretty fit and still had to stop coming back up. There are benches in different spots along the way for you to stop and rest. Also consider if you are ok with open heights. The steps are see through and can be a little unnerving if you don't like heights.
There was a good amount of parking. But again, we were there mid September. I've heard horror stories about the summer.

reviews.name: Tetlamahte
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Take the trails and enjoy nature! walking these trails to the water fall was the best part of our visit.

reviews.name: oli h
reviews.title: Wow - worth the long steep hike
reviews.comment: GC of Y is simply gorgeous. You can easily see why it is called Yellow'. From the parking lot there is a healthy moderately steep switchback trail and it is worth the hike down and then, of course, back up. You are right at the falls with the roar and mist - great photo opps and quite magical place. Also hike the other side along the rim for spectacular views.

reviews.name: Saurav S
reviews.title: silent awe
reviews.comment:
Yes that is what we experienced when we reached and hiked along the rim here. You will just keep on looking at the falls and the valley and will have little time to talk with your party. The beauty of nature will engulf you in silence.
as you go down the stairs the falls look different. As you hike along the rim, each vista point will give you a different view and perspective. You will also hike between some geothermal area which is kind of neat.
Overall a great hike and great views.

reviews.name: Yali L
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: For the better view, you need to get to the view point and look around. The fall looks great from different angles. From the video point, if you look to the right, you see color walls of the canyon.

reviews.name: Mike C
reviews.title: Scenic parks tour
reviews.comment: What a beatyfull spot !!! It's a 1/2 mile walk to a lookout point make the path for a great lookout area wher you look one wat you see a 309 ft waterfalls neayufill. Like the other way you see a yellow walls of the canon .

reviews.name: trouthook69
reviews.title: Simply gorgeous
reviews.comment: This area as well a the rest of the park is simply magnificent. The Yellowstone national park and all of its sites are nothing short of the ultimate place to visit. There is nothing to say but make it a bucket list spot and go in may after snow is off roads and you will be able to see all the wildlife of the park

reviews.name: luckylanna
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: We were lucky enough to be there while it was snowing, which was a unique look. The views are truly amazing. A must-see when in Yellowstone Nat'l Park.

reviews.name: 48Fred48
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: Boy I was not expecting this. We spent 5 weeks in West USA & Canada, along with the rain forest on Vancouver Island this was the best placed visited amongst loads of fantastic sites. People go to Yellowstone for the ‘bubbly water’….but this was just mind blowing

reviews.name: Richard X
reviews.title: Magnificent view
reviews.comment: We were there in rain then turned to snow. So we chose not to walk the trails. The canyon is so deep and color is beautiful. I wish to have a chance to walk the trails later.

reviews.name: MTRoamer
reviews.title: Worth the stop, short hike, beautiful scenary.
reviews.comment: This never fails to amaze me how beautiful this area is and what nature is capable of creating. Worth the steps to get there and the crowd fighting and patience for a picture.

reviews.name: missisyippi
reviews.title: Yellowstones National Park
reviews.comment:
A Bucket List to be checked!! Bisons, Bears, Foxes, Wolves, Swans and Wild Ducks - animals watch - excellent for little children as well as for all ages. Stay at lease 2 days to a week to explore the park!
Beautiful lake for pictures!
Don't miss the Good Old Faithful and many more!!

reviews.name: Ralph S
reviews.title: Grand Canyon is well worth the drive and the walk
reviews.comment: When you are driving through the park, you just have to go see this part of the park. The views are breathtaking and the sounds are glorious.

reviews.name: BassetMa
reviews.title: Great view of canyon and falls
reviews.comment: Must see view of canyon and falls (from Artist Point). There is also a canyon drive and you can hike various trails and down to the falls itself. The hikes are a bit steep if you are out of shape. A must see.

reviews.name: Miyukiloveart
reviews.title: October travel
reviews.comment:
I went there with my friend.
Uncle Tom trail is very steep , easy to go down hard to clim up. Still fun .

reviews.name: Sharon T
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: There is not one part of Yellowstone that is not amazing. The falls are beautiful. The scenery is not paralled anywhere else in the USA.

reviews.name: Nancy H
reviews.title: A spectacular canyon and waterfall.
reviews.comment: This site provides excellent opportunity to get some fantastic photos. A beautiful waterfall, the Yellowstone River, and a deep canyon provide great subject matter.

reviews.name: Jake E
reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.comment: This is a fantastic site to visit in Yellowstone! We only got to spend a few minutes here but it was absolutely worth it. Check it out!

reviews.name: reddog8854
reviews.title: Words and Photos do not do it justice, you must experience it!
reviews.comment: This was the first time for me to travel west. My traveling companion has been to the area several times. After being back home now for a couple weeks, I am still in awe over the beauty that encompasses Yellowstone. From making the hike down the switchbacks to the lower falls, to the sweeping vistas of artist point, looking back at the falls where we had just stood, feeling the power of the rushing water, it is nothing less then awe inspiring. If you want to find yourself becoming emotional over the absolute beauty that is available to all of us in this country, this is the place for that to happen.

reviews.name: SharpShoey
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Amazing natural beauty here and well worth the time to visit. The vivid colors in the earth, the Lower and Upper Falls, so many spots for photographs! We had no idea this would be such a grand sight as it doesn't get the press or attention that Old Faithful gets. Probably the most beautiful area of Yellowstone National Park.

reviews.name: Raquel F
reviews.title: Love this view
reviews.comment: Prior to this, I had never seen a canyon before. It was absolutely breathtaking. Wish we had time to do some of the longer hikes to get away from the crowd. We did the north side overlook. The switchbacks were literally breathtaking... lol but so worth it.

reviews.name: annacV5721VY
reviews.title: Beyond words
reviews.comment: Got to see the falls this year just after a fresh snow storm, the site was so beautiful with the canyon colors and the snow.

reviews.name: Mulherin
reviews.title: Breathtaking Sight
reviews.comment: It was a steep walk down to view the lower falls but worth every step when we got there. The beauty of the falls is amazing. The walk back up was helped by benches along the way and a chance to catch our breath! Don't miss this incredible wonder.

reviews.name: Dottie B
reviews.title: Beautiful Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Loved it. So pretty. The colors of the different rock layers is amazing. Hike both trails, the Northern Rim and the Southern Rim for different view of the canyon and the falls.

reviews.name: Wildsongs
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment: A short walk from the parking lot to the stone wall that runs along the path, will bring you to the lookout that gives you this amazing view of the Falls. Do not miss this!

reviews.name: Jan C
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The 300 foot falls (Yellowstone River) are spectacular, and the walls of the canyon with all their beautiful coloration are breathtaking. Well worth going to see!

reviews.name: Gayle T
reviews.title: Well worth the trip
reviews.comment: The park is beautiful. We spent 2 days and went thru 1 loop each day. Signs are sparse-only at intersections- and the speed limit is usually 45 mph....this is great for the animals that will meander across the road and as traffic stops look for wildlife. Mammoth Springs was AMAZING.

reviews.name: TallTraveler2013
reviews.title: Yep, There is Another Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Everything about Yellowstone seems to be very big and the canyon is no exception. Okay, so it's not "THE" Grand Canyon, but it is still very beautiful and quite impressive. Make sure you stop to tale a look when you're in the park.

reviews.name: cbhb68
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Waterfalls that were magnificent-colored rock- awe struck by the beauty of the whole area. Make sure you ride around the whole area-north and south sides. Photo opportunities galore.

reviews.name: A C R
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is a pleasant surprise in that it lives up to the pictures that you see posted everywhere. There are numerous overlook locations and plenty of hiking trails for all abilities. We took a Ranger-led walk on the South Rim and it was very enjoyable and informative.

reviews.name: Cynthia K
reviews.title: Fabulous!
reviews.comment:
If you only have 2 days to spend in the park, one of them has to be at Canyons. This is a fabulous area. This was our 3rd trip to Yellowstone & we came here all 3 times.
Canyons is a very busy place. I would recommend the same advice I give to everyone : when visiting a busy national park GET UP EARLY!! Shower the night before. Eat a light breakfast (not in a restaurant) & get over there!! In the summer this place is jump'in.
There are 2 main areas. The North Rim & South Rim. Both are equally beautiful, but due to construction, we've spent more time at the South Rim. The parking area in the South Rim is huge. The view of the Lower Falls spectacular. There's a few day hikes you can access at this point. The Canyon Rim South Trail is 3.5 miles one way, but fantastic views can be seen at many points on the trail. Walk a little way & then go back when you get tired.
The North Rim parking is a problem. If you go later in the day, you will have stress. This road is one way traffic only. Inspiration Point is a highlight. There's also the North Rim Trail, which is 3 miles one way. There's also a lot of great views.
Canyons has a large shopping area, with restaurants, the General Store, an outdoor outfitter & the Visitor Center. There's also a campground with laundry & showers.

reviews.name: cleopatraCapeTown
reviews.title: fantabulous...
reviews.comment: our highlight possibly as there were less people but none the less it is extraordinary. There are boardwalks and wooden stairs on either side which go quite a way down giving beautiful views of the canyon. Wear sensible shoes..don't forget water and sunscreen.

reviews.name: Alan L
reviews.title: Simply spectacular
reviews.comment: A really must visit destination eminently reachable attraction, walk down to the top of the lower falls it is worth the effort

reviews.name: Storm S
reviews.title: Awe-inspiring views that launched the idea of national parks in 1872
reviews.comment: Pack a picnic lunch, you'll be out all day. The bare rocks of the Yellowstone "grand" Canyon are truly golden yellow, (and in places even tangerine orange and russet red), hence "Yellow stone". We walked to a viewpoint along the Uncle Tom's Cabin Trail, and could see the Yellowstone River clearly as it pelted over a steep precipice and into the gorge below. We followed the trail down a winding track, the air scented with pine resin, almost to the base of the falls. After a mile or so, the path stopped abruptly, 380 steps on several steel connected platforms took us to the valley floor, where the spray creates misty rainbows. Not suitable for anyone with vertigo.

reviews.name: Barb k
reviews.title: Mother Nature is amazing!!
reviews.comment: If you ever get a chance to visit Yellowstone you really need to see ALL of it! Old Faithful is great but there is so much more to the park than that. The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is so amazing. You only have to let your imagination go and you will realize how incredible our world really is. Norris Geysers are so amazing also. You will do some walking but so worth it! Just think that you are walking on the boardwalks above the worlds larger volcano!!! Think about that for a minute....must put it on your bucket list!

reviews.name: Alain L
reviews.title: Stunned & Speechless, Truly Magnificent.
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was scenic stop on our Caravan Bus Tour. I was truly stunned and speechless. I'll have to agree with everything that has been said by the other reviewers, at the risk of sounding repetitive. Take a good camera and give yourself plenty of time to soak in this beautiful attraction.

reviews.name: CiCiWong0822
reviews.title: Cool~~~Spectacular Canyon to travel in autumn
reviews.comment: It was a breathtaking experience to Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, rapid watering with special trees around. From the upper fall to the lower fall, there are colorful rocks like oil paintings. The best location to appreciate the grand canyon is the Artist Point.

reviews.name: alexandrah260
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment:
This is such a beautiful location also for walking a trail, very nice scenery and you can spend all day here.
The further up the trail the more quiet it becomes.

reviews.name: CTtraveler6665
reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.comment: The park is amazing all around and this is an imperative part to include. Many easy/steep paths at your discretion. Don't miss!

reviews.name: Barbara C
reviews.title: Quite a view
reviews.comment: very easy to view in Sept/off season but it must be awful in peak season to be able to view safely but that is also why we went in sept

reviews.name: RoadtripCowboy
reviews.title: Spectacular vistas
reviews.comment: In the eastern part of the park we hiked the trail to the sheer cliffs and waterfalls of Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. There were significant crowds that summer Thursday braving the somewhat steep and windy trails down then back up again. The platforms at the base by the waterfall revealed the expansive views of the canyon valley stretching for miles. There is another viewing platform on the other side that is accessed through another vantage point. It was good for a little while to get outside and see some awesome scenery.

reviews.name: John T
reviews.title: Great Views
reviews.comment: I hiked all the the paths down to the water below and stopped at all viewpoints. Hikes are not real bad although coming back up can be a bit of a chore. Thought this was the best views in all of Yellowstone especially when viewing from the top of the lower falls.

reviews.name: TravelingMedTech
reviews.title: Amazing View's and Unforgettable
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was amazing. A short 0.6 mile hike uphill to the Artist Point gave great views in any directions. A must see, there were trails as well but I didn't do any of them due to time. Ranger was at the Artist Point to give info and ranger talks about the canyon.

reviews.name: MJC104
reviews.title: Take My Breath Away!
reviews.comment: Fantastic and awesome experience; unbelievable view that takes your breath away! I took a picture with my phone, and the photo was phenomenal, but not because of me.....God's work.

reviews.name: dasandman
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Do not miss this place. We were not expecting much when we hiked into the canyon, but what we saw at the bottom was amazing! You can stand right at the top of the lower falls and the view into the canyon is one of the coolest things we have ever seen. More than worth the hiking effort.

reviews.name: Karen S
reviews.title: Awesome view
reviews.comment: Great spot for pictures, the view was awesome and worth the stairs involved. Beautiful spot to visit.

reviews.name: ShirleyE601
reviews.title: We enjoyed this beautiful unforgettable sight.
reviews.comment: The grand canyon of yellowstone was a wonderful stop. We spent a couple hours admiring the views, taking pictures and came home with many great captured moments to remember.

reviews.name: Bubbs1965
reviews.title: Much bigger, grander and more stunning in real life
reviews.comment:
We walked from the canyon village to the rim which is actually a bit tricky because the path isn't signed. A helpful staff member pointed the route. (around a mile?) it does however avoid the problem of car parking on the rim side lookouts which can be very busy.
When you step out to see the canyon it is Oh so Yellow, and Oh so vast !
there are steps down in places for a better view if the waterfall. Not to be missed. On a cautious note the barrier is quite low in places.

reviews.name: Kathleen P
reviews.title: Beautiful Canyon
reviews.comment: Beautiful Canyon,with wonderful water fall. The different rocks making up this canyon, and their beautiful colors make this a must see spot in Yellowstone Park.

reviews.name: Leslie F
reviews.title: Impressive
reviews.comment: Beautiful, colorful and really big! Also very popular. Very cold the last few days si bring your serious cold weather gear. The snow is really magnificent.

reviews.name: Robin B
reviews.title: Don't miss this!
