reviews.comment: One of the best attractions in the park. Unlike some of the others you can get good photos even in poor weather. The falls are spectacular and the views are beautiful. The walk is very manageable.

reviews.name: GoingFarFarAway
reviews.title: Wow, fantastic views
reviews.comment: A must see if visiting Yellowstone NP. Amazing natural beauty. Plenty of picture taking opportunities.

reviews.name: raccoonink
reviews.title: Artist Point
reviews.comment:
There are some amazing views of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and some of the best are from Artist Point.
This was one of my favorite locations in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Jennifer D
reviews.title: Gorgeous Views
reviews.comment: It snowed the day we were there making the entire canyon beautiful as the snow came down and covered the canyon walls.

reviews.name: Todnick
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: We tried as many stops as we could along the canyon. There's a fairly short walk to the lower falls that is worth doing. Overall, breathtaking and worth the time.

reviews.name: ctank1of5
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: This was taken from Artist Point. We were unable to go on hike down to bottom of the falls because of icing of the train IN JUNE! We were not prepared for how chilly it was in June.

reviews.name: Perblat
reviews.title: Undescriptible
reviews.comment: A half hour trek among nature, trees, squirrels, birds and wind ... and at the very end the amazing waterfall. A fresh ... strong waterfall on the Yellowstone River, outlet of the Lake of the same name. The vertical yellow walls of the canyon are a sight in themselves. The color of the rocks give name to the Park

reviews.name: Diane P
reviews.title: Truly beautiful even on a cloudy day
reviews.comment:
The pictures don't do this canyon justice. Amazing views from many different overlooks and trails. Some are wheelchair accessible so everyone can see it. Trails and long stairways to lower vantage points for those who are more adventurous.
Definitely a don't miss!

reviews.name: Schrofer
reviews.title: Just a dream
reviews.comment: To visit the Yellowstone Park is just a dream. The nature and landscape is breath taking and you will see the wildlife and beautiful canyons. MUST SEE

reviews.name: cgm9
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment: We joined on to a Park Ranger-led tour that told us a lot about the ecology and flora of the area. We decided not to go to the bottom of the canyon (there is a way to go to the bottom on both the north and south sides). Both sides appear to be quite strenuous, even the one with stairs.

reviews.name: Mjldly
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment:
Absolutely beautiful! The waterfalls will take your breath away, and are all easy to reach from the road.
Awesome place!

reviews.name: Karen C
reviews.title: Out of this world!
reviews.comment: We did the walk down on uncle Tom's trail - not for the faint hearted and more physically challenging than we thought ! But the views are truly amazing.

reviews.name: Fraugdawg
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Beautiful falls and gorge showing many different shades of colors showing off the many minerals in the cliffs. Usually very busy with tour buses with folks from all over the world. Fun to people watch.

reviews.name: OurNCFamily
reviews.title: Busy - But a Must See
reviews.comment: Parking area really congested, but you have to see this. Every time I tried to get over where I could get an unobstructed view to take a picture, someone would push their way in front of me. Took awhile to get pictures. After that we had a nice long conversation with a park ranger and learned about some of the hiking trails nearby.

reviews.name: Kim449
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: This is so spectacular and breathtaking. The colors are amazing when the sun hits it just right and I was able to get some amazing photos. You can't believe how grand it is so be sure to view it from the north and south rim and make sure you stop at every vantage point!

reviews.name: CSItraveller
reviews.title: good view of the falls
reviews.comment: Access is very easy for a view of the falls. There are paths down to the water level for those willing to make the climb back afterwards. However it is a good point for sunrises - given a clear dawn.

reviews.name: Dawne C
reviews.title: Beautiful scenery, well worth the drive.
reviews.comment: As we were driving in Yellowstone Park to the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone we had a minor traffic jam. One single bison was just walking down the center of the road. I didn't mind the delay at all as everyone that passed him had to slow and of course take a picture. Very fun! And the spectacular view of the canyon itself with the waterfall and river was wonderful. If you are up to a steep hike back up the paths make sure you try it. I only went 1/3 of the way and huffed and puffed all the way back up.

reviews.name: DenverLisa
reviews.title: Impressive Sight in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This was our first trip to Yellowstone. There are so many awesome sites, it is hard to say which stop is number one. This might be it. In addition to Artists Point, check out the many waterfall overlooks. This is a must see!

reviews.name: FLGal321
reviews.title: A Must See!
reviews.comment:
This was my first trip to Yellowstone National Park and the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was a pleasant surprise and a must see from both the north and south side, completely different views.
Is it the "Grand Canyon" of the west, certainly not but it's breathtaking nonetheless and a must see if you travel to Yellowstone.

reviews.name: OziDiver
reviews.title: Must do in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is one of the must see sites when visiting. It is best viewed while staying at Canyon, as you must view both the North and South Rims. You can just walk out to the overlooks or go for a full on walk around the rims. Would recommend that you build in plenty of time here to take in all the sites and go for longer hikes to get all the views, There are plenty of parking spots, but most of the hiking is out and back, as there are no shuttles. The scenery is absolutely stunning, in anyone's language. The North rim is a one way road, back to Canyon Village. Do not overlook the Brink of the falls walks.

reviews.name: grzzz
reviews.title: Holy Cow!
reviews.comment:
Don’t miss this. It is one of the truly amazing parts of Yellowstone.
Hint1: There are many locations to view the canyon. Visit them all. They give completely different views. It is truly amazing.
Hint2: Don't worry about the crowds. There are many areas with easy access and fences that tend to be a bit crowded, but people move on and you will get to the front to see the views.
Hint3: To avoid the crowds, hit the paths. There are many uncrowded paths where you can walk right up to the edge of a cliff and look down without any fence or barrier. Everywhere you go and look, the views are unbelievable.
Hint4: Take a ton of pictures, but don’t expect them to replicate the beauty and depth of the canyon. Looking at the photos and videos I took, the videos do a much better job of capturing the depth, color and size of the area.

reviews.name: newarkdelawaregin
reviews.title: Beautiful and Majestic
reviews.comment: Enjoyed a ranger-led hike with our kids along the south rim of the canyon. The ranger was very interesting and informative; the group was not too big. Scenery was beautiful. We continued hiking along the south rim as far as Artists Point

reviews.name: stella k
reviews.title: Stunning scenery
reviews.comment: The canyon is particularly scenic and spectacular, but the whole park just 'takes your breath away'. It is worth the walk down to the waterfalls.

reviews.name: James S
reviews.title: Must see feature
reviews.comment: Make sure to travel both the south and north side roads for spectacular views. Tis does not require a lot of hiking as the viewpoints are very accessible with short walks.

reviews.name: Gwen_BE
reviews.title: Not the greatest canyon
reviews.comment: In a country with so much to see you become a bit critical. So no I don't think this was an amazing and must-see sight. Okay it's a pretty canyon and you should stop by when you're in Yellowstone since you're gonna drive past it anyway, but it's not the highlight of the park.

reviews.name: Jay E
reviews.title: A Must Stop in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: One of the best views in Yellowstone. A must stop. This isn't like the other stops where hot springs are the attraction.

reviews.name: WarwickshireMonty
reviews.title: Stunning scenery
reviews.comment: You simply have to take in the views of Yellowstone's Grand Canyon. The scenery is stunning. Highly recommended

reviews.name: txn
reviews.title: Don't miss this!
reviews.comment: This is a beautiful area of Yellowstone and is well worth visiting. The waterfall is stunning. I've been told that the best time to visit for photography is in the morning and sunset.

reviews.name: Dan S
reviews.title: One of the easiest great views to get to
reviews.comment: A short easy walk to an excellent view of the canyon. With it being so easy to access, there is no reason to miss.

reviews.name: Sarah C
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: So beautiful!! Our photos did not do it justice!! If you take small children keep a very close eye on them as there are no railings past the initial viewpoint and the walk is along cliff tops. I would highly recommend this.

reviews.name: Jenny E
reviews.title: Amazing views
reviews.comment: This is a must with amazing views and not a long walk. Beautiful colouring in the mountainside on the sides of the canyons. Really lovely views.

reviews.name: Austin W
reviews.title: Great views and lovely trek
reviews.comment: We parked at the upper parking area on the North Rim Drive and walked the trail (nice trek with a sheer drop towards the River below, pine trees and a squirrel too!) to the Lookout point and back. Great views of the Fall

reviews.name: TomGibb
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The greatest experience is Artists Point. Going to Yellowstone National Park is the greatest of National Park experiences. The best spot to observe the falls remains Artists Point. A very short walk and the greatest of views in the park. Just relax and recognize that you will have lots of folks that mostly travel in groups. Just wade through the crowds and take some pictures there.

reviews.name: Worked_the_World
reviews.title: Far more impressive than the hype
reviews.comment: Really worth the very short drive to see. Morning is best to get full sun on the north facing falls. Allow an hour to an hour and a help for the upper and lower falls.

reviews.name: Pamela J
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Beautiful unbelievable views! It is a must-see! Little Kids would make me nervous here if unattended.

reviews.name: RTG-travlin
reviews.title: Breath Taking
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is absolutely Breath Taking and you need to make sure that if you are visiting Yellowstone that you add it to your itinerary.

reviews.name: Gerry A
reviews.title: Great view
reviews.comment: This is one of the must sees on your tour around Yellowstone. The Great Loop Road gives the best views in my opinion.

reviews.name: PJ B
reviews.title: Add this to the must see list
reviews.comment: Don't miss this while traveling in Yellowstone. It was one of my favorites! Breathtaking views. Go up to Artist Point for fabulous views. Can't say enough about this place! AWESOME!!!

reviews.name: Geeena
reviews.title: a must visit attraction
reviews.comment: Make sure you stop at Artist Point on south rim - great views. This is a must see and if you are able the trails down to the falls looked really cool.

reviews.name: pepeingle
reviews.title: Picture postcard views
reviews.comment: Stunning views of the waterfall especially from the North Rim but all viewing areas offer interesting features.

reviews.name: SeDeGar
reviews.title: Wonderful
reviews.comment: When you come upon this canyon it is breathless. The hiking trails are well maintained and worth the trip. The history of how this canyon was formed is amazing. We are lucky to have national parks and forests.

reviews.name: JaneRoedel
reviews.title: Spectacular Views
reviews.comment: Take your time and enjoy the views. Don't spend all your time taking selfies, experience the moment and the spectacular scenery.

reviews.name: Farrah H
reviews.title: Absolute must-see!
reviews.comment: We spent the day in Yellowstone, but ended our journey at the Grand Canyon. The views are breathtaking! I encourage you to drive all the way around and stop at the different view points. The gradual climb up to the larger falls is worth it!

reviews.name: 61elc
reviews.title: Incredible to see!
reviews.comment: We were so amazed to see the canyon. So majestic and beautiful. It was incredible and a must see. Worth the trip

reviews.name: GEOCacher
reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.comment: The falls and the canyon are spectacular! I would recommend both the north and south rim drives. All overlooks are so wonderful.

reviews.name: Sandra G
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
reviews.comment: We were mesmerized by the views and the historical information on the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. There are well maintained pathways that bring you right up to the brink of the canyon. I even had a little trouble with vertigo. Excellent displays of magma deposits and striatum. Beautiful views of the river below.

reviews.name: Skytrekker
reviews.title: Don't miss!
reviews.comment: This is one of the highlights of the park. It is nowhere near the size of the real Grand Canyon, but it is still so beautiful and majestic. There is a north rim and a south rim. We went to the south rim. When you enter the road to view the canyon you are now on a one way loop road that takes you back to the Canyon Village area. Be sure to look for the stairway on the opposite side that goes half way down the rock face to a small platform. Only for the brave! Also look for the lower falls. Stunning!

reviews.name: Benny H
reviews.title: Yellowstone has it all,,,,
reviews.comment: Been here three times from SoCal. One time for myself and twice more as a family guide. I enjoyed Yellowstone more than Yosemite, Grand Canyon or even Rocky Mountain although they have less visitors. Might be due to it's location. Simply driving thru the "number 8" shape scenic loop gave me lot of fun. It's a huge park. All three times I visited, I entered the park at 8am and finished the complete loop at around 6 or 7pm depends on the traffic. I took almost all small roads where car can enter thru. I like this park because I don't have to walk too far too see things. So it's great place like myself who hates walking too much during the vacation (I take vacation to relax). Most of the viewing can be done from inside the car or by very short walk. Be forewarn that this park has lot of Park Ranger action compare to other parks. I never seen so many visitors get pulled over(assuming speeding) like in this park. They come out from nowhere like the highway patrols. If you're there for just one day, then do the counter-clock drive. It's a better side for viewing and entering view points. If you begin before 8am you should be able to view all the popular attractions and finish the "8" loop by 7pm. If you're lucky you'll catch Old Faithful eruption as well. At one visit I tried to complete full loop and reverse back loop in one day but couldn't unless I'm the only one in the park, and without speed limit. You will definitely see Bisons but I noticed huge number of them come out on the road just before sunset when most visitors are gone. And lastly, don't make a mistake of not visiting Grand Teton National Park right below the Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Renae B
reviews.title: Unbelievable
reviews.comment: When you pull up to the Canyon area and get out of your car expect your jaw to drop. Such a beautiful place. Probably my favorite area in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: John M
reviews.title: Grand Views! Majestic in Scope!!
reviews.comment: Our guide took us to one of the lookout points of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon. Absolutely majestic views of the falls, the river, the walls. Spectacular. Unbelievable photo-op.

reviews.name: Julia S
reviews.title: Sunrise on a cloudy day
reviews.comment: Lots of visitors frequent this amazing vista and take photos at Artists Point. I recommend going at sunrise on a cloudy day as the light is amazing and the steam from the falls is at a minimum.

reviews.name: dodi534
reviews.title: Breathtaking !!
reviews.comment: This is what I pictured when we decided to visit this park . It is absolutely amazing and humbling to see the power of nature . We walked down to the rim of the lower falls which is 3/8 of a mile with about 10 switchbacks on the trail . The walk down was strenuous for me because of physical limitations , but it was worth it . The view at the bottom is awesome . The walk up was harder on my lungs but easier on my body . Do this walk if you have the chance . The canyon is truly wonderful . There are several spots to see the falls, upper and lower , and to enjoy the beauty of this canyon . Loved it !

reviews.name: Lydier H
reviews.title: One word - spectacular
reviews.comment: Drove in through South Rim, the oneway path to witness this magnificent canyon view. I arrived at the sunset, the king cliff has already put on his golden cloak longing for a romantic struggle with his snake river soulmate.

reviews.name: StevenDustmaker
reviews.title: Remarkable Falls
reviews.comment: A great stop in the park. Short walks for most views (unless going to base of Lower Falls...ouch). Worth the effort

reviews.name: Dave-Laurie C
reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.comment: So beautiful and powerful to see the wonder of nature at work. Yellowstone has done a great job providing access to the many viewpoints on both sides of the canyon. I would recommend taking both loops to see the different views that include the waterfalls, the mighty Yellowstone river, the awesome colorful canyon and the almost hidden thermals at the bottom. This is a must see for all park visitors!

reviews.name: Ernie B
reviews.title: Always beautiful
reviews.comment: Lovely area to hike and take in the unique beauty of the falls. Discovered a backcountry hot spot on the south rim that we'd never seen before. Hike along the rim from artists point for .8 miles and turn right. Very interesting scenery from the pond back towards the parking area at Uncle Tom's

reviews.name: Jill W
reviews.title: Amazing views and worth going to all the viewpoints.
reviews.comment: There are many access points and trails available and it is worth visiting them all. The depth of the canyon itself is quite amazing as is the volume of water pouring over the upper falls. You can take a short walk down to the spot where there is an overlook above the main falls and look up to the viewpoints on the other side and vice versa.

reviews.name: Chris D
reviews.title: Amazing formation
reviews.comment: When in Yellowstone make to go and see the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Obviously not as large as the G.C. But truly a wonder of nature. Can be windy in that area, take lots of pictures

reviews.name: Troy M
reviews.title: Stunning Views
reviews.comment: The waterfall and surrounding areas are stunning. The landscape views are extraordinary. Lots of parking. Restrooms available. There are stairs to get to the upper viewing area. A very nice stop.

reviews.name: GenotheViking
reviews.title: Wow what a unique deep canyon.
reviews.comment: This place is beautiful and a must visit while in Yellowstone. The best place to see it may be from Artist Point but there are plenty of viewpoints on both sides. Spectacular colors.

reviews.name: Tina B
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: What a beautiful place! So many great place to take pictures and the stones are pure YELLOW How Yellowston got its name for sure. The colors are spectacular! Lots of walking but very much worth the views you will see!

reviews.name: travellerX49
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment:
There is a one way drive which gives good views over the canyon and the waterfall.
There are obviously some great hikes but those who are less able can still get a good view from the rim. Amazing, a must if you are visiting the park.

reviews.name: Yifei L
reviews.title: Majestic canyon with waterfalls and Yellowstone river
reviews.comment: Can't believe that here is a grand canyon in the deep of YSP. Seems that the land just lifts up impressively from the basin to the elevated hill, forming the canyon with Yellowstone river inside and the scenic views as well. It'a wonderful place to view the waterfall from the viewing deck on the top. BTW, Yellowstone River flows to the north and will merge to Madison river in Montana, then join Missouri River and Mississippi River in Missouri. So considered by the length, Yellowstone or Madison River is one of the fountainheads of Mississippi River.

reviews.name: Ross B
reviews.title: Unexpected suprise
reviews.comment: The views are the best in Yellowstone Park, one way you into the canyon is a superb waterfall, whilst in the other direction is craggy and colourful.

reviews.name: David M
reviews.title: Beautiful place
reviews.comment: We got here the day after a light snowfall and it was stunningly beautiful. There are several places to park and take photos. Artist point was the best but don't skip the other places. I suggest avoiding summer school vacation times to avoid crowding.

reviews.name: barb g
reviews.title: Just beautiful
reviews.comment: Had not been here in years. Enjoyed the hiking and views. Knowing where to see the best views is key. Ask the staff

reviews.name: Michael B
reviews.title: Steep Cliffside!
reviews.comment:
Easy walk from the parking lot. Not difficult to see at all. The overlooks have railings, but if you're afraid of heights beware. The edge of the overlook is a complete vertical drop off.
My wife and I thought the view resembled a painting, with awesome views of the river.

reviews.name: Karen R
reviews.title: Artist point was the best place to view
reviews.comment: I was surprised that Yellowstone river has this beautiful teal green color. Artist point was the best place to view. Summer is a busy time to visit. Go early morning or evening to have less visitors sharing the space with you

reviews.name: Cranky_Traveler
reviews.title: I could not believe anything the beautiful existed in the USA - amazing
reviews.comment: This place took my breath away. Go to Artists' Point. You won't be disappointed. If you go nowhere else in Yellowstone, go here!

reviews.name: OChalofn
reviews.title: Awe inspiring
reviews.comment: Nature at its finest.... Could sit and stare at the waterfalls and beautiful canyons for hours...no wonder it is a favorite location for artists. This is a heavily visited site but you don't feel cramped after you get away from the parking area.... Not to be missed when visiting the park.

reviews.name: Bess W
reviews.title: LOVE THE SOUND OF RUSHING WATER
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was our last stop on the CIRCLE OF FIRE TOUR of the lower loop. It was beautiful and a little bit of a walk after a full day on and off the YELLOWSTONE tour bus.

reviews.name: bonannoguy
reviews.title: Worth the stop
reviews.comment: Beautiful falls and surrounding vistas. Short walk off the pullout so it it accessible to everyone. Impressive to say the least.

reviews.name: Kathie1953
reviews.title: Uncle toms trail
reviews.comment: I walked the upper trail, it offers fabulous views of the falls and a peaceful, deep forest experience. Stopped and watched a squirrel chewing an acorn like a drill bit :). It is not too challenging for a non hiker.

reviews.name: Makai
reviews.title: Too Expensive for the View
reviews.comment: Save your money and go to Iceland. It is much cheaper and much more beautiful. Yellowstone in a tourist trap - about $700 per day including overpriced motels, food, and entrance fees. If you are a geologist then it would be worth the money because there are a lot of interesting volcanic events happening. Also go in September to avoid the crowds and long lines.

reviews.name: Lynnpatricia
reviews.title: Get the GyPSy App!!
reviews.comment:
We downloaded this app for under 5 dollars and it was fabulous. We had our own knowledgeable tour guide right in our car with us. Do yourself a favour and check it out online. We are in Teton now and GyPSy is expertly guiding us again.
Yellowstone - Overall, scenery stunning, lots of buffalo & elk (very few 'visible' bears) but HUNDREDS of cars and people.
This is not a wilderness - it's a huge safari park but still enjoyable.
Grand Canyon a must!

reviews.name: Ethan Morris
reviews.title: Simply Beautiful
reviews.comment:
Very pretty, a must-do in Yellowstone National Park, along with exploring Hayden and Lamar Valleys and hiking.
This can be very busy-try to do at times when there are less visitors

reviews.name: OklahomaLizzy
reviews.title: amazing views
reviews.comment: It had snowed the day we arrived so it was an added bonus to see this place with and without snow. It is the prettiest place in Yellowstone, not to be missed

reviews.name: Elli D
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The rimtrails are really worth a walk, the stone is so colourful no matter at what point you are standing.

reviews.name: Charles_Schuchert
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: Absolutely spectacular vistas of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Have visited here four times over 35 years and still spectacular. Great access and parking. Easy in and out for a drive by. Multiple views.

reviews.name: vacation22
reviews.title: Hike the North and South Rims
reviews.comment: The observation points are nice but the rim hiking is flat and you get away front the crowds. Evening is nice too. Short drive from Canyon Lodge

reviews.name: Yori O
reviews.title: Loved It!
reviews.comment: Wasn't sure until I saw it. It is not on the size of The Grand Canyon but I would recommend visiting this place. It is small yet magnificent. The viewing area could become crowded so avoid when the big busses roll around. In a certain way, I liked it more than the Grand Canyon.

reviews.name: Tracey B
reviews.title: Awesome views
reviews.comment: Simply amazing photo ops from the viewing park area, very busy even in September but do stop as it's worth it

reviews.name: CrewFever
reviews.title: Amazing views and colors
reviews.comment: We hiked along the canyon seeing the upper and lower falls in addition to the canyon itself with it's geologic colors. Frankly, we hadn't anticipated the canyon being as grand and majestic as it was. A pleasant surprise and compliment to the other natural wonders of the park

reviews.name: Ken B
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: Whether known by this name, or as Artist Point, or as Upper Falls, this is an iconic and must-see location. Be prepared to take the short walk from the parking lot (ramps are available as alternatives to stairs), and spend at least an hour there just drinking in the breathtaking scenery.

reviews.name: macska
reviews.title: A must do stop in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: There are three different pullouts that you can easily do to see the brink of the falls, the upper falls, and by the Canyon lodge area the north rim. You will see rocks formations and colors that we saw no where else in the park. Paths are short and easy. Uncle Toms Trail, the 300+ steps that you can take to see the falls closer was closed, but we weren't going to do those anyway. While you are here the Canyon Lodge gift shop had a nice selection and a clearance rack. I got made in the usa tshirts fot $6.99. My kind of shopping.

reviews.name: David A
reviews.title: impressive views of the falls. VERY crowded in summer
reviews.comment:
The great loop road just south of Canyon village takes you past several good view points of both the upper and lower falls of the Yellowstone river. The upper falls viewpoint is distant, but a level hike of approximately 1 mile takes you to a much more interesting viewpoint.
A hike with a drop of 600 feet takes you to the top of the lower falls from this viewpoint, where you can stand on the lip of the lower falls,
The lower falls are by far the more impressive, being the iconic picture of the Yellowstone river.
The lower falls viewpoint gives an excellent view of the lower falls with minimal walking.
The great loop road tends to be extremely congested and parking can be a hassle, but the views are worth the effort.

reviews.name: Doggieinwindow
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: This was a beautiful photo stop. The waterfall empties into the canyon below, and the rock formations are amazing.

reviews.name: AusBet
reviews.title: WOW
reviews.comment: A wonderful view of the Lower Yellowstone Falls & this is where you can see why it is called YELLOWstone NP

reviews.name: LostALot22
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: I loved the canyon. Due to erosion you can see different layers on the other side. And you can see breath taking views up and down the canyon with its yellowish walls. Very nice.

reviews.name: malleegirl
reviews.title: Beautiful area
reviews.comment: This is certainly worth a visit while in Yellowstone. We have some great photos of the waterfall and also the colourful rock on the other side. Just a short walk.

reviews.name: ralph r
reviews.title: Grand views but not quite the Grand Canyon in Arizona
reviews.comment: Breathtaking and accessible thanks to the Parks peopl'e. Every stop on the road is little or no hiking to a great viewpoint. Off the main road you can choose to take the South loop of North loop. If you only take one take the South loop as it takes in Uncle Tom's Trail and Artist Point. Note the North loop becomes a one way loop that heads into the Canyon Lodge area which is convenient if you are staying there. Do not violate the rules of staying on the trails or viewing viewing area fencing. It is enticing but people have died in these areas that are very safe. Go early to get better vibes and easier picture taking as when the tour buses arrive it sort of disturbs the pleasure a bit. Note that Uncle Tom's trail can scare people because of the alerts of the 358 or so steps can be exhausting, it is not as bad as it sounds, so go ahead it is worth it, just take your time.

reviews.name: karendory1
reviews.title: Breath-taking
reviews.comment: Breath-taking view your eyes cannot believe what you are seeing, very photographic, short walk mostly level take your time some pull-outs fill up parking might be limited if you have a big rv,restrooms limited some attractions have them see map

reviews.name: Joyce H
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring
reviews.comment: Nothing can outdo nature! The falls are absolutely beautiful. It is well worth stopping at this point of interest in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Dennie E
reviews.title: Always breathtaking
reviews.comment: This is such a beautiful canyon and the falls are always magnificent. It's always been a great photo opportunity. The colors here are awesome and the atmosphere is inspiring.

reviews.name: genmasjoy
reviews.title: Beautiful viewing spot
reviews.comment: While not comparable to the Grand Canyon in Arizona, the Canyon in Yellowstone was a scenic viewpoint which we enjoyed

reviews.name: avoi014
reviews.title: Loved it! Met my expectations.
reviews.comment: We went mi-morning around 10/11am and we were able to find a parking spot without much trouble, surprisingly. We started with Uncle Tom's trail which had 300+ stairs, but was worth it. We were able to get good views of the falls and we saw the rainbow while we were there. We also walked the south rim trail, but if you're short on time, I would just drive to Uncle Tom's Trail and then drive to inspiration point. On the south rim trail you only get the same view at different distances, basically.

reviews.name: Chris S
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Didn't realize the beauty of this place until I saw the real Grand Canyon. The combination of the water, the size of the mountain, trees and a blue sky is truly spectacular

reviews.name: Lodestar-Crusader
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: This area is one among several in Yellowstone that merit some attention and certainly offers great photo opportunities.

reviews.name: Janet P
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: We hiked the trails on the South Rim. Best views on this side. The climb down to the base of the falls is 328 steps from Uncle Toms trail and not for the faint hearted but is amazing. We walked about halway to Artists point which was a really enjoyable hike butcrealised the kids (7 and 5) woukdnt make it there and back so returned to the car and drove there. Tge views there are beautiful. This was our favourite part of Yellowstone.

reviews.name: PHulgin
reviews.title: One of the best highlights of the park, a must see
reviews.comment: If you only see one thing in Yellowstone while you are there, make sure this is it. It is a spectacular setting, very remote, and extremely pristine. The wildlife viewing was great and it was a good place to hike.

reviews.name: CayohuesoJoe
reviews.title: Hike the .8 mile down! the vibration on the deck next to the falls makes you feel small
reviews.comment: the zig-zag hike down is easy and the view just keeps getting better and better until you get to the lip of the thundering falls. Then it's incredible! The hike back up will wear you out (altitude mainly) but is so worth it.

reviews.name: Bill P
reviews.title: One of the prietiest places in the Park
reviews.comment: We toured both the North and South rim's of the canyon. Different views of the Falls - both beautiful. More active folks hiked to the falls - we just took too many pictures! We also saw an Osprey nest on top of a rock pinnacle with babies still in it and Mom coming to feed the, Fantastic sight. Be sure and bring the best pair of binoculars you can find.

reviews.name: bckpkr1979
reviews.title: *** Accessible View of the Falls - Artist Point ***
reviews.comment:
Loved this trip which is so close to Canyon Campground in Yellowstone! It'd be a crime to not stop here. If you are coming to see to the falls, traveling around noon or early afternoon DOES make for good pictures!
Also, when you first pull into the lot for Artist Point, it is tempting to take the first parking spot you see, but in reality, the attraction is at the very back of the parking lot. It is accessible and me and my kneerover were able to easily see and photograph what I came for! Fantastic!

reviews.name: klebrecht
reviews.title: Majestic
reviews.comment: There are several viewpoints of this magnificent Canyon. Be sure to enjoy each and every one of them.

reviews.name: Kishor K
reviews.title: Mesmerizing views
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone has 2 falls, Upper and Lower. We visited only Lower falls area. There is a small trail that leads to the head of lower falls. You get to see the complete valley and the canyon. I would not recommend this trail with stroller kids or picked up kids as it is a steep uphill trail while walking back. I was speechless after being there and I'm sure anyone would be too, Mesmerizing!!!

reviews.name: Rcbrook
reviews.title: Time it right to see the Rainbow
reviews.comment: From late May to early September, a rainbow appears on the Lower Falls of the Yellowstone river. For me, it was at 9:40 AM MDT. It is a truly beautiful experience and worth planning for your trip.

reviews.name: Karen M
reviews.title: Don't miss
reviews.comment: This area is overwhelming. I call it a sensory overload. If you travel to Yellowstone you must see he canyon

reviews.name: Cherriepa
reviews.title: Spectacular landscapes!
reviews.comment: This was included in our vacation, and we enjoyed it immensely! It was spectacular views from the car and on foot it was breathtaking. So much wildlife to see and just one great scene after another. We can't wait to go back to Yellowstone

reviews.name: Narren2014
reviews.title: A must see. Artist point was just gorgeous.
reviews.comment:
You must go and see this place and witness sheer beauty.
Do not miss Uncle Toms trail, its worth doing.

reviews.name: Noel C
reviews.title: Wonderful day hike
reviews.comment: Hike the entire loop for wonderful views of the rivers and falls. We've encountered bison along this hike once or twice, but mainly just wonderful views away from the bulk of the summer crowds. The hike is easy/moderate. We usually bring a picnic lunch to have part way through and finish with ice cream in Canyon Village.

reviews.name: lancelassiter
reviews.title: Amazing place, perhaps best of Yellowstone.
reviews.comment: South rim views were amazing! Uncle Tom's trail is challenging but worth it, not for the out of shape tourist. Go early to miss the crowds. This was only second to Old Faithful for crowds. Would do the whole rim on both sides if time/family allowed. Consider going north and hiking up to Mount Washburn the same day - also a great excursion.

reviews.name: must_need_H2O
reviews.title: This really is worth the stopping and doing the hiking
reviews.comment:
An amazing canyon with a wonderful waterfall and the colors of the walls and how the river has carved out this canyon are worth every minute driving to this place. The parking isn't as bad here as other places, but because of the tour buses stopping here, the crowds will be bigger. That isn't bad though it will be a multicultural event with everyone asking to have their picture taken with the waterfall and river back ground in all kinds of different languages. Mostly lots of pointing and hand waving trying to communicate with each other. We really had a great time in the crowds and after they dispersed we did some of the hikes and enjoyed getting up and close to some of the water features down in the canyon it self. All we spent more time here than any place else at YNP.
The Good: wonderful views of the canyon with an impressive water fall flowing into a striking blue river.
The Bad: Should have spent more time here than other places in the park
The ugly: Parking can be "interesting" in peak crowds
On the scuba bubble scale of 1 to 10, I give this canyon 8 bubbles

reviews.name: Lourdes H
reviews.title: Hike
reviews.comment:
Great hiking on the south rim, do the Uncle Tom's Cabin trail!
Did rent the bear spray, better to be safe then sorry.

reviews.name: todski85
reviews.title: A must see
reviews.comment: This part of the park is not to be missed, everything here is so great. Take your time and get this in your visit

reviews.name: EnohKcir
reviews.title: Great views - worth the hike and the crowds
reviews.comment:
The steep canyon walls are colored by the geothermal activity and the rushing blue water makes for a spectacular view. Decided to back-track to after heading down to Old Faithful in the morning and we are glad we did. Was well worth the additional time it took.
Watch the signs and be aware that the best views of the "brink" of the falls are from the first parking lot you pull in to. We had to circle around the loop twice because we missed the signs that are immediately on the right as you pull in to the upper lot. Once you arrive in the lot there are a lot of overlooks and trails that offer various angles of the canyon and falls. A thorough visit can be accomplished in 1.5 - 2 hours.
Take good shoes and a good camera!

reviews.name: Charles_and_Susan
reviews.title: Don't miss it, it's just amazing.
reviews.comment: We enjoyed the animals and thermal features in Yellowstone and thought we'd have a look at this on the way round. It was a wow moment. We'll worth visiting, I'd you're short on time take the south ride and go to Uncle Tom's Trail for stunning views.

reviews.name: Joe A
reviews.title: Wonderful views
reviews.comment: There are several great viewing areas for the canyon and falls the best being one one the north rim which brings you right on top of the falls.

reviews.name: Sarah N
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing
reviews.comment: Amazing!!! Get there in the early morning for that rainbow effect at the bottom of the Lower Falls. If you can do the Uncle Tom's trail to the bottom.

reviews.name: peter h
reviews.title: Spellbinding
reviews.comment: Dont miss this wonderful area when you are in Yellowstone. The views are breathtaking as a result of not only the depth of the canyon but the kaleidoscopic colours on the canyon faces. Although the falls are a long way from most of the viewpoints, you can sense their power and energy. A great example of the creative power and beauty of nature.

reviews.name: champoux
reviews.title: Beautiful views even when the falls are not gushing with water
reviews.comment: Had a quick stop here on our drive around the park. Easy to park, not far to walk. There are a few trails as well

reviews.name: family0f3kids
reviews.title: beautiful
reviews.comment: Easy to drive and see the sites. Does not take too long and the sites are worth too see. Go see the mud volcano and then stop here on the way back if staying at the Canyon Lodge.

reviews.name: Naga64
reviews.title: Worth dropping by
reviews.comment: The canyon is not quite the Grand Canyon but it is more accessible and there are good paths that give you a good overview of the canyon including the waterfalls. We went in the late afternoon when the light made the canyon more beautiful.

reviews.name: Cherstevens
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: We visited this area twice while we were in the park. Once on a photo safari and once to take in another opportunity to view this spectacular sight. Truly remarkable!!

reviews.name: lrjohnston
reviews.title: Beautiful must see in yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is a top 2-3 of the sites to see in Yellowstone. "Artists point" off the best views and a nearby south rim trail offers a moderate difficulty hike to see some additional amazing views. Uncle toms trail is a tough 329 step hike down to the bottom. It's a pretty strenuous climb but well worth it and there is no reason that you have to go fast so we'd recommend it to anyone without a health reason to not make the climb (my wife and I made the hike with our 1 and 3 yr olds on our backs).

reviews.name: armenmenech
reviews.title: Amazing yellowstone
reviews.comment: What an incredible display of nature. Yelowstone is just beautiful, it has canyons, geyser's and incredible waterfalls. Definately stop by here to admire the views of the falls, and animals and nature displayed beautifully everywhere, this is a must see.

reviews.name: oceangirl117
reviews.title: Spectacular Hike!!
reviews.comment: This was a fabulous hike! We hiked the North and the South Rim and both of the hikes offered stunning views of the Canyon and the Upper and Lower Falls. Neither hike was too difficult. In my opinion, this is the most beautiful hiking area in the park. Take your time and enjoy the view - well worth the effort!!!!

reviews.name: Scotlandtravels
reviews.title: Pick and Choose
reviews.comment:
This was our second trip to Yellowstone so we skipped Old Faithful. We came in the north entrance (wonderful stone arch dedicated to Teddy Roosevelt) after staying overnight in Bozeman. BTW, if you are over 65, buy a Senior pass: free admittance to all national parks. You get your $10 back in one visit.
. We wanted to see the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone so we turned east at Mammoth Springs (what wonderful old buildings!). We picked the lower falls - the views are all along the rim. To see the best view of the falls, try the wooden walkway down into the canyon. It is a spectacular canyon! Then we drove over to Norton Basin (stopping for a picnic at the Virginia Cascades - picnic tables at the end of the loop). The Basin has a nice museum and several walks through the geysers. Fascinating!
To leave the park through the east entrance, you drive by the immense Lake Yellowstone. It's a long way to Cody (30 minutes to the East entrance, 50 more to Cody) but the canyon on the way is beautiful.
We came back into the park the next day and left by the south entrance, right into the Tejons NP. Be sure to keep your entry receipt or have that Senior pass ready.
FYI. Gas is available all over the park. Take a picnic so you can skip the Grills and restaurants that are filled by buses. Picnic tables everywhere and in beautiful areas.

reviews.name: 4our_trips
reviews.title: One of our Best National Park tours
reviews.comment: Our visit was actually 5 years ago, & I hadn't finished it on-line. It was a September visit and we drove a rental care through the Park on the Loop. (Our visit was actually 5 years ago, & I hadn't finished it on-line...) We saw bison, elk and beautiful water throughout the day-trip.

reviews.name: elliescr
reviews.title: Very pretty
reviews.comment: Definitely stop to take in the view and get some pictures. Falls are big and pretty. There was an osprey nest on one side of the falls, atop some rock formations. Make sure you bring your binoculars!

reviews.name: StacyAnn7
reviews.title: Easy Hike, Great View
reviews.comment: As long as you're not in a rush, the hike is fairly easy. There are many amazing views along all of the different trails at the canyon. Bring water!

reviews.name: cheribree2016
reviews.title: Nice hike to viewpoints
reviews.comment: Beautiful views, but way too many people. Steep hike back to car. Don't even try to push a stroller.

reviews.name: dmcfarland43
reviews.title: spectaculor views
reviews.comment: Loved the waterfalls, and the breath taking views from the different look out points! Stop at a visitors station within Yellowstone and have a ranger give you a detailed map to follow!!

reviews.name: oldhickory5
reviews.title: Wall paper worthy!
reviews.comment: Iconic location. Drop dead gorgeous! ...I don't need a hundred characters to review this. Just read everyone else's reviews. You'll get the picture.

reviews.name: Paresh P
reviews.title: definetely worth the visit
reviews.comment: If you're in YNP, be sure to visit this place. It's not Grand Canyon... canyon, but most definitely a nice place to visit here in the YNP. I wish they had trail that lead down to base of the waterfall...

reviews.name: Matt S
reviews.title: What a fantastic view
reviews.comment: Must stop during a trip to Yellowstone. What a great view. I recommend taking the Uncle Tom's trail down to the bottom to see the lower falls. It's well worth it

reviews.name: Shelly F
reviews.title: What a fantastic view
reviews.comment: If you've been to the Grand Canyon, you won't be disappointed with the views and beauty of the grand canyon of Yellowstone. Take the walk down uncle Tom's trail to see the lower falls. It's a bit of a hike, but definitely worth it.

reviews.name: Steven C
reviews.title: Evening Stroll along the South Rim
reviews.comment: Definitely worth a quick hike and evening stroll after dinner. The waterfall is intense from the ledge right above it. The view back further from Grand View and Lookout seemed the best. Enjoy the wonder.

reviews.name: TP1234
reviews.title: Best of Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
Located in the center of Yellowstone, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is, in my opinion, the best attraction in the park. It is a short drive south of the Canyon Village & Visitor Center. We went to both the north and south rims - to get a different view of the canyon and the falls. The "Lookout Point" on the north rim gives you a closer look at the lower fall. The "Artist Point" on the south rim give you a more complete impression of the canyon; it is one of the most popular spots to take pictures. I highly recommend visiting both rims but keep in mind that the north rim road is a one-way road and you will end up going back to the Canyon Village.
You can also take one of the trails to go down to the bottom of the lower fall but there are a lot of stairs to climb; it is not recommended if you don't have much time.

reviews.name: jackm0use
reviews.title: Breathtaking views
reviews.comment: This is an amazing stop in the park, you can drive or hike to the overlooks and see the canyon and beautiful waterfalls. The overlooks have a low boulder wall/barrier that seems a little unsafe if you get too close to the edge. Someone fell to their death just about a week or so before we were there.

reviews.name: Izaxi
reviews.title: One of the best sight of Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
This is probably one of the best sites in Yellowstone National Park.
What is upsetting is that you can easily miss this place due to the poor Signage on the park roads, this is about a mile or two south of Canyon and it is on a side Road to the east of the main Road, so people can easily miss the turn that say Artist Point, how silly is that? So we where lucky and we did stop by and the view is just magnificent with the colors of the Canyon and the river under. This was truly breath taking!

reviews.name: Jhurd6
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
reviews.comment: If you are at Yellowstone, you must make a stop here. It is so beautiful and there are several hikes around the falls. Parking fills up fast. This is one of the highlights of my visit.

reviews.name: aliuska13
reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.comment: To me is one of the most beautiful views in Yellowstone Park you should go early in the morning since it's less people and you can take really nice pictures

reviews.name: Cheri W
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: It is a definite must stop at when your in the park. There is a long walk down to the lower falls on a broken trail (has guardrails/hand rails) but worth the trek with picture opportunities & the occasional chipmunk. The trek up is a little more difficult but they have benches at every turn which are a welcome site.

reviews.name: PeanutPopcorn1
reviews.title: Breath-taking
reviews.comment: Beautiful scenery, see the upper falls before the lower falls, because the lower falls overlook offers spectacular views in all directions. A lovely part of YNP and definitely worth the drive. Great wildlife viewing along the drive. Look for osprey nests once you arrive.

reviews.name: cagatravel
reviews.title: Amazing scenery and falls
reviews.comment: This is a must visit in Yellowstone NP. The Grand canyon has spectacular rock cliff formations with an amazing powerful waterfall. No matter what side of the canyon you see this place it is amazing with lots of viewing areas which you can walk or drive too. There are limited parking at some viewing areas so patience or walking will be the solution.

reviews.name: LandSMom
reviews.title: Beautiful waterfalls and colors!
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is definitely worth seeing. The waterfalls are beautiful, and the colors of the canyon are striking. The walk down to the brink of the lower falls is fairly steep and may be a hard climb back up if you are not in good shape. Definitely go to Artist Point.

reviews.name: LeslieinTN
reviews.title: Break From the Thermal Attractions
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is twenty miles long. The canyon is up to 4,000-feet wide and 1,200-feet deep in places. From several vantage points, you can view Lower Falls plunging steeply into the canyon 308 feet, or the Upper Falls tumbling 109 feet. The various yellow, red, pink, and white mineral stains mark the locations of hot springs and steam vents in the canyon walls. "Most of the yellows in the canyon are the result of iron present in the rock rather than sulfur, as many people think."
We enjoyed the beauty of this easy stop, however, we did not enjoy the large crowds. Many recommend going early if you can but if you are driving the loop and not staying in the park then that is hard. The beauty is worth the hassle of fellow tourists. ;) It was quite an unexpected sight in YNP compared to all the thermal attractions.

reviews.name: mesharks
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: This is a site you could sit and look at all day and never get tired of. We went to the upper and lower and still love looking at the canyon the best. A site I will never forget.

reviews.name: mrs.travelpro
reviews.title: Beautiful...a Must See In Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Breathtaking....is all I can say ...do not miss. Picturesque..one of my favorite spots. Entire family loved the view. Was able to get some great pictures

reviews.name: JLP1000
reviews.title: Great and educational
reviews.comment:
I recommend getting there early. We arrived at 8:30 am and the crowds hadn't arrived and we had a pleasant visit. Old faithful erupted on the scheduled time on the info board. While waiting, a volunteer with a radio told us of another guider that was bigger and longer lasting was almost ready so we saw it first then after a short time watched Old faithful.
Don't miss this
Ps we actually got some cell service there

reviews.name: Dinah B
reviews.title: Breathtaking Section of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This is the second year in a row we visited Yellowstone and the Canyon area is one of my favorites. We spent about three hours visiting the different points to view the Upper and Lower Falls. We did not take Uncle Tom's Trail, but stopped at the Brink of the Upper and Lower Falls, Artists Point, and a couple more places along the North Rim Drive. The different views of the falls are spectacular. We especially enjoyed Artists Point and the Brink of the Upper Falls....you are standing directly over the falls and the noise of the rushing water is awesome. My husband in unable to walk long distances or inclines and he was able to walk to both brinks as well as Artists Point without any difficulty.

reviews.name: LlanoJean
reviews.title: Beautiful area of the park
reviews.comment: We parked at Wapiti Lake trailhead and walked the trail along the South Rim up to Artist Point and then back down to the Wapiti parking area via Lily Pad Lake and Clear Lake (this takes you through some geyser areas that make you feel like you are on another planet, but also through some beautiful valley/hill views). I was nervous for families with young children that did not seem to understand the perils of falling into the canyon if they did not keep their children close at hand! An absolute must-see area of the park!

reviews.name: Steph
reviews.title: Nature at its best
reviews.comment: This was my favorite part of Yellowstone. It's absolutely stunning. The colors are spectacular. There are numerous lookouts to stop at and take in the views. Most are a short walk. We didn't do any hiking to the lower lookout points since we were with a child and it started raining really heavy.

reviews.name: laneg5
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Gorgeous view of the upper and lower falls. Saw an eagle on the nest on rock formation below the overlook.

reviews.name: ThatchersBiscuit
reviews.title: gorgeous
reviews.comment: The grand canyon of Yellowstone can be viewed from a number of vantage points and it is definitely worth going to them all. It is just as gorgeous as Arizona's, but it a bit more accessible and the colors and calls are completely breathtaking.

reviews.name: StephLowes
reviews.title: Absolutely Breathtaking!!!!
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is beautiful---a must see!!! The upper & lower falls are stunning as well.

reviews.name: ZeemyCee
reviews.title: Spectacular Spectacular
reviews.comment: Visited the falls with a group of about 30 people including youth and stopped for photos - a very popular spot for photographers and visitors

reviews.name: LondonLee
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is truly amazing. We had incredible weather last week on our trip which probably made it even more spectacular. We even got to see a rainbow across the falls. You cannot go wrong anywhere in Yellowstone Park as there is so much to see. Enjoy!

reviews.name: David M
reviews.title: Eagle Eye View Of Majesty
reviews.comment: Each scenic overlook of the Grand Canyon Loop offers unique vantage points to admire but the second offered an added, unexpected treat...a view of a huge eagle nest (complete with eaglets) atop a towering rock formation within the canyon. The amazing emerald streaked water and majestic wildlife of the Canyon Loop made it a family favorite and a treasured memory of everything that is special about Yellowstone. Make sure you go to upper observation area even though eagle nest is visible from lower area.

reviews.name: Michael Q
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: This vista was the best sight for us at Yellowstone . We hiked to the lower falls , the path is steep and half way down turns into grated metal steps. There are benches to sit / rest if needed and the steps are wide enough to accommodate foot traffic coming and going in either direction. Once at the bottom there is a nice landing and an awesome view of the lower falls. The upper falls trail is very easy to access and also provides excellent views. A short distance from this access point is a stop called artist point, make sure to see this , all of Yellowstone is breathtaking , it allows you to see the lower falls as it cascades into the steep canyon below . This is a must see.

reviews.name: Vivian L. H
reviews.title: Awe Inspiring
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone lives up to its name! The walls are steep, steep. It takes about 350 steps downward on metal steps, and then you have to climb back up. The reward is the beautiful Upper and Lower Falls. This is a must see!!

reviews.name: pollyrascal
reviews.title: DO NOT MISS THIS
reviews.comment: Absolutely spectacular! The colors, rock formations, waterfalls, displayed beautifully by it's creator, our Heavenly Father over MILLIONS of years. Don't miss this! The National Parks Service has done a fabulous job of creating many vantage points for viewing these wonders!

reviews.name: Trixie1953
reviews.title: Awesome Sight
reviews.comment: Even though it was pouring rain when we visited, it is a awesome sight to behold. Magnificent color in the rock that Mother Nature just painted. A beautiful waterfall streaming down, even with thunder and lightning we were able to take great photos. It certainly is a "Grand" Canyon.

reviews.name: Trace7000
reviews.title: Gorgeous sight, great hiking and views
reviews.comment: This was another beautiful hidden gem of Yellowstone. We parked and hiked and were able to get beautiful views of the waterfall and canyon.

reviews.name: April B
reviews.title: Awesome View
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon was so high and so wide open that it actually made me apprehensive to go towards the edges. It was a breathtaking view! Definately worth stopping for.

reviews.name: LaVetta S
reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: This place was awe inspired, beautiful.....what can I say? There was some hiking to get to some of the views, but well worth it. The falls was superb, really great.

reviews.name: LEB1952
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: Quite an impressive view. The canyon is just off the loop road which allows pull over parking for the short walk. Like many other sights here are worth seeing.

reviews.name: Lynn H
reviews.title: Awesome area. So beautiful
reviews.comment: Elk wandering in the parking lot made this visit even more special. Also saw a bald eagle nest on one of the rock formations.

reviews.name: Don S
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The waterfalls here are so amazing. I highly recommend going here. It's magnificent and the view and everything is so breathtaking.

reviews.name: petsitter
reviews.title: Our Favorite Part of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: We toured here our third day in the park. I guess I enjoy seeing beautiful scenery. The geysers and fumeroles are interesting but I had had enough. When I got here I was absolutely awed. The colors are amazing and beautiful waterfalls. This I would come back for and consider it a must see when in the Park.

reviews.name: TravelMom2020
reviews.title: Gorgeous View
reviews.comment: Worth the drive. See upper and lower falls. Be careful near edge as a worker in the campground fell to her death last week!

reviews.name: Istop4pics
reviews.title: Prepare for many picture stops
reviews.comment: Gorgeous geology showing colors and deep steep areas along with sturdy trees. We stopped every chance we could to get pics. We went earlier in the morning and it wasn't very crowded until we got to Artist's Point. I wish we could have taken Uncle Tom's Trail as I heard it was worth the steep delcine. The waterfalls were flowing strong even in the heat of the end of summer. This is an excellent drive with many oohs and ahhs.

reviews.name: fiddlestogo
reviews.title: just spectacular
reviews.comment: We visited every view point on the south rim, and some of the north rim. Each view was different and completely worth it. We also went in late afternoon to avoid the crowds. But, the place is large and crowds wouldn't interfere with the views. A person can easily walk to all the view points and do a larger hike if they want. This is one of the must see sights in Yellowstone!

reviews.name: Betty
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery
reviews.comment: This place is amazing! There are different places to see it. Go to Artist's Point for the most scenic view. Here you see the waterfall and the different colors of the canyon.

reviews.name: publicguy999
reviews.title: A Highlight Of Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
This is by far one of the highlights of Yellowstone- it's also one of the most picturesque. Depending on where you come in from (either Grand Loop from the south or north, or Norris Canyon Rd. from the west) you will hit either North Rim or South Rim drives first.
The South Rim Drive will take you to Uncle Tom's trail, a short and easily accessible trail that follows along the canyon and to Artist's Point, which is easily one of my favorite sights.
North Rim Drive is a loop from Canyon Village south to Grand Loop Rd near the South Rim Drive and has view access of its own to the brink of both falls and to Inspiration Point (which sadly was closed when we drove through).
Overall it was a great experience (although not very child-friendly) in Yellowstone!

reviews.name: Jacob R
reviews.title: Nice quick hikes
reviews.comment: The grand Canyon of Yellowstone has many great views and hikes. Make sure you come here when you visit.

reviews.name: Victor C
reviews.title: Just beautiful
reviews.comment: This is one of my favorite spots inside the park. Very beautiful scenery. Sadly, the place was so overwhelmed with tourists, some quite unruly. Really ruined the supposedly calm and peaceful atmosphere. I want to go back again, may be in spring or fall to really appreciate it.

reviews.name: Jimcudo
reviews.title: Super cool
reviews.comment: This is an incredible marvel of nature with stunning views offered from many different locations. If you go to Yellowstone you MUST see it.

reviews.name: AshAgs
reviews.title: Breathtaking experience!
reviews.comment: Amazing natural beauty. We stayed for 4 days and spent half a day in and around the Grand Canyon. A mix of short and easy trails and awesome views make this a totally worthwhile visit.

reviews.name: EssexRon
reviews.title: Lovely half day hike
reviews.comment: Plenty of steps if you want to get all the viewpoints of the falls but well worth it. We did the south rim first (by far the best) and later the north (still worth seeing). After the falls, the path travels along the rim of the canyon for some distance and its a lovely and varied hike as the scenery opposite changes constantly.

reviews.name: Elise F
reviews.title: Early Bird Gets the Worm
reviews.comment:
You're going to want to get up around 5am every day and get out on the road. That early in the day, you'll see mule deer, porcupines, etc. Also, the parking lots will be empty, the construction zones will be down, and the roads will be free of traffic. Additionally, it will be cool. The downside is that the cool air makes the steam more visible, which obstructs the view of the thermal features.
The park has clearly marked trails and a wide variety of land types: volcanic geysers/pools, grasslands, mountains, rivers, canyons, waterfalls etc. I highly recommend Uncle Tom's hike.

reviews.name: C8264QQmichellej
reviews.title: Great scenery
reviews.comment: My husband and our two teenage children really enjoyed seeing this. I was surprised to see such a great waterfall in Yellowstone. The canyon is long, but a bend in it limits views to only part of it at a time. The cliffs and waterfall are spectacular to see.

reviews.name: Frank-in-MI
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: This was a favorite stopping point as we did a 3 day tour of Yellowstone. We were there toward the evening hours and loved how the sun lit up the formations. Make sure to make this stop.

reviews.name: OregonJoe
reviews.title: Gorgeous and spectacular
reviews.comment: What an incredible display of nature. Beautiful waterfall surrounded by a bright yellow canyon. Visions of the Grand Canyon in a compacted view. Like most everything in Yellowstone, this is a must see.

reviews.name: Momrat3
reviews.title: Sublime Artist's Point
reviews.comment:
After studying Alfred Bierstadt in Art History, I found it hard to believe that Artist Point would be anything like his painting. What with all the park visitors crowding around, plus global warming and pine beetle damage, I figured the view couldn't be as beautiful and the trees would be gone. I am not pessimistic; I just assumed he made it more vibrant than it was in reality.
Wow, was I wrong, and so happy to be wrong! This place is as lovely to see as any place I have been. The water is like green glass, the canyon walls are subtle pastels, the trees are deep green, and all I have is this camera. Sigh...next time I'm bringing my paintbox.

reviews.name: Tom D
reviews.title: Mother Nature at her Finest
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon at Yellowstone is fantastic. It's not like the North and South Rims of the Canyon but a masterpiece you can only see in Yellowstone. The mountains and waterfalls are simply beautiful and something you should not miss while your in the park. This is definitely one of the top 10 things to see in the park

reviews.name: Goavidtraveler
reviews.title: Stunning Views
reviews.comment:
Land, Waterfall and Bright Blue Sky with an wide expense of lush green land and mountains all juxtapositioning was effect.
While we were there, a rainbow showed itself across the falls. A place not to be missed if you are in the area.

reviews.name: Jeff K
reviews.title: A must see at YNP
reviews.comment: We made a day hike along the South Rim. Although the parking lot at the upper falls was full, the trail and viewing areas did not seem full. Great views all along the south rim trail. The hike was relatively easy, except for the spur with the long staircase. The north rim parking areas and viewing areas looked over full, so we did not go there.

reviews.name: Grant P
reviews.title: Great Scenery - Incredibly Busy Place!
reviews.comment: The waterfalls and scenery here are magnificent. In summer, be prepared to find parking scarce and people everywhere.

reviews.name: Steve_OldOkie
reviews.title: Hidden grandeur
reviews.comment: We've visited the Grand Canyon in Arizona several times and this sighting of Yellowstone's Grand Canyon was equally awe inspiring. The rushing waters from the water falls was a wonderful symphony highlighted by solo bird arias singing the beauty of nature. One additional surprise, a majestic bull elk was ruling his domain from a nearby copse of trees. Then there was the bonus of a bull bison easing along the roadway as we returned to our room at the Best Western Weston Inn.

reviews.name: Geri T
reviews.title: Most Spectacular View in the Park(Well at least one of the best)
reviews.comment: Words can't describe how beautiful the falls are. Go to both the North and South sides of the falls. It is worth it.

reviews.name: LoveOahu09
reviews.title: A must see!!
reviews.comment: Stop and park along the road, traffic will be crazy. Be ready to hike a little way but so worth it at the end! Breathtaking!! And amazing. Words can not describe the beauty you will see. Doesn't even look real!

reviews.name: Graham w
reviews.title: staggeringly beautiful
reviews.comment: Came here 36 years ago, still amazing sight despite crowds in August, we came June last time, hardly anybody here then. It is like a mini "Grand Canyon".

reviews.name: Patricia S
reviews.title: Hike - don't drive everywhere you can!
reviews.comment: Unbelievable scenic beauty and best seen by walking to every overlook and every trail! Truly one of the most beautiful areas in the park!!

reviews.name: Marci H
reviews.title: Picturesque
reviews.comment: This can be viewed many different ways and it is magical. I suggest doing all the hikes you can but there are pull offs if you want the easy way. Hit the park early to avoid crowds.

reviews.name: Julie H
reviews.title: Yellowstone Park is one of the best parks in the U.S.A. It's a must see.
reviews.comment: Yellowstone Park is a must see and one of the best parks in the U.S. A. The beautiful mountain and lake scenery is intermixed with geysers and mud pots. You have to do some driving to see the different sights and the park is really busy in the summer, but it is well worth it. We did not see any wildlife this time, but have seen buffalo, elk, and deer there before. One of the more beautiful sights is the Mammoth Hot Springs Terrace. There is some walking involved to get the best pictures.

reviews.name: Bill F
reviews.title: Awesome waterfall
reviews.comment: We stopped to visit the Grand Canyon and thought it was pretty incredible. Then we took the 3/4 mile walk down to the falls and we were amazed. It was awesome and well worth the walk. It's a hike back up the up hill so prepare yourself.

reviews.name: MMM
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Visit Artist's Point in the morning for a lovely rainbow at the base of the falls. When we visited in late July, the rainbow appeared at approximately 9:30. Check reviews to see based on sunrise times etc when you visit.

reviews.name: Michael J
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: This area is a must see if you're in Yellowstone! The scenery is absolutely breathtaking. We saw this in the late afternoon the lighting and shadows made it a sight to behold! Well worth the drive!

reviews.name: Christy B
reviews.title: It was beautiful
reviews.comment: The view was beautiful, amazing. But viewing it was crowded and chaotic. I felt like a tourist and not an admirer of creation. If I ever go to Yellowstone again I'm going in the fall.

reviews.name: Mark D
reviews.title: Stunning.
reviews.comment:
Come for the geysers, stay for the canyon. Several choices of walks along canyon rim and up to brink of falls.
Don't miss it!

reviews.name: 37firemedic
reviews.title: Family Vacation
reviews.comment: Stunning views of Gods Creation. You can view the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone from either canyon side, travel to both sides its worth it.

reviews.name: Keith P
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: Standing on the rim of this beautiful canyon you can see a might yriver that carved out its course thousands of years ago. The majesty of God's creation is without compromise!

reviews.name: sscToronto
reviews.title: Great Vistas available
reviews.comment:
We did the south ridge hike to artists point. Was a very nice hike, but not suitable for young kids. Lot's of cliffs to fall off. If I had to do this again, I would have driven to Artist Point, snapped some photo's, then gone back to the lower falls view and done the Uncle Tom's hike. Easier, and you get all the same views of the falls.
Go early, it is a lot nicer without the crowds.

reviews.name: Jan S
reviews.title: Bucket list item
reviews.comment: Something you have to see in your life. The geysers are amazing and unreal. Very educational for young kids and easy to self-drive. No bear sightings and no wolves seen, but still lots of Bison.

reviews.name: Hank J
reviews.title: Its Amazing
reviews.comment: Even if the park did not have thermal features, this is as amazing as the Arizona Grand Canyon. It has waterfalls, and has fun paths. Bring bear spray, to stay safe from bears.

reviews.name: Roger H
reviews.title: Majestic Views
reviews.comment: The hike on the south rim was great. Go early and avoid the crowds. Lots of bison while driving to trailhead so be careful.

reviews.name: Charles D
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: To me, this is the most beautiful part of Yellowstone. The walls of the canyon have to be where the name Yellowstone came from. Not to be missed!! And, don't assume you have seen the grandeur of the canyon from the roadway. Get out and walk to the viewpoints, if you are able!!

reviews.name: garbagecollector
reviews.title: See Artist Point and Brink of the Falls and other view points
reviews.comment: Yes, Artist Point is crowded, but that's because it is so special. Others might tout the trail views or a tough hike, but Artist Point rivals the views in Grand Canyon and Yosemite. It's really fantastic! Secondly, check out the Brink of the Falls. It's a short drive from Artist Point and a short walk from the parking lot. Seeing the power of the water going over the edge is spectacular and sounds so cool!

reviews.name: journeemyles
reviews.title: Best Part of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: This was my family's favorite area of Yellowstone. We could have stayed here the entire week and been perfectly content. It is absolutely stunning! Do all of the trails that you have time to do, the waterfalls change with every view that you witness. Do not miss Uncle Tom's Trail! It is a MUST DO!

reviews.name: Bibi128
reviews.title: Simply Stunning!
reviews.comment: I haven't seen the Grand Canyon yet so I can't compare; however, I was visually stunned by Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Views from the North Rim are spectacular. From the rush of water on the Lower Falls, to the mists rising at it hits canyon bottom. The color of the walls, a soft, creamy ecru often shot through with red, to the blue of the river running below. It really is breath taking. I did not make the trek down to the falls viewing platforms but from what I understand it is relatively easy. Check with the rangers to be sure. I did go over to the South Rim. The view of the Lower Falls is much better from the observation points.

reviews.name: Allen R H
reviews.title: Beautiful Vistas
reviews.comment: The falls and canyon offer spectacular views, but some of the trails are not for the faint of heart. It was a nice divergence from the other geologic formations in the park.

reviews.name: ewall67
reviews.title: great hike
reviews.comment: When you're in Yellowstone, this is one of those hikes you should really make time to do. Take the family - enjoy the great outdoors. Leave the internet behind - reality is WAY better!

reviews.name: 683jeans
reviews.title: beautiful
reviews.comment:
We arrived through the south entrance of the Park by the US 191. Take route 20 on the Grand Loop Road and then take on, N Rim Drive, to do a mandatory stop to admire this beautiful place.
The parking lot is well laid out.
After a short walk on a marked path, we arrive at the edge of the impressive canyon and we admire all the colours of rock of the walls.
Inside, we see down the yellowstone river. You can see the majestic waterfall. It's very beautiful.

reviews.name: Salvatore C
reviews.title: Yellowstone Grand Cayon
reviews.comment: This is truly God's doing...so spectecular and beiutifull. You will not be disappointed....although there is some walking that requires alot of energy...it is worth thej effort...If you can not make the walk down and up to the water fall...there is a lookout point that is quite simple to view it from....the look out point is senior freindly!!...the south rim is very difficult and alot if stairs!!

reviews.name: ninfrtr
reviews.title: Easy on the feet!
reviews.comment: Great views without having to walk to far to see. Lots of parking and people leaving quickly so no wait for parking space. We went around 1pm

reviews.name: David292737
reviews.title: Gorgeous setting!
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is absolutely stunning, featuring a waterfall at the top, forests on either side, and colorful cliffs. I recommend the South Rim Trail along the south rim of the canyon for the best overall views -- you get great views of the falls and multiple overlooks of the canyon. You could start at Uncle Tom's Trail and climb down the 380 steps if you want, but the views from the trail were just as good in my opinion and far less busy. The east end of the South Rim Trail is Artist's Overlook (also packed with tourists), so the walk along the way between Uncle's Tom's Trail and Artist's Overlook is probably the best way to get all of the views with less foot traffic around you.

reviews.name: hikerks
reviews.title: Breathtaking and awesome views
reviews.comment: My husband and I spent most of the day at the canyon area. We hiked Uncle Tom's Trail, South Rim trail, Artist Point,walks around the North Rim area and just enjoyed all the different perspectives of the beauty of the various colors in the canyon and the thundering waterfalls and special views of rainbows.

reviews.name: Sue B
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: Almost everywhere in Yellowstone has a breathtaking view, but the first time you see this from the top you realize some places are prettier than others! Must hike up to see this from the top, not just the parking lot where there are hundreds of tourists taking pictures of the waterfall. Keep in mind this is a wild area with wild animals, and there are no guardrails on the upper rim, so keep the kiddos close by.

reviews.name: Shannon P
reviews.title: Gorgeous views!
reviews.comment: We enjoyed touring both the north and south rims. The best view was at Uncle Tom's trail. Although it was strenuous, the view definitely beat out Artist's point. I gave four stars because the Upper Geyser Basin was our favorite over the canyon area.

reviews.name: BrianAthens_Tx
reviews.title: "Spectacular" doesn't do it justice.
reviews.comment: We day hiked the Ribbon Lake loop along the south rim where there were spectacular views of the falls, canyon, and Yellowstone River. The trailhead at Uncle Tom's Point and Artist Point was very crowded but the trail itself wasn't so bad. The return loop passes through some areas with fumaroles and mud volcanoes and the smell of sulfur in the air. Now we know wher the "Yellowstone" got its name!

reviews.name: Juniapetunia
reviews.title: Fabulous experience
reviews.comment: We hiked the South Rim Trail most of the way. Since there are so many awesome views along the trail, we didn't feel the need to go to Artist's Point. There are so many people there...just not necessary. We were at the trail by 9 and there were very few people along the way until closer to 11, and even then, it wasn't bad. Hike is about 3 1/2 miles roundtrip.

reviews.name: Soggyinsnoqualmie
reviews.title: one of the must sees
reviews.comment: do at least one of the hikes to get closer to the falls and the great views. Watch kids along the edge, there are some areas that don't have much to keep people from falling.

reviews.name: anonymous882016
