reviews.title: Nice view
reviews.comment: It is a view point where one can get nice view of the lower falls and grand canyon of the Yellowstone. It is pictures-queue.

reviews.name: muralidhar2015
reviews.title: Visit A Legendary Park.
reviews.comment: We drove all the way from Denver, Colo and arrived late night in Cody at a pre- booked lodge.The views on the way was Great.Next morning set out for the Yellowstone National Park.Outside temperature was cold,but our expectations were immense, every now & then forcing us out of the car to breathe freshest of airs & admire the Lake, faraway snow clad mountains and try to locate a Bear on Ground. Wild life abounds, road side warnings do prepare you for this. This being a volcanic region, Sulphur springs abound and well marked places are to be trekked to Enjoy oneself. Mid morning saw us eagerly waiting for Eruptions of the Old Faithful,(largest of the Geysers) which does so with clockwork precision. Crowd's anticipation is fully justified & cheering on seeing the Geyser can only be explained as ecstatic. A sprawling Log Cabin(claimed to be largest of its kind in Northern America) serves people with Good Food, lodging & Greatest of the views. A Great Water Fall & Rhyolite mountain takes up your afternoon. You can drive around a number of places stopping by to admire Nature at its Best. We chose to drive back to Jackson for the Night. Setting sun behind the Grand Tetons Range offers magnificent vista to record and savour later with Wine & Dinner. Plan for at least two nights stay, you will not be disappointed. Love to go back.

reviews.name: Christary B
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: It's worth the hike to see the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone! It's such a beautiful sight! God is so creative! You will enjoy it!

reviews.name: Debbie K
reviews.title: Absolutely BEAUTIFUL!
reviews.comment: It was awe-inspiring to see God's Hands & Nature's Beauty at work. You could spend hours there (the upper and lower Falls).

reviews.name: Thomas S
reviews.title: a Yellowstone experience
reviews.comment: There are so way great things to do and see throughout the park, so it is difficult to pick and choose. To really see all the great views and features it can take days. We spent three and half and did see it all.

reviews.name: Kimberly M
reviews.title: Lovely walk from Artist Point along the south rim
reviews.comment: One of the most breathtaking views I can imagine - unforgettable. There's a short hiking trail that goes along the rim from Artist Point that's a very easy walk with wonderful views of the canyon. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Fred M
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful!
reviews.comment: The views at Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone were amazing. The steep cliffs and canyon face, waterfalls, and natural beauty make this a must for nay visitor to Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Brian D
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of YS
reviews.comment: It was a spectacular view as you make your way down the 200+ steps. It doesn't reach the bottom but you will have an awesome view of the waterfall. It can get pretty crowded at the end when everyone wants to take pictures. Only downside to this is that you have to make your way back to the top. But overall, good place to visit if you are ever in YS.

reviews.name: Muguvian
reviews.title: Falls!
reviews.comment: Loved stopping here at various areas and getting photos of the gorgeous scenery. The canyon walls are spectacular, and the roar of the falls adds to the spectacle.

reviews.name: Vacay
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Stay at Canyon Lodge to do both North and South Rim Hikes. If you do the hikes you don't have to go to Artist Point

reviews.name: Colin D
reviews.title: Better to visit out of summer holidays
reviews.comment:
Yellowstone was the aim destination for a month holiday in the US. It was good, but no where near as good as Grand Tetons (you must consider climbing Table Mountain), the Ruby Mountains or Lake Tahoe.
Just too many people and too many cars. National Parks need to consider queues for viewing points......with say a maximum stay of 20 seconds before you need to move on.
Won't say two days in the park were wasted, but definitely an anticlimax.

reviews.name: Donna M
reviews.title: Must see!
reviews.comment: If you've seen the Grand Canyon you will understand the name of this site. Beautiful colors of the canyon walls with flowing river at the canyon base. Lovely!

reviews.name: Sharkalark
reviews.title: Amazing from every view
reviews.comment: This place was amazing. I went at sunset one night and again the next morning. I practically had the place to myself and the light was amazing for pictures. One of my favorite places in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Tammy B
reviews.title: Grand Cany0ne
reviews.comment: In my opinion this is one of my favorite sites in Yellowstone Park. Absolutely beautiful! It really did remind me of the Colorado River flowing through the Grand Canyon. The waters looked so blue even on a rainy day!

reviews.name: sarahbutcher27
reviews.title: Wow! A must-see in the park!
reviews.comment: Words can't describe the beauty of this area! We viewed the canyon from Artists Point, Grandview, and Brink of the Upper Falls. I wish we would have planned more time and done one of the rim hikes. Definitely add this to your must-see list!

reviews.name: Gone F
reviews.title: Do not miss Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
reviews.comment: We stayed at Canyon Lodge in early July 2016. That's where you want to stay if you want to send time visiting the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. Take the Upper Rim road and the Lower Rim road. Stop at all the turnouts, because each gives you a different view of the canyon, river and falls. Do some hiking, but be sure to educate yourself about the trails - some have large elevation changes - easy going down, but difficult going back up. This is one of the must-do features of Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Suzanne M
reviews.title: Beautiful Waterfall
reviews.comment: The Waterfall is beautiful. If you walk down the steps you will be very close to the falls. A must see if you are in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: Wyn G
reviews.title: Just visited a traffic jam for a whole day.
reviews.comment:
I have visited Yellowstone twice in the past, but this visit was an immense disappointment I am really sorry to say. I have seen bears, deer, wolves, otters but on previous visits, this trip we only saw a raven in one of the badly organised car parks.
It is a beautiful place but don't go in July or August is my recommendation. We had a day long traffic jam which is miserable especially when ones expectations (based on previous trips) are so high and hoping to see an abundance of wildlife. There is nothing wrong with Yellowstone but if you wish to watch Old Faithful along with several thousand other folks the go in July or August. Last time I saw Old Faithful I was there in June and saw it blow with maybe one hundred people also watching. Sadly a forgettable experience for us this time around, I will be back but not in July or August, our experience was quite horrid unless you like sitting in heavy traffic on your vacation, if this is your taste head to Yellowstone today, you wont be disappointed.

reviews.name: LeftyPicker
reviews.title: Picturesque, but not the best of Yellowstone.
reviews.comment:
August 6-7, 2016.
We understand why this is a popular spot for artists an photographers. The view of the lower falls from Artist's Point is certainly beautiful. However, among canyons and waterfalls, we have seen others similar, so this was not one of our favorite areas of Yellowstone. Artists Point and Inspiration Point are worth a stop if you are in the area. Did not care for the hikes to the brinks of the two falls. Not a good spot for viewing and appreciating the falls. Having visited Grand Canyon NP 3 years ago, any place using those two words in its title is stretching it. The canyon is impressive--and the only one of its kind in Yellowstone--but we would not describe it as 'grand.'

reviews.name: mikes970
reviews.title: Go see it!
reviews.comment: This was amazing. I preferred the north rim side. Give yourself enough time to get out and walk around. Go down to the lower falls. If there are crowds be patient people will continue to move. There are parking lots all along the north rim road. I gave myself two full days in Yellowstone and did the north loop for one day and the south loop on the second day.

reviews.name: Judy M
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: I love the Grand Canyon in Arizona and am so happy I saw this in Yellowstone. It is a very short hike for a beautiful view and great picture opportunities

reviews.name: pinkbroo
reviews.title: Canyon is quite spectacular - view from Artists Point simply stunning!
reviews.comment:
We stayed at Canyon Lodge for 2 nights as part of a family holiday (2 kids aged 6 and 16) in July 2016 and whilst there visited both the north and south rims of the Canyon to see the upper and lower falls.
The canyon is quite spectacular and you can feel the sheer force of the waterfalls. The viewing from Artists point in particular was simply stunning. Inspiration Point was closed for maintenance works on our visit which was disappointing but we still really enjoyed our visit and in fact our 16 year old said it was his favourite bit of our whole trip - praise indeed!!

reviews.name: Fred1855
reviews.title: Wow fun to see up close
reviews.comment: Driving the loop it's definitely worth the pullover if you can find a parking place. Perfect sunny day made for great pictures. Just be ready for crowds of sightseers

reviews.name: macboysmom
reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.comment: This is a must see. The South Rim is the best best if you are short on time. Artist Point is breathtaking. Probably my favorite spot in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: TheTravelingMan70
reviews.title: Unbelievable view. Great family photo opportunity.
reviews.comment: We were at the end of our trip and I had to stop here. I am so glad I did. It was so beautiful. It really looked like a painting with water moving through it. Be patient, lots of people around. Most were very respectful for picture taking.

reviews.name: MidgesMom99
reviews.title: A must see at Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Breathtaking waterfall and valley views. Easy walking trail with many beautiful photo opts. A ranger was giving an insightful talk when we arrived. The waterfall is stunning.

reviews.name: jkdussault
reviews.title: Wow! nature's beauty at its best.
reviews.comment: this canyon is so beautiful. i have never been to the grand canyon in arizona, but my husband has been there. he said that this one was just as good as the one in arizona and if we never get to the one in arizona, it's fine. i am speechless and words cannot describe this beauty of nature. it should be on your bucket list of things to see and do in yellowstone national park.

reviews.name: audio_man01
reviews.title: A Gem
reviews.comment:
There is really very little that we could possibly add to this spectacular portion of Yellowstone National Park. Visiting this and other portions of the park was close to a religious experience as one gazed upon this stunningly beautiful canyon and waterfall.
It is simply a MUST, ABSOLUTELY GOTTA see site and a great example that regardless of the amount of time that you have budgeted to visit this park, you'll simply walk away in absolute awe at what you have experienced and profound disappointment that your vacation must end so that you can return to work so that you can start saving for your next visit!

reviews.name: WorkHardPlayHard225
reviews.title: Breathtaking views and a must see
reviews.comment: This area has some absolutely breathtaking views. There are many options to view it. You can get to either side of the canyon; you can view it from top level overlooks; or you can take paths down into the canyon to view the waterfalls etc. more closely. We stuck to the overlooks and the epic views they provided. The trails down look to be fun and allow for close up, or a different angled view from down inside the canyon. Some trails don't go down to the falls, some are farther down the canyon and just provide a different perspective. They are not for the out of shape or injured, as they are very steep and long windy paths. However, they provide amazing views for those who wish to take them. That said, you do not need to in order to enjoy this magnificent area of the park. The overlooks provide full views of it all, and from multiple overlook locations to provide different views and angles. It's a definite must see for any first time visit.

reviews.name: starfighterltd
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: This really does look like the grand canyon! So beautiful! The waterfall is amazing! There is plenty of parking in this area.

reviews.name: Jayendra P
reviews.title: Breathtaking views!! just amazing
reviews.comment:
We had planned to spend 36 hours in Yellow Stone park due to unavoidable circumstances. We were on our way to attend a wedding. However, we ensured that we reached Artist's point on the lower rim as early in the day as possible. Wise decision. especially on the weekend.
The stunning views of the lower water falls, the "painted" valleys with bright colors from oxidized metals, the blue sky, the green vegetation, around the water is a perfect place for photographs. However, everyone who comes there has the same idea. The area where one can take pictures or view the scenery is limited and thus potential to create congestion. Thus, we started from here and went to the north rim later on.
It is difficult to explain the beauty in words. Thus, you have to see it!!
must see!!!

reviews.name: WhoDat66
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: No more need be said. Worth the drive and every step you take to view this magical place. Watch for the nesting Eagles as there were many around.

reviews.name: Heidi g
reviews.title: Probably my most favofite spot in Yellowstone! Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: We visited the South Rim first one and the North Rim another day. The Yellowstone River was turquoise blue and wove through the canyon with very high walls of many colors like yellow, coral, pink! We took the South Rim trail and it was easy with some hilly paths. There are numerous overlooks and any one of them is just amazingly beautiful. We hiked to Artists Point and there's a wonderful lookout area there where you can see the canyon in both directions and the Lower Falls. The Lower Falls are super cool with the green color that is in the water at the top! Never saw that before! We hiked down the North Rim to the Lower Falls overlook where you are right at the top of those falls and it's breathtaking! That was somewhat strenuous getting down and then back up but well worth it. Take your time and stop and rest! We saw a momma black bear and two cubs out in a field just before stopping at the North Rim too! Highly recommend seeing Yellowstone's GRAND Canyon!

reviews.name: heiditwilliams
reviews.title: Have to see to appreciate.
reviews.comment: We took the Uncle Tom's trail to the lower falls. Was a strenuous walk back up but worth it. Don't attempt if you are not in at least fair shape.

reviews.name: 907blaked
reviews.title: Stunning views!!
reviews.comment: We really enjoyed driving to the various overlooks along the North Rim drive (3 different parking lots with overlooks, plus Inspiration Point - which was closed when we were there), Brink of Upper Falls (single parking lot with overlook), and the South Rim drive (we just did the final overlook - Artist Point - at the end of the drive, but there are 2 other overlooks that require a bit of hiking). We did not hike along the trail but rather drove from overlook to overlook. The views were absolutely beautiful and well worth it. Some of the areas made us nervous with our kids. I read on another post that the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone has the most beautiful views in all of Yellowstone, and I think I would have to agree with that.

reviews.name: HouTexRunner
reviews.title: Beautiful afternoon visit
reviews.comment:
The waterfall down into the canyon is breathtaking and beautiful. The different minerals mixed with the water and scenery in the background just makes you want to pause..... and take in a few moments.
You really will want to spend enough time to make a beautiful memory.
Just keep a close eye on the little one's since it is a very deep canyon with lots of people.
Schedule a stop and enjoy you will be glad you did.

reviews.name: jmwonderer
reviews.title: Pictures do not do this justice
reviews.comment: You hear the waterfall from the parking lot. Super powerful. Must see in Yellowstone. Get out early to avoid crowds.

reviews.name: Mary Jane R
reviews.title: A sight
reviews.comment: Very cool! Hiked the Uncle Tom's trail to get an up close view of one of the falls. The falls is so cool, very powerful and with a green colour flowing with the water which we can't figure out what! A strenuous hike back up on the stairs but it was all worth it! Wish we had more time to do more of the trails..

reviews.name: Adventure-travel101
reviews.title: One in a lifetime view
reviews.comment: This is breathtaking. Just amazing. Make sure to do all points of the canyon. Uncle tom's trail is a must do. Artist point may just be the most incredible view in the whole world. Also make sure to do the brink of the falls trail ( both waterfalls) It's incredible standing right next to the water.

reviews.name: cr0ssc0untryb0und
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: A must see at Yellowstone. Parking was easy in this location and the views were amazing. Perfect amount of walking.

reviews.name: Christian F
reviews.title: Part of the beauty of this fabulous country that we are blessed to live in !
reviews.comment:
Anyone that is a native or visitor to the U.S.A that has not taken the time to visit
Yellowstone has really not seen the most beautiful, peaceful place on earth !

reviews.name: hkallumkal
reviews.title: Awesome views
reviews.comment: Great view of the canyon and the waterfalls. Make sure to visit the Artist Point to get a nice view of the lower falls.

reviews.name: Robert W
reviews.title: Our favorite spot in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The views and sites are fabulous. Uncle Tom's hike is very strenuous, but the rewarding views are worth the effort.

reviews.name: Christy C
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: The sound of the water is so relaxing. The views are much prettier then the Grand Canyon in Arizona. You can take pictures all around and it would look like a postcard. Absolutely a site to see.

reviews.name: janeandiain2016
reviews.title: Scenery
reviews.comment: Amazing scenery. There are 3 main areas of the park and are very different. It is almost like visiting 3 separate locations. Lots of great viewing points, some require a bit of walking and not all reas are accessible for disabled people.

reviews.name: william w
reviews.title: Sight seeing
reviews.comment: This is a wonder to see,there are many other things to see in the area,you can hike in the area to see even more.

reviews.name: Lisa A
reviews.title: Surreal landscape
reviews.comment: This place is beyond words...It is so beautiful. One of my favorite stops in the park. IT IS BUSY at this pull-off but so worth it.

reviews.name: Michael B
reviews.title: Family Trip to Yellowstone
reviews.comment: What a great experience. The falls of Yellowstone and view of the canyon were spectacular. This is an absolute MUST SEE on any visit. Our four grandchildren from six to eleven were mesmerized. Although tired, this experience was without parallel.

reviews.name: Donna C
reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is the most awesome place inside Yellowstone Park. We took lots of great picture easy in and out travel.

reviews.name: RPIBUFF
reviews.title: Incredible
reviews.comment: There are no words to describe the magnificence of the Canyon, but I'll try. We covered all the options - both sides, upper falls, lower falls, at the brink, down lower, every which way. We even took the metal walkway on the east side of canyon - not for the faint of heart or out of shape folks 😀. In the area are places to eat and buffalo and wolves and elk. What else can I say but don't miss that area of the park.

reviews.name: Jacob L
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: If you live the great outdoors then don't miss this part of Yellowstone. We've been to Yellowstone twice and I still don't think we've seen it all. You can spend a lifetime exploring or just sitting in the park. Seek out the canyon if you're only in the park for a day.

reviews.name: adithi a
reviews.title: Amazing place with most amazing views
reviews.comment: The place looks very unreal and especially from the artist point the canyon looks like a painting. There are quite some moderate hikes for people wanting to walk around. I felt south rim views to be more beautiful than north rim views.

reviews.name: NoIberostarFan
reviews.title: Great if you haven't seen the real thing
reviews.comment: The view exit from the road is not well marked, but is worth the view. But seeing the real Grand Canyon is completely different.

reviews.name: JLF923
reviews.title: Not to be missed!
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon was just amazing to see. There are a ton of walking trails around and into the canyon that give you lots of different views and perspectives. I'd highly recommend walking down to the brink of the upper and lower falls if you are able to. Also Uncle Tom's trail on the south side of the canyon was well worth the effort.
The parking lots were very crowded, so plan accordingly.

reviews.name: DonW
reviews.title: Beautiful waterfalls and good hiking in this area
reviews.comment: Beautiful waterfalls and good hiking in this area. The canyon is beautiful as are the waterfalls. IF you want to go down to the lower viewing area of the lower falls, beware that the steps are steep and plentiful and the walk is quite tiring.

reviews.name: Bill
reviews.title: Unbelievable Beauty
reviews.comment: I felt like I was in heaven or tge land of the lost or both. The scenery was immensely beautiful. I recommend spending time in this area of Yellowstone esp hiking.

reviews.name: Manu
reviews.title: Wao, beautiful !!
reviews.comment: First of all, if you have good knees I recommend you to walk down the trail with the so many stairs and you won't regret it, otherwise stay around the overlook and still you gonna love the place.

reviews.name: HannekeLeonie
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The grand canyon of Yellowstone is very beautiful! Drive both rims and walk down to the Lower falls. We spend approximately 3 hours in this area.

reviews.name: draclark
reviews.title: Impressive canyon
reviews.comment: This was our first visit to Yellowstone and the canyon is not to be missed. Don't miss the walk down and around the viewing area and up the steps for a great photo opportunity

reviews.name: SeabrightBunch
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Upper and lower falls were spectacular! It is quite a hike up and down the 300 odd some stairs at one viewing area. I would recommend wearing good shoes and bringing plenty of water (We all had flip flops on and tennis shoes in the car😬). Down was pretty easy, but freaky if you are not a fan of heights. And going up is not as easy as it would be at sea level! Just saying...even those in great shape will be huffing and puffing at the top of the climb. That said its not hard and we did it with grandparents and young kids. Anyone in moderately good shape can handle this hike and the view is worth it!

reviews.name: Umbrella
reviews.title: Everything is beautiful in Yellowstone!
reviews.comment:
Rode motorcycles through Yellowstone for 9 days! There are a lot of miles to cover! Dont plan a short visit, as it takes a while to get to each place. The roads are often blocked by Bison. That can slow you down for a very long time! We ran into a lot of road construction. That became an unwelcome hazard, as gravel and motorcycles do not mix!!
It's a beautiful place to visit....lot's of people have discovered that!

reviews.name: Travis B
reviews.title: Beautiful and worth the hike
reviews.comment: We had 24 hours to see Yellowstone and this was one of the highlights. Take the time to stop and hike to all vista points. Incredibly worth every minute and every step.

reviews.name: Jossey
reviews.title: My Favorite In Yellowstone
reviews.comment: The most beautiful area of Yellowstone. We had to bypass a few attrations, due to crowds. Thankfully, we found a decent parking spot for the canyon. Hiked to the lower falls. Easy going down, coming up is a bit of a climb. There are some resting benches on the way up. Amazing photo ops.

reviews.name: Lance2185
reviews.title: early morning stop
reviews.comment:
This was nice but in a park of such awesome things this was ok.
I would only go early in the am or late in the after noon as it can get very busy. upper and lower falls are worth the stop

reviews.name: Najebo
reviews.title: Beautiful but crowded
reviews.comment: We got there around 9am and it was already very crowded. But you don't want to miss this spot as it is probably one of most beautiful views in the park.

reviews.name: tsalvati35
reviews.title: Beautiful...but crowded
reviews.comment:
A must see on any trip to Yellowstone, some highlights include: Uncle Tom's Trail, Brink of Lower Falls and Artist Point.
Arrive early to find parking.
Tip: We found parking in the lot near Uncle Tom's Trail, from there it's only one mile (each way) to reach Artist Point, which can be a very difficult spot to park in.

reviews.name: Hnic7
reviews.title: Worth it!
reviews.comment: I love waterfalls, so consider that in this review. I had been to Yellowstone a few times before but had never seen the canyon. It is massive, stunning, awe inspiring. The hike is brief and you have lots of options. I didn't do my homework in advance, so if you really are picky on what or how you see it - do plan it in advance. But if not, you can wing it and be successful!

reviews.name: missmaggiesmom
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: Don't miss this when visiting Yellowstone! You can take a short, easy walk and view the falls from an overlook, or hike a short but very steep trail (with many, many stairs) down to the base of the lower falls. Either one is well worth the time!

reviews.name: Beth B
reviews.title: Do a little cardio before you go!
reviews.comment:
With all of the other things (roads, ramps, walkways) that they've incorporated at the park, it's a little amazing to me that there's no handrail along the path to the waterfall. People are working their way along the long path...anxious kids darting around you, parents with strollers. It's a LONG way up and down, and not recommended if you have an issue with heights. There are benches at the ends occasionally if needed. Found one mother stopped half way up with a stroller definitely struggling!!!
That said, it has been the highlight of out trip so far. The view is incredible!

reviews.name: RajeshC
reviews.title: lots of animal
reviews.comment: Bisons, bears are here. Good view of the natural as well. Cold at night. You can hike all the way to the bottom.

reviews.name: kmiller1951
reviews.title: Great view
reviews.comment: Thie Yellowstone Grand Canyon is impressive. There is a short walk to the scenic overlook. The view is beautiful and well worth the stop.

reviews.name: Jim G
reviews.title: Gorgeous
reviews.comment: One of the absolute highlights of my stay in the park. And that's saying a lot in Yellowstone - which is filled with awesome sights.

reviews.name: JWaters68
reviews.title: Iconic views, a must to see!
reviews.comment: Went to two different views, one above the falls and one from Artist's Point on the other side of the canyon. This should not be missed. I could sit here for hours talking photos and enjoying the falls and wildlife.

reviews.name: Aundrea R
reviews.title: Wonderful visit. Would return here again
reviews.comment: My whole family enjoyed the trip to the canyon. There was minimum walking involved for those with small children. However I would keep a close hold on the children, as I'm afraid they would climb over. A great experience and the kids and entire family enjoyed it. We simply drove to each stop and got out on each trail for a few minutes then got back in the car. I feel like a tour would be too much, especially with kids.

reviews.name: agd2015
reviews.title: Awesome no matter from what place you see it
reviews.comment: What a wonderful sight! There are several different ways to view the GC of Yellowstone, the north rim, the south rim, hike down into the canyon to get closer to the waterfall or see it from one, or more, of all the view points. No matter how you choose to do you will be in for a truly great moment!

reviews.name: Todd H
reviews.title: The best view in Yellowstone Park
reviews.comment: We spent four days in Yellowstone national park and of all the places we visited in the park, this was by far the most beautiful scenery. If you visit Yellowstone this is a must see in the park. It would be a great place to take family pictures or a senior picture.

reviews.name: Maureen S
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: A must see at Yellowstone. You can view it from both sides, which we did. There are a lot of trails of varying difficulty to see both the upper and lower falls.

reviews.name: Tracy G
reviews.title: Grand
reviews.comment: We were lucky enough to spot a bear on the cliffs across the canyon from where we were. Make sure you bring your binoculars

reviews.name: mp2travels
reviews.title: What a marvelous place!
reviews.comment: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is a wild and beautiful place! There are numerous overlooks for those who can not hike. Then there are trails of medium to lengthy time and various difficulty for those who want to get up close and personal with the Canyon! The sound of the upper and lower falls resonate though out the canyon. This is a wonderful display of God's creation!

reviews.name: jbmathusek
reviews.title: Spectacular National Park
reviews.comment: I don't even know how to describe the Park other than Breathtaking anything other than that is worthless. This Park is a must for everyone. Just go and experience the splendor of this Park.

reviews.name: Nechama S
reviews.title: Gorgeous! Spend the day going to see the falls from each viewing point
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful things to see and do in Yellowstone. We spent one day hiking, climbing up and climbing down to see the falls from each viewing point. It is so gorgeous. The "artist point" is the easiest hike and very dramatic view. The "Uncle Tom's Trail" is a lot of overhead and a lot of stairs. The view is nice but the standing area at the base of the trail is small and as soon as you get down there, you feel pressure to leave because there isn't enough room for a lot of people to stand around there resting. The North Rim Trail was the most worth-it in my opinion as it is not a strenuous trail to the falls or back, it is a series of ramps instead of stairs and the view is unreal. Hiking around the falls is fun, great exercise and the views are not-to-be-missed. Bring your camera, good sneakers or trail shoes, a hat and some water.

reviews.name: Alissia P
reviews.title: Simply amazing !
reviews.comment: This is just an amazing place to visit, do not miss it, the views are stunning. Make sure you go down on Uncle Tom's trail (take your time on the way up).. and do it in the morning to see the rainbow.

reviews.name: Adam R
reviews.title: Great waterfalls!
reviews.comment: In my opinion, this is at the top of the list of things to see in Yellowstone, aside from the animals. The views were incredible!

reviews.name: Doc1955
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Did the south rim hike. Terrific hike. Not very strenuous. Well marked. Unfortunately paved in many areas

reviews.name: mr_hand
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Not quite as good as the real thing but still impressive. Parking might be tough to find in the summer but it's worth the stop. You'll se the river flowing though the canyon and the waterfall but make your way to artists point for the best view

reviews.name: Calidris53
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: This may not be 'the' Grand Canyon but its certainly spectacular. We did a section of the South Rim Trail including the steep stairway known as Uncle Tom's Trail which affords fantastic views of the Lower Falls. Its worth walking a bit further towards Artist Point to appreciate the sheer size of the gorge and get away from any crowds.

reviews.name: Stuart W
reviews.title: Yellowstone trip 2016
reviews.comment: Went back multiple times during our Yellowstone trip. There are many trails and views of the falls which are all different. Don't miss Artists point.

reviews.name: Timothy Y
reviews.title: More Scenic Than the Geysers
reviews.comment: The best view I got was from the Lower Falls Hike. There were many obstructed views along the rim. This is a definite must see at Yellowstone.

reviews.name: CO55
reviews.title: Vacation
reviews.comment: Amazing Canyon with a beautiful water fall. You can peer down into this ever changing canyon and gaze at the awe inspiring water fall. Park Rangers give regular programs on the canyon and how it continues to change!

reviews.name: b.mck8113
reviews.title: Must See!
reviews.comment: This view was worth the trip from Boston. The pictures do not do the location justice. It also has several hiking locations for the willing.

reviews.name: dps_Sedona
reviews.title: Superb
reviews.comment: I will be cutting and pasting this review because everything in the park is great to visit. Some are better than others but that's all subjective. Worth the visit.

reviews.name: BNTTravels
reviews.title: Excellent views. Don't miss.
reviews.comment: Where ever you go to view, it is a beautiful site. This time we were on the south side, and even with lots of tourists it is well worth the time and effort.

reviews.name: Stephan Neuhauss
reviews.title: Impressive Canyon with Waterfalls
reviews.comment: The canyon is deeply cut into multicolored stones by the seemingly tame yellowstone river that forms two magnificent water falls. On a sunny day the water spray creates a permanent rainbow. Both rim hikes are worth the effort.

reviews.name: Buenos Nachos
reviews.title: Majestic!
reviews.comment: If in Yellowstone, a must see Outside of Old Faithful, probably the most iconic representation of the park

reviews.name: Lisa R
reviews.title: Amazing!!! Breathtaking!!
reviews.comment: This is a must see if you are visiting Yellowstone. There was a trail to follow down to see the view, but the hike was a little steep getting back up. If you have any health problems, you might want to take it slow, but it was well worth the time. The photos we took were amazing and one of the most beautiful sites I have ever seen.

reviews.name: Juliette G
reviews.title: It really is like a mini Grand Canyon
reviews.comment: Wow what a view! We started out at the South Rim Drive then did the Brink of the Upper Falls and finished with the North Rim Drive. Best to get out there early as it gets packed quickly. If you want to get pictures (like panoramas) without others in your pics you will need to be there by 9am. Parking was the best here versus anywhere else in the park but again we were there early. The views were spectacular! Worth the walk down to Artist Point and at the Brink of Upper Falls. We did not do Uncle Tom's Trail as we could see lots from the smaller walks. We are glad we didn't as we saw a lot of people struggling back up the stairs (you get a good view point of the trail from the Brink). Lookout Point and Grand View are also good places to stop as they give great views of the canyon below. Inspiration Point is closed until 2018 for renovations.

reviews.name: barke1020
reviews.title: Make sure to take the hike down!
reviews.comment: If you're physically able, the hike down to lower falls is so worth it. The view above the falls is one of the best I've ever seen!. The hike down isn't difficult, however ascending over 600 feet is moderately challenging.

reviews.name: Jing W
reviews.title: Amazing view, easy hike to falls
reviews.comment: Very easy hike to lower falls. Upper falls and inspiration point trails were closed for maintenance during my visit, but the views of and from lower falls was worth it.

reviews.name: evaporatorz
reviews.title: Largest waterfalls in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: A quick and easy hike down to the upper falls, then another down to the larger, lower fall. The views are gorgeous. You can then go further to Artist Point on a steep at times, trail which follows the river.

reviews.name: conniehar
reviews.title: Highlight of the trip!
reviews.comment: This area of Yellowstone is gorgeous!!! Don't miss the falls and Artist Pointe! And the rainbow on Uncle Tom's Trail!

reviews.name: Graham W
reviews.title: Visit to Yellowstone
reviews.comment: If you have time it is worth visiting. There are several areas to stop & view & it is worth stopping at 2 or 3 of them & following walkway. Take your binoculars if you have them

reviews.name: Steve618
reviews.title: Beautiful but terribly crowded in July
reviews.comment:
We visited both the north and south rims of the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. The views of the canyon and falls were spectacular, but we were disappointed at the woefully inadequate parking and the crowded theme park feel of the attractions. Also we had an elderly person in a wheelchair which missed most of the overlooks since they were too difficult to navigate, despite claiming to be wheelchair accessible.
Listen to the guidebooks and avoid this place in July, and go during a less crazy time!

reviews.name: mexistu
reviews.title: Stunning and vast
reviews.comment: A short 5 minute drive on the Canyon loop to see the waterfalls with breathtaking vistas. The largest waterfall in Yellowstone park.

reviews.name: DianneF50
reviews.title: Simply Beautiful
reviews.comment: Yellowstone is simply amazing! There isn't anything to see that you are not in aw of. It took us 3 days to enjoy the entire Grand Canyon from every direction. Each place, view was beautiful and beyond imagination. Yes, go - see and enjoy!

reviews.name: OldBridgeTraveler
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The falls is beautiful. The parking lot was not that large. There is a walk to see the falls, but well worth it! They have several viewing points allowing for some really good photos!

reviews.name: Lynn M
reviews.title: Beatiful sight to see
reviews.comment: The falls were amazing. the walk down to the brink of the falls is a long one but well worth it. there were a lot of people but I wouldn't say crowded.

reviews.name: TravelerGEO
reviews.title: Do not miss this place
reviews.comment: This to me is one of the highlights of a visit to Yellowstone. Great views without too much of a walk from the South side. Do not miss this, better than Old Faithfull.

reviews.name: Gina S
reviews.title: Grandest thing I've ever seen!
reviews.comment: This place is massive and grand every which way you look at it. Looking over the guardrail at the expanse of the Grand Canyon is unbelievable, beautiful and breathtaking! The various colors and hues of the canyon add a beautiful element that makes for a dramatic view any time of the day, but it's best to get there early in the day (morning!) to avoid the big crowds. If you have a fear of heights, though, this may not be for you.

reviews.name: Meg S
reviews.title: South Rim
reviews.comment: South rim has walkable views, unlike the North side which is a one-way drive-thru. This beautiful park should be explored on foot, even if it is less than half a mile from your car. Too beautiful to not respect it with a walk.

reviews.name: Linda F
reviews.title: Beautiful Scenery
reviews.comment: We came in from the east side of the park, which was less crowded than the southern entrance. We were at the Grand Canyon in a short time. We saw the lower falls first -- beautiful. And then we drove to the upper falls. We took a trail called 'Uncle Tom's Trail' that consisted of 328 steps down towards the base of the falls. The steps are broken up by paths. It takes quite a while to navigate. The steps are metal and steep. At times, I was holding onto the railing with both hands. At the bottom is a platform with a bench. There are also some benches along the way. There was a bit of a line leading to the platform. You can take some great photos. It was tough walking back up but it was definitely worth it.

reviews.name: Judy J
reviews.title: A magical place, but in summer is definitely crowded and somewhat hurried
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the most spectacular scenic vistas in the USA - Lots of viewpoints offer a variety of views. Uncle Tom's Trail is an experience of 320 steps to offer an up close view of the canyon and falls

reviews.name: mmlfoot
reviews.title: A bucket list item for sure
reviews.comment: This is just so beautiful the pictures don't do it justice. Second only to Niagra Falls as the best waterfall I have seen. Crowds throughout the park weren't nearly as bad as I expected and we managed to find parking places easy enough and everyone was very polite with getting their pictures then getting out of the way.

reviews.name: Mark50
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: Artist Point at the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone holds the most spectacular waterfalls, both upper and lower falls plus the canyon depth is not to be believed. A photographer's paradise.

reviews.name: PatH13
reviews.title: Out of nowhere
reviews.comment: We drove up to the canyons campground and stopped at the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone first. I was totally surprised by how awesome this was. It looks nothing like anything else in the park. We hiked down to the bottom and back. The Canyon campground is right at the falls.

reviews.name: ann p
reviews.title: Breathtaking - a must see
reviews.comment: Absolutely gorgeous scenery. Some strenuous hiking for those who are not hikers, but worth the effort. Enjoyed every moment of the experience

reviews.name: ksmom2Kansas
reviews.title: Highest recommendation!
reviews.comment: This is just beautiful. We drove along the south rim and the north rim, stopping at viewpoints and doing the short hikes. We hiked "Uncle Tom's Trail" and it was spectacular. Definitely put the Canyon on your Yellowstone itinerary.

reviews.name: dunadan
reviews.title: Amazing views, spectacular morning light
reviews.comment:
We started off day two of our Yellowstone adventure making a beeline from West Yellowstone to the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, eventually stopping at all of the major viewpoints, starting with Artist Point.
While AP was my favorite place to view the canyon, you really can't go wrong no matter from what side, angle, or elevation you experience the canyon: it is spectacular regardless of your location. Each vantage point offers different viewing opportunities, and many of them let you see other viewpoints, including ones you were just at less than half an hour ago.

reviews.name: Peggy S
reviews.title: Must see to appreciate
reviews.comment: Beautiful waterfalls, both upper and lower falls plus the canyon colors and depth is amazing. Be prepared to do some walking up and down hills, bring water. The view of the brink of the upper falls was more impressive to me than the lower falls because you are so close.

reviews.name: BQbookkeeping
reviews.title: Amazing views!
reviews.comment: Loved every minute of our trip, even it was raining the entire day. Will be going back for at least a week.

reviews.name: Craig T
reviews.title: Yellow rocks and waterfalls
reviews.comment: An incredibly beautiful valley and you will see why they call this place Yellowstone (hint: rocks are kind of yellowish). Not only is the canyon gorgeous, but you have this amazing waterfall to boot! There are several nice hiking paths that you can take to see the canyon and the falls.

reviews.name: Deborah L
reviews.title: Stunning!
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone is beautiful and worth the visit and dealing with the crowds. A must see!

reviews.name: gaunttj
reviews.title: beautiful. sad inspiration point was closed.
reviews.comment: Go early! We got up early for animal watching at dawn and then headed here. It wasn't busy at all which is really nice when you are trying to enjoy nature.

reviews.name: Conny Bax
reviews.title: Stunning!!
reviews.comment:
In the Yellowstone Park, this is the most wonderful view we had! It's simply astonishing.
Be care of the temperature, cause it may be really cold even in spring (we were there on the 23th May, and the temperature was 2° Celsius, while the weather was snowy!!)

reviews.name: NSP9454
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: Easy access from multiple location. Lower crowds in the early morning and late evening. The lighting at these hours is great and there is s better chance to see animal on your drive or hike

reviews.name: Tanya G
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Breathtaking views. Just beautiful. You won't want too miss this stop. Yellowstone's Grand Canyon may not be as big as The Grand Canyon however it's just as magnificent as the The Grand Canyon. When you watch the waterfall there is a section of the water that flows green. We could have stayed there for hours enjoying nature at its best.

reviews.name: Jim G
reviews.title: Must see if you're in the Park
reviews.comment: First let me start by saying we love to hike so we did the south rim trail to Uncle Tom's trail. If you're not faint of heart it is a little scary walking down the stairs that lead down to the platform 328 steps in all. Just remember you have to climb out. The south rim trail hije is a beautiful mix of meadows, cliff views, geysers and the stairs. You can choose to view the waterfall from Artisans point or do the stairs we chose both and we were amazed at the beauty. We did not see any bears on this hike, however we did see fresh claw marks on the trees. Bring bear spray you can purchase or rent the spray. A must do hike.

reviews.name: AJ&HTraveltheworld
reviews.title: Early Morning Solitude
reviews.comment: We arrived around 07:00 an the car park was empty. We walked to the viewing point and had the area all to ourselves. Sunshine was very bright even at that time so be careful with your photos, but great view and very beautiful spot.

reviews.name: Carlos T
reviews.title: MARVELLOUS SIGTGHS&EASY TRAILS
reviews.comment: One of the best National Parks Canyons, very easy to access, with many trails that allow wonderfull views of the Canyon and the water falls. Beautiful colors of the mountains.

reviews.name: Boogiesmom3
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Go mid morning and check out the sun on the walls of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Artists Point is appropriately named as it looks like a painted picture! Go to the end of the parking lot and skip the first parking area.

reviews.name: Cadyme
reviews.title: We waited to long!
reviews.comment: Should have visited years ago.. Finally did so a wildlife safari, plus Jackson, and Jackson Hole.. Wildlife sightings everywhere, (with a good guide). Even wolves. . A wonderful part of our world, but a little tough to reach..

reviews.name: C_A_L_NoVa
reviews.title: Amazing Natural Beauty
reviews.comment: Everyone should stop and see this natural beautiful waterfall and the canyons it runs through. There seemed to be a hike right to the falls.

reviews.name: Crystal W
reviews.title: Do not miss this!
reviews.comment: This is even more impressive in person! Lower falls is best for viewing and lots more parking! Best when sunlight is shining on the falls!

reviews.name: Yahel_Carlos
reviews.title: Visiting Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Yellowstone is a huge park in the state of Wyoming. It is reccommended to visit yellowstone for few days at least. Nice trails, views, huge kind of wildlife going around cars. Bring hiking shoses, camera and go visit.

reviews.name: Richard F
reviews.title: looks like an artist painted it
reviews.comment: this was just beautiful. It was amazing to see so many people just looking at the waterfall. I think it is a great place for pictures and would recommend it. Lots of people so get there early in the morning.

reviews.name: azinsc
reviews.title: Great Surprise!
reviews.comment: My husband has travelled to many National Parks and he always seems to oversell things and I end up disappointed. This trip to Yellowstone he didn't tell me much of anything... and this turned out to be my favorite attraction! Artist's Pointe was amazing! The steep steps on the other side of the canyon were no joke though!

reviews.name: Al F
reviews.title: Excellent Outdoor Trip within Limits
reviews.comment: We spent three days around the park, and I recommend staying at the park that length to appreciate it without being hurried. The park staff kept the roads clear and accessible, and all the attractions and signs were well marked. the mas and signage were always up to date, and the speed recommendations were quite appropriate. I would recommend that the park should put marked speed bumps warning bumps before the worst curves, but only a negligent driver could have ignored the signs. Be advised: most cell reception falls apart within the park. We stopped at numerous roadside attractions and viewed many geysers. The signage and staff explained in detail science (geology and geography). As standalones, the sites viewing some waterfalls and hillsides are not fully accessible, and had not apparent features for readers needing assistance (poor mobility, blindness). We strongly recommend the Boiling River Spa, even with its limited accessibility. We were pleasantly surprised by the accessibility and proximity to certain wild animals (bison/female moose), although the bears, bighorn sheep, and male moose were conspicuously; absent. I recommend wearing hats in July, and to keep a camera ready as wildlife appear a lot closer to the human activity than expected.

reviews.name: kenrod
reviews.title: great visit
reviews.comment: When in Yellowstone, do not miss out on seeing the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. There are several hiking trails to get an even better view. Some of the trails are for easy or moderate and some trails are more difficult but I would recommend getting off the parking lot and checking at least one of the trails.

reviews.name: Bill H
reviews.title: Outstanding views of a beautiful canyon.
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone was such a surprise the first time we visited the park. I expected the geysers, wildlife and the historical buildings but I had not realized the beauty of The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. My favorite location is Artist Point. On our last trip there was a beautiful rainbow at the base of the falls. Many of the viewpoints are now handicapped accessible.

reviews.name: jackbauerTX
reviews.title: Incredible, but crowded
reviews.comment:
Went here on a Tuesday with the wife, and it was a great time. The great thing about Yellowstone is that you don't have to work hard to see great scenery. It is simply everywhere.
This place offers a breath taking view deep into earth with a roaring river for a back drop. There are multiple places to view this and I would recommend the south rim parking area and a walk east off the asphalt and away from the crowds. There is a great trail that goes to Ribbon Lake that follows the rim for about .5 mile. I would recommend that. For sure
My biggest complaint was crowds. We spent a total of 4 days in Yellowstone and two places were crowded beyond my comfort were the South Rim parking lot and Old Faithful. Try to get away from the crowds and enjoy that absolute gift from God.

reviews.name: 1966Airstream
reviews.title: What a sight!
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is just what is says: a great canyon (rivaling THE Grand Canyon) with a waterfall at one end. It is a wonderful sight. There are parking lots where you can park and then walk to some great viewpoints. Just expect a lot of people because it is one of the more popular sports in Yellowstone.

reviews.name: PMZ
reviews.title: Beautiful and well worth the hike!
reviews.comment: Definitely rings true, it is the GC of Yellowstone. Much smaller but just as beautiful and yellow. Who knew.

reviews.name: Jason Wood
reviews.title: Unbelievable View
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is perhaps one the the greatest sites in Yellowstone Park. Pictures do not do it justice to see with your own eyes. It looks so great and unbelievable that at first glance it is surreal that it is a wonder of nature. Amazing spot to check out and a good hike to get to the view!

reviews.name: Mimi_Ann2013
reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.comment: A must see on the Yellowstone trip. The "painted" rock is a beautiful vista. The grandeur of the waterfall is breath taking.

reviews.name: Keith W
reviews.title: Bucket list
reviews.comment: Jaw-dropping scenery. Take time to wander the various trails. The views are magnificent from every angle and a photographer's dream. Pretty hot in the Summer so take plenty of water Prop better in the Autumn

reviews.name: sugarspice5
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: There are many hiking trails to enjoy the breathtaking views of the Canyons. You can also see fall from both purer and lower rim trails and both are spectacular.

reviews.name: pbuntarl
reviews.title: Natural Wonder
reviews.comment: This is one of the most beautiful sites in Yellowstone. While not as grand as the Grand Canyon Arizona, it contains 2 beautiful waterfalls with viewing platforms and the ability to see them from different angles. The canyon itself is awe inspiring!

reviews.name: Swati J
reviews.title: Spectacular views must do activity in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Ample parking, short walk from parking lot. Totally worth watching the view of Yellowstone river, the falls from the view points. If you have enough time you can do south rim or north rim trail otherwise just drive to the points and take a look. This is a must do activity in Yellowstone stone. If you have limited time stop only the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone, Lower fall view and upper fall view. These All 3 things can be done in an hour.

reviews.name: SamSofnNad
reviews.title: So many amazing sights
reviews.comment: So many things to see and do. This one is worth the stop. great view of the falls. easy walk for a great canyon.

reviews.name: Happycak
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: We spent four days in Yellowstone Park. One of the many spectacular places we visited was the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. The walk down to the falls is easy and not too strenuous. However going back up can be a little demanding. You may need to stop to catch your breathe but the view of the canyon and falls is so worth it!

reviews.name: Bubba1202
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: You can't come to Yellowstone with out allocating at least 1/2 day to this area. Between the upper and lower falls, artist point, uncle toms trail and canyon gift shop (the best in the park) and the canteen... this is the best area in Yellowstone

reviews.name: JoAnn h
reviews.title: The most beautiful part of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: Be sure to drive through the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. Spectacular waterfalls and the yellow stone cliffs that give the part its name.

reviews.name: Jeff S
reviews.title: Plan on at least 2 days to see the wonders.
reviews.comment: We entered through the east gate and went counter clockwise around the great loop and reached the north gate late afternoon. We returned through the north gate and made it to the east gate (again late in the day) We were able to visit most (?) places. REMEMBER, the signs that say 25mph are not suggestions. Top speed is 45 but hardly every went that fast. There are numerous turnouts for picnics, photos and the like, but some people still stop in the middle of the road for selfies.

reviews.name: Devin E
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: Amazed views of the raw power of the natural world. The views are inspiring and I see something new every time! Come early or late - this is a popular spot and is very busy!

reviews.name: Teachtravellearn
reviews.title: Beautiful! Must see!
reviews.comment: Don't miss this even if you have a short time to spend at Yellowstone NP! You can not imagine the amount and Fores of the water!

reviews.name: Matthew P
reviews.title: A Spectacular, Must-See
reviews.comment: This was likely our favorite stop in the entire park. There is a spectacular view of the entire canyon at the lower falls vantage point that will not disappoint. If you want good pictures, make sure you go in the morning as he sun will illuminate the falls.

reviews.name: Ginny067
reviews.title: Totally awesome
reviews.comment: A really inspiring sight. There were other tourists there, but it didn't feel crowded. We went in the morning.

reviews.name: Diane W
reviews.title: Waterfalls
reviews.comment: I love water falls and this did not disappoint. The views are spectacular with of eagles soaring and nesting near viewpoints.

reviews.name: bc042016
reviews.title: Beautiful location
reviews.comment: This could be argued to be the most beautiful place in the park.. Artist Point is so appropriately named. We photographed rainbows at both the lower and higher falls on this trip

reviews.name: Phillip G
reviews.title: Very impressive sight
reviews.comment: The canyon looks like it is between 1000 and 2000 deep. There are multiple vistas of the falls, the canyon walls and the outflow. Expect to see lots of other people. It has a good sized parking lot.

reviews.name: Okielady32
reviews.title: This Is Really Yellowstone!!!
reviews.comment: If you go to the park without seeing the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone, then you haven't really been to Yellowstone. This place is breath taking, and you will never tire of visiting or looking at this majestic place. There are two waterfalls that empty in to the awe inspiring canyon - Upper and Lower Falls of the Yellowstone. You can walk (trails) to both of these falls, and you must DO this. In fact, there are several other places along the canyon that are famous for viewing the canyon. In addition to the falls, make sure you take Uncle Tom's Trails (really a stair case that goes in to the canyon), and Artist Point and Inspiration Point. I encourage you to visit these points before 9:30 am or after 5 pm to avoid the tour buses that will dump large numbers of people at once making it difficult to take photos of the beautiful scenery. Carry water with you at all times. There are also plenty of restrooms around most of these points. In fact, there is a large, modern restroom facility before you take Uncle Tom's Trail. We stayed at the Canyon Lodge (we loved it) and visited the canyon every day for four days. We never tired of it.

reviews.name: Bobbi S
reviews.title: Breathtaking
reviews.comment: Just one of the fabulous places one must see in Yellowstone. The colors of the walls were beautiful and the depth was something hard to imagine.

reviews.name: Ann W
reviews.title: Stunning!!!!
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and its waterfalls is absolutely stunning.
We did both rims and a number of the hikes.
Not to be missed!

reviews.name: Posie C
reviews.title: Awsome
reviews.comment: Visited during a light rain . The view was spectacular. We saw an osprey nest with al least three chicks.

reviews.name: indiequeen182
reviews.title: WOW WOW WOW
reviews.comment: Spent two full 8 hour days in park and the Grand Canyon is easily in my top three favorite sights in the park. Absolutely incredible.

reviews.name: Bill C
reviews.title: This is one of the things you come here for
reviews.comment:
I hadn't been here since 1977. Memories fade and now I remember how gorgeous this place is.
Don't be rushed, there are lots of views and lots of sounds to here.

reviews.name: CASEY T
reviews.title: Arrive early (by 9 am) and get a half mile down the trail
reviews.comment:
These two actions assure you get a parking place and feel like you have left the crowds behind.
The North Rim in particular is people crazy in the afternoon so start your day there. Decide which stop is the most interesting and make that your starting point. Do everything including any hiking that can take you a half mile from the parking lot. You will shed people like a mink coat.
The South Rim is less populated with fewer stops. It offers every bit as much amazing stuff as the North Rim just fewer places to check it out.
Plan a full day in the Canyon area. Don't miss the soda counter in the General Store in the Canyon developed area. Its a so fun 50s authentic experience (except for the prices and the "earth friendly" throw away serving "dishes").

reviews.name: Kotaylor5
reviews.title: Worth the steep hike down
reviews.comment: This powerful waterfall is really worth the steep walk down to it, I promise! If you've been to the Grand Canyon, you'll soon see how aptly named it is.

reviews.name: Marty N
reviews.title: Colors Magnificent
reviews.comment: So pretty and easy to see. On the South Rim Drive. Falls were worth the drive but canyon, Wow! Variety of colors. Glad we went.

reviews.name: Samantha D
reviews.title: Great views. Easy access.
reviews.comment: This is an exceptional view. You will definitely need your camera. The access is easy for all levels of physical ability. Ramps are available for the disabled.

reviews.name: Rich B
reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.comment: Not as great as the Grand Canyon but for where you are at it is incredible. The views are incredible.

reviews.name: cdhoag
reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.comment: The waterfall and yellow mountains surrounding it are breathtaking. A truly amazing place with various hikes and view points, providing the perfect area for exploration.

reviews.name: larry e
reviews.title: Beatiful Awesome Views
reviews.comment: I visited with my wife and sons (aged 18 and 16). Very scenic. A little bit of hiking is required (like a 5 minute walk) with some stairs so be aware but if you do not have a significant mobility issue, it will not be a problem. If you hike down a bit, you get a better view of the falls. There are at least two type of viewing platforms. There were also some trails that would allow more hiking along the river. We did not have time to explore these but they looked pretty cool. If you come to the park, this is a must-see.

reviews.name: Theresa M
reviews.title: Uncle Toms' Trail
reviews.comment: Get ready for the steps, steps and more steps. And if you're afraid of heights, there are some portions of the stairs that could have you questioning your decision to do the hike.

reviews.name: Pickypickypickyman
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: Absolutely breathtaking. Suggest that you read up on the history of the canyon before you go. It can get busy in late morning and early afternoon. Bring binoculars and s camera with s wide-angle lense and zoom.

reviews.name: Naughty-Cougar
reviews.title: Amazing...
reviews.comment:
A breathtaking landscape, almost surreal.
Breathtaking views.
Recommended all the trails, S.Rim Trail and Uncle Tom`s Trail until the Artist Point.
For those unwilling to walk too, small visit to the Upper Falls parking at S.Trim Trail and then with a car get to the parking lot at the top of Artist Point.

reviews.name: Happyrocker
reviews.title: Worth the hassle
reviews.comment: Yellowstone gets busy as the day wears on, and we didn't get to the Grand Canyon area until early afternoon. Traffic and parking get tight, but it was well worth the stop. We've been to the real Grand Canyon on Arizona, and while Yellowstone is much, much smaller, it has an intimacy lacking at the big one. From the observation areas you can see the colors in the rocks, and the effects of the water as it has created the canyon. Worth the drive and the stop.

reviews.name: Stephen O
reviews.title: Must see this canyon and waterfalls
reviews.comment: This is one of the spots in yellowstone that you should try to stop by and see. The canyon and waterfalls can be seen by driving up to the parking lots on the North rim, and taking a 5 minute stroll. Bring your camera.

reviews.name: Cathy u
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: We parked at both of the parking lots and hiked the uncle Tom's trail and down to the waterfall. Both were a little bit challenging to get back up, but our eight and 10-year-old did it just fine. So beautiful, definitely worth it! Go later in the evening or earlyto try to avoid the crowds

reviews.name: SheilaMcEntire
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment:
I highly recommend taking the Uncle Tom's Trail to the bottom on Canyon Falls and taking the trail or going to the Artist's Point stop. The Uncle Tom's Trail has metal stairs going down to a spot where you can get an awesome view of the waterfall. I even got a picture of the falls with a double rainbow!
Artist Point lets you see some beautiful area of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. There are so many colors! You will want to take lots of pictures!

reviews.name: Voice1234
reviews.title: Incredible!
reviews.comment: There are no words to describe the beauty of the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. You have to see it! I've seen many waterfalls, but nothing of this magnitude! Absolutely incredible!

reviews.name: meiravl
reviews.title: Beautiful
reviews.comment: The rock formations are beautiful. If you're able, be sure to hike sown to the lower falls. It's worth it.

reviews.name: Slava K
reviews.title: Must see
reviews.comment: I don't think you can visit the Yellowstone National Park without seeing the Grand Canyon. There are plenty of overlooks to look at it from different sides, and if you have plenty of times, visit them all.

reviews.name: mkjava
reviews.title: Wow, Best View in Yellowstone
reviews.comment: There are lots of places along the way to see the canyon and falls, but it's worth it to drive to Artists Point and walk down the short trail to the main viewpoint. One of the most breathtaking vistas that I've ever seen.

reviews.name: JoAnn P
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: The views of the falls were amazing. We viewed from Artists point. It was super busy when we were there (around noon). It's fascinating to see how the geography of the park can be so varied. We also stopped to view the smaller waterfall but the larger was was much more grand. There are walking trails also here.

reviews.name: Edward B
reviews.title: Most wondrous part of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: I thought this was the most wondrous part of the whole park. Just beautiful and powerful. Very much enjoyed.

reviews.name: bobbyfdny
reviews.title: I thought I was in heaven
reviews.comment: I saw some of the most beautiful sights in my life at this place. The water falls and canyon was something you have to see to believe. No photograph can do it justice. The fact that I had great weather was a plus for me. If this isn't on your bucket list it should be.

reviews.name: Tracy F
reviews.title: Beautiful!
reviews.comment: Worth the visit. Breathtaking views. Steep trail to the bottom of the canyon. The overlook provides a beautiful view without the hike.

reviews.name: Lareson
reviews.title: Stellar!
reviews.comment: What a gorgeous place!!! You really should try to walk between the overlooks. Get there early if it's a nice day because the parking is difficult and if there are big busses that equals masses of people. We were there on a cloudy rainy/snowy (yes, in July) day the first time and had the place to ourselves

reviews.name: saltedradish
reviews.title: Visit early
reviews.comment: We found by getting an early start in the mornings we could find parking and get great views without many crowds. Beautiful area. Great views.

reviews.name: Mosslady53🌴
reviews.title: Yellowstone and Glacier 2016 trip
reviews.comment: My son and I were back to Yellowstone this year and stopped by for views of the Grand Canyon. Look for a rainbow at the Falls.

reviews.name: Haswell4
reviews.title: Absolute must see
reviews.comment: This is absolutely the most beautiful part of the park. It is well worth the drive to see it. Parking was tight but not as bad as old faithful or prismatic springs. Many access points from either side. We only did the southern side from south rim drive. But I can't imagine the northern side being any more beautiful. Of all of the parts of the park we saw, this was my favorite.

reviews.name: clynchGreenvilleSC
reviews.title: Our Beautiful Country So Proud
reviews.comment: This is one of the most beautiful views in Yellowstone. We should all thank our park system and those responsible for their upkeep for such a fantastic job. Advise everyone to go see this beautiful spot.

reviews.name: Joe N
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment:
The Grand Canyon of Yellowstone was one of the top 3 places to visit in the park, next to Old Faithful and the Grand Prismatic Springs.
There are multiple trails on the North and South rims; take the time to hike the trails to the edge for the best views.

reviews.name: KansasTraveler156
reviews.title: Not to be missed
reviews.comment: My family spent time on both the north and south sides of the canyon. On the north side, there is a trail with switchbacks that leads down to the head of the lower falls. The trail is steep and requires some physical exertion, but the views are well worth the effort. The colors of the canyon are spectacular in the sunlight. Don't miss!

reviews.name: RSGuy
reviews.title: Take a hike
reviews.comment: Recommend taking the south rim trail with, if you're up to it, Uncle Tom's trail to the lower falls. The view is well worth the struggle to get back up all those stairs.

reviews.name: Roy J
reviews.title: Excellent beauty
reviews.comment: it was awesome experience to drive around Yellow stone... Every point give us breath breaking experience ...want to see again

reviews.name: William C
reviews.title: My group visit to Grand Canyon of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: On 7/5 on a group tour. We stopped at Grand Canyon Yellowstone . What a beautiful place. I really enjoyed myself,thank you

reviews.name: Christina E
reviews.title: Beautiful stop!
reviews.comment: We hiked the trail to the top of lower falls. While the view of the falls isn't best here, the canyon is amazing. Warning - it's a steep walk. Take your time and use careful footing.

reviews.name: palladia
reviews.title: Very pretty
reviews.comment:
People sometimes ask me, why is Yellowstone called that way. Are stones yellow there? Having been to Yellowstone several times before, but never visited the Grand Canyon area, I always just said that I had no idea.
Well, now that I've been there, I can say that the cliffs in this area is indeed yellow, and perhaps that's why the river and park are named that way?
There are roads and view points that line both side of the canyon. There are several water falls, but due to geography, you can't see more than one fall from a single view point. Some view points also require slight hikes, so plan accordingly.
We didn't go to the north side this time. But I must say that the lower fall is a lot prettier, and you must visit Artist Point if you don't mind walking a little bit. The views are awesome, and worth the effort.
It's not as deep or expansive as Grand Canyon N.P., but the canyon itself is nevertheless quite pretty. As I mentioned, the yellow-colored cliff is something unique.
Definitely worth a stop here.

reviews.name: Bentelrab
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: The most beautiful place in the park. looks a lot like the grand canyon, even better with the view of the falls. The canyon village is a great place to have lunch.

reviews.name: Love2travelHank
reviews.title: Wicked views
reviews.comment: There is a large parking area and this is a very popular stopping point. There is a short and not difficult walkway to the viewing area. Quite a sight and worth 5he stop. There was an Osprey nest visible when I was there wi5h two chick's in the nest.

reviews.name: K4B
reviews.title: Beautiful spot
reviews.comment: If you like stunning natural beauty, waterfalls and nice walks you'll love this. There is a lovely mile to mile and half walk between the top of the falls and artists point which is great, moderate ability only. There is also a stairway to lower down the falls which is great on the way down but certainly gets you heavy breathing on the way back up!

reviews.name: mrliterature
reviews.title: Just Gorgeous
reviews.comment: There are so many little places to stop, hike, and see this canyon. Give yourself time, and take advantage of seeing the canyon from both the north and south rims. I love this place, and I've loved it for years.

reviews.name: Anthony
reviews.title: Great Classic View
reviews.comment: Great landscape! Easy access off the main road. Some views do require a bit of a hike, but not too bad.

reviews.name: William B
reviews.title: Spent a couple of days on the west side of Yellowstone
reviews.comment: We spent a couple of days on the west side of Yellowstone so the Grand Canyon was on our map. Beautiful area and the canyon of coarse is a must see. Nice place to stop and smell the roses. ( none) What a site as I've now been to The Grand canyon, Litchfield State Park N.Y. (little grand canyon) of the east wow, and now this what a collection of memories.

reviews.name: AZ_85203
reviews.title: Highlight of my trip!
reviews.comment:
Knowing that we basically had an afternoon and morning in Yellowstone, I did a lot of research and seeing the falls of Grand Canyon was first on my list of things to do. I knew that I wanted to go to Artist point and see them. It did not disappoint. It was one of the most breathtaking things I have seen. If you only see them from one spot, this is the one to do it in.
There is plenty of parking, and it is a short walk to the falls. There are stairs, and I don't remember if there is a ramp for wheelchairs or not.

reviews.name: haveboozewilltravel
reviews.title: Spectacular & Awesome
reviews.comment: We generally stay at Canyon Village on our trips to Yellowstone, so I am aware of most of the trails & viewpoints. On the north rim road I would recommend the walk down to the brink of the Lower Falls, Lookout Point & Inspiration Point. The finest viewpoint however is on the south rim road at Artist's Point.

reviews.name: Hun09
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment:
There is so much to see in Yellowstone, and the canyon is one of the highlights. All very walkable from the car park.
Get there as early as possible to avoid the hoards of people.
We practically had the place to ourselves at 7.30am

reviews.name: NoFo
reviews.title: Fabulous view
reviews.comment: This was one of the most beautiful stops of our Wyoming vacation. It is a don't miss site. The best view is at the top of the stairs.

reviews.name: Judy g
reviews.title: Beautiful view
reviews.comment: Gorgeous view of the falls totally worth seeing, you'll get some nice photos. Try to see all attractions in the morning, afternoons are much more crowded.

reviews.name: Kimberly K
reviews.title: Just had to see
reviews.comment: We traveled through Yellowstone this past week therefore, 3rd week in June. As far as I'm concerned the best part of our trip was seeing the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. There are beautiful waterfalls great little hikes to the water falls (strenuous but a must)! We were camping and almost didn't find a place twice while traveling through. The Rangers and all the staff of Yellowstone were extra nice! It was already busy while we were there....I would hate to try and travel in a couple of weeks....

reviews.name: notacouchpotato
reviews.title: Stunning vistas
reviews.comment: We were lucky that the day we visited the canyon was in bright and blue sky sunshine and the timing as the snow melted fantastic for the power of the waterfalls. There are convenient viewing points around the canyon, many of which are accessible for wheelchairs. A beautiful experience.

reviews.name: Ben T
reviews.title: Awesome, Highlight of 3 days in Yellowstone Park
reviews.comment: I have been to Yellowstone three times and this is by far the best item to see in the park. Yes, visit Old Faithful and the Upper Geyser Basin for 3 hours to check that off your list, but for true beauty this is the spot. You have to go down a bunch of stairs to get to the viewing area, but it is very manageable and worth the trip. Great picture opportunity.

reviews.name: RAP326
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: If I had known just how great this park was I would have put it on my bucket list. It had amazing canyons, valleys , falls , geysers and springs to name a few . And then there were the animals all over. We saw many bison and wolves, our favorite parts. Was hoping to see a bear, but no look. This is a must see.

reviews.name: josephlouise
reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Going downhill was easy but coming up was a different story. Long climb and had to take a few breaks to get my breath back, but I would do it again if I could. The canyon is awesome along with the waterfall. It is nature at its best.

reviews.name: Jeffreysgirl2009
reviews.title: Beautiful View!
reviews.comment: I can't imagine how pretty this would have been at sunrise or sunset because we hit it up mid-day & it was gorgeous! There are plenty of trails leading to this canyon, so choose the one you wish & go with your camera. You will be stunned!

reviews.name: jill l
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
reviews.comment: Yu can't even imagine how beautiful and majestic this is until you visit and walk around. A must see!

reviews.name: Jim M
reviews.title: Huge Waterfall, Great Photo Opp.
reviews.comment:
There is a beautiful waterfall at the top of the canyon. The waterfall and the varied colors of the canyon wall make for some very interesting pictures. There are walkways on both the north and south side of the canyon. The experience is different enough that I would recommend doing both the north and the south.
On the south side of the canyon there is an observation point called Lookout Point. This location offers a great view of the canyon and also you can look down on an osprey nest that is in active use.

reviews.name: PWTinTN
reviews.title: Grand Canyon of Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
The beauty you’ll see at the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone makes the hike worth it. However, as a warning, it you have bad knees, and tire easily it may be a bit strenuous (be prepared). There were those who had to carry their children back up.
We started with the North rim, the pictures don’t do it justice. First to the upper Falls, Lookout Point, and then the Grand View. Afterwards, we did the South rim. Old Faithful is nice, but, the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone needs equal billing.

reviews.name: terry m
reviews.title: awesome animals.
reviews.comment: two different bison came rt. to our car! any elk in herd. fascinating volcano results. 3 day stay about rt.

reviews.name: delois m
reviews.title: Stunning Views!
