reviews.comment: This is a don't miss while in Yellowstone. Beautiful views and very easy to access and see everything without too much hiking or walking. Be prepared to wait in line for a while for the 2 toilets that are available for all the people visiting this popular site.

reviews.name: EdinOKC
reviews.title: Best of Show
reviews.comment: We thought that Old Faithful would be our favorite. But we were wrong. Even with mist and rain and strong wind, we would have gone back a third time if we thought we would finally have had some sunshine. As an amateur artist, I really appreciated the colors of the canyon walls. And I finally understood why it is called Yellowstone. As with most spots in the park, parking is a little bit of a problem. (Of course, since it was misting/raining, it was not much of a problem the days we were actually there.) So after seeing Old Faithful, this is the next "must see," and you will probably enjoy it even more than Old Faithful because it doesn't go away for an hour and a half!

reviews.name: Whichway2thebeach40
reviews.title: Rainbow at falls
reviews.comment: Go between 9:45 and 10 am for rainbow in June/July (check with rangers for time. Time may be different depending on the position of the sun)

reviews.name: pooh-sheryl
reviews.title: Awesome view
reviews.comment: After walking down to the falls top ridge, go up to the Grand Canyon view to see the whole area. It was an awesome view. We took the north rim side. The south rim side has steps.

reviews.name: mbungay
reviews.title: A Must See In Yellowstone
reviews.comment:
I loved the geysers and hot springs but I think seeing the lower falls from the bottom was my favorite. It's definitely worth all the steps and while we needed to stop for breaks with my twin 6 year old boys, it was not that hard.
A stop at the Canyon Village afterward for some ice cream wasn't bad either!

reviews.name: Chris W
reviews.title: MAGNIFICENT
reviews.comment: One of the most beautiful sites on earth... the upper falls and the lower falls... the colored rocks!!! MAGNIFICENT!

reviews.name: jkumpon
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: Be sure to take Uncle Tom's trail to get a close up view of the falls (although it is a somewhat strenuous hike on metal stairs and a bit nerve-wracking for those with height phobias). We also had a black bear wonder in front of us as we started this path!

reviews.name: Nicholas H
reviews.title: Colorful and breathtaking
reviews.comment: A good way to view this canyon is from the lookouts along the north and south rim drives and hikes near Canyon Village. Beautiful streaks of color run down the rocks to the blue green river at the bottom

reviews.name: RudySzymon
reviews.title: Sunset view, WOW
reviews.comment: We had plenty of time to stop at all view points on both rims of the canyon. With sun coming down, the colors of the rocks was changing all the time.

reviews.name: Netteheideman
reviews.title: Amazing waterfalls!
reviews.comment:
Overlooks are fantastic! Hikes to spectacular views are relatively short, but they are steep. Uncle Toms Cabin trail was awesome, but not for the faint of heart. Steep stairs suspended high up. Well worth it!
Also hiked the South Rim. Red Rock trail was steep, but amazing! Very short. Then did the Brink of the lower falls. Gorgeous the entire hike. Most amazing scenery.
Loved every minute.

reviews.name: Cortnee_Speckel
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: Definitely go in the afternoon to early morning g there are trails that you should take the upperfalls have a great veiw. This is definitely a full day thing to do

reviews.name: AlisonandColin
reviews.title: Stunning
reviews.comment: We hiked both the north and south rims. South rim, from Uncle Tom's parking lot to Point Sublime, was the more stunning walk with awesome views of the Canyon.

reviews.name: angie t
reviews.title: The view is excellent !~
reviews.comment: Do not forget your camera ~! The photo opportunities are endless and spectacular. Make sure you have plenty of fresh batteries as well.

reviews.name: MITravelwriter
reviews.title: Delightful
reviews.comment: Watch for nesting osprey. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds and watch the early morning fog dissipate. The trail is beautiful with great views. It might be too high for some travelers.

reviews.name: Jessica H
reviews.title: Fantastic view!
reviews.comment: I can't believe how amazing the canyon was! Lots of photo opportunities and beautiful views!! Nicely paved paths and overlooks.

reviews.name: Jennifer G
reviews.title: Amazing Colors
reviews.comment: Our pictures will never do this site justice. We were amazed at the colors and grandeur. We also visited the upper falls. It was amazing to see the power of the water as it fell over the land.

reviews.name: Big_bro_1_usa
reviews.title: Spectacular!
reviews.comment:
PROS: awe-inspiring sight! Beautiful lower falls and rushing Upper falls! Brink to the Lower Falls and Inspiration Point currently closed for the season. Amazing lookouts!
CONs: none. Need to be seen to be believed.

reviews.name: Joanna E
reviews.title: This was an amazing site.
reviews.comment: I husband and I really love the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone. The waterfall was amazing. I highly recommend this for anyone going to Yellowstone. It is really a must! It was probably my favorite sightseeing location that we had there.

reviews.name: HokieGal
reviews.title: Our Favorite View
reviews.comment: There are many places to go to view this spectacular piece of Yellowstone. See them all....the brink of the Lower Falls and Artists Point were our favorites. Great photo op which I'm now having blown up into a beautiful wall hanging.

reviews.name: Indianagogirl
reviews.title: Great Morning Visit
reviews.comment: We hit this highlight fairly early in the morning and arrived just before a big tourist bus. Be prepared for crowds, but the views and hikes are lovely. If we could only be at every major site in Yellowstone in the morning or evening! :)

reviews.name: tntraveler62
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.comment: What a jewel of a place. We took the hike from the lower falls to the upper fallls and Artist's Point. The trail follows along the canyon. The beauty here is amazing.

reviews.name: Shunjie L
reviews.title: Beautiful views
reviews.comment: There are some trails from both North and South Rim Drives. It is nice to try all those trails. But if your time is limited, I recommend the South Rim Drive trails. It is a 2-mile round trip, from Uncle Tom's Trail to Artist Point. The best time to avoid the crowd is the morning before 10:00am or the late afternoon.

reviews.name: Skylance
reviews.title: Great views
reviews.comment: We stopped here to admire the views during our stay. Unfortunately, we only had a limited amount of time, so could not fully explore it. Our visit was far beyond expectations

reviews.name: Darlene H
reviews.title: Breathtaking!
reviews.comment: This area is beautiful, vast, breathtaking and a must to see while in the area. With all the cars and lines sometimes we want to just keep driving to the next site. But stop and take a look. You won't regret it. It's so gorgeous and the pictures are great!

reviews.name: jtaylor924
reviews.title: Awesome canyon and falls
reviews.comment: The view of this fall was awesome, the roar of the water combined with the late afternoon sunlight on the falls was awesome. The formations in the canyon walls were also very pretty.

reviews.name: Keith T
reviews.title: Impressive, see the waterfall
reviews.comment: Liked the Canyon as it was very narrow and provided some great photographs. Even better if you can take the short hike down to see the waterfall. It's a little steep but if you can manage is worth the walk.

reviews.name: George Y
reviews.title: Evenings are great
reviews.comment: The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the most picturesque places in the world. Alot of our pictures just look fake since the view is so beautiful. I suggest going in the evenings as there are ALOT less people, and you can enjoy the hikes and views in more peace.
